original: @115b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @115b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'a rya manydzu shr'i n'a ma sam ga'i ti t'i k'a /
analyzed: a'a rya manydzu shr'i n'a ma sam ga'i ti t'i k'a /
translated: Ārya-mañjuśrī-nāma-saṃgīti-tīkā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher bshad pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gyi mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i rgya cher bshad pa /
translated: The Extensive Explanation of the True Words of the Noble Mañjuśrī

original: gsung gi mnga' bdag 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: gsung gi mnga' bdag 'jam dpal ye shes sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to Mañjuśrī, the wisdom being, the lord of speech.

original: mchog tu dri med blo yi rnam ba kun mkhyen gzod nas zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: mchog tu dri med blo yi rnam ba kun mkhyen gzod nas zhi ba'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: The one with a completely stainless mind, omniscient, the essence of primordial peace,

original: sna tshogs sems can don rnams 'byor pas che ba gsal 'gyur mtshan rnams yang dag brjod //
analyzed: sna tshogs sems can don rnams 'byor pas che ba gsal 'gyur mtshan rnams yang dag brjod //
translated: The one with the qualities of the various perfections, the one who benefits beings, the one who is clear and vast, the one with the true words,

original: rang bzhin zhi brnyes rdzogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' yon tan mnyam med pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhi brnyes rdzogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' yon tan mnyam med pa //
translated: The one who has attained the nature of peace, the perfect Buddha, the Bodhisattva, the one with incomparable qualities,

original: gzod nas grangs 'das kyis gsungs de yi mtshan rnams dbye 'dir bdag gis bri par bya //
analyzed: gzod nas grangs 'das kyis gsungs de yi mtshan rnams dbye 'dir bdag gis bri par bya //
translated: The one who is primordially beyond number, the one who is spoken of, I will write about his qualities here.

original: ngag gi spyod yul kun las 'das //
analyzed: ngag gi spyod yul kun las 'das //
translated: Beyond all objects of speech,

original: mtshan rnams kun gyi yon tan ldan //
analyzed: mtshan rnams kun gyi yon tan ldan //
translated: Endowed with the qualities of all the characteristics,

original: tshig rje dang bas rab btud de /
analyzed: tshig rje dang bas rab btud de /
translated: With words of respect and devotion,

original: de'i mtshan don ni rnam par dbye //
analyzed: de'i mtshan don ni rnam par dbye //
translated: The meaning of its name is “analysis.”

original: bla ma'i man dag las brgyud cing //🔽sna tshogs rgyud don mthong ba dang // pha rol phyin pa kun ldan pa'i //
analyzed: bla ma'i man dag las brgyud cing // sna tshogs rgyud don mthong ba dang // pha rol phyin pa kun ldan pa'i //
translated: It is transmitted from the guru,🔽and it is seen in the various tantras,🔽and in the meaning of the Mo’i sde

original: mod sde'i don rnams mthong ba las //
analyzed: mod sde'i don rnams mthong ba las //
translated: that is endowed with all the perfections.

original: nus pa kun dang rnam bral yang //
analyzed: nus pa kun dang rnam bral yang //
translated: Even though one is completely devoid of ability,

original: bdag nyid dran par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag nyid dran par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to remind oneself,

original: rnam par 'byed la 'gal med de //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed la 'gal med de //
translated: there is no contradiction in analyzing,

original: gzhan gyi don du'ang dgag pa med /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du'ang dgag pa med /
translated: and there is no prohibition for the sake of others.

original: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis dga'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan mchog tu dad pas bskal pa 'am bskal pa las lhag par brjod na bsod nams kyi phung po ji tsam rab tu skye🔽bar 'gyur @116a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis dga'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mtshan mchog tu dad pas bskal pa 'am bskal pa las lhag par brjod na bsod nams kyi phung po ji tsam rab tu skye bar 'gyur @116a * //
translated: “Son of a good family or daughter of a good family, if someone were to recite the names of the tathāgatas, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, with supreme faith for an eon or more than an eon, how much merit would be produced?

original: zhe na ; de la ni grangs med cing tshad med pa rab tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe na ; de la ni grangs med cing tshad med pa rab tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be produced immeasurably and boundlessly.

original: yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes mtshan bzung na snga ma las 'di nyid bsod nams kyi phung po shin tu mang po rab tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang la la zhig gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes mtshan bzung na snga ma las 'di nyid bsod nams kyi phung po shin tu mang po rab tu skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, any son or daughter of good family who recites the name of Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, will generate a heap of merit far greater than the previous one.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the spiritual friend of limitless tathāgatas.

original: de yang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas dga'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang por byang chub tu thugs bskyed pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de yang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas dga'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dang por byang chub tu thugs bskyed pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: Moreover, Mañjuśrī, the youthful one, has caused the bhagavān buddhas, as numerous as the grains of sand in the Gaṅgā river, to generate the mind of awakening for the first time, and so forth.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rim gyis sangs rgyas nyid la rab tu gzhag pas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas yang dag par bsngags pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi rim gyis sangs rgyas nyid la rab tu gzhag pas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas yang dag par bsngags pa gsungs pa la /
translated: He has gradually established them in buddhahood through the perfections such as generosity and so forth. The bhagavān Śākyamuni has praised him.

original: la la dag ci 'di dag don ji lta ba nyid yin nam /
analyzed: la la dag ci 'di dag don ji lta ba nyid yin nam /
translated: Some may wonder, “Are these statements true to the meaning?

original: yang na gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir bstod par mdzad pa yin zhes rnam par rtog pa skye ste /
analyzed: yang na gus pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir bstod par mdzad pa yin zhes rnam par rtog pa skye ste /
translated: Or, in order to generate respect, he praises him.

original: rnam par rtog pa de bsal zhing bzlog pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de bsal zhing bzlog pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to dispel and reverse that conception, he says “thereupon” and so forth.

original: yang na dam tshig dang sngags dang phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'i le'u la sogs pa thams cad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i bsngags pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang na dam tshig dang sngags dang phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa'i le'u la sogs pa thams cad du bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i bsngags pa gsungs te /
translated: Or, in all the chapters on entering into the commitments, mantras, seals, and meditative stabilizations, the Blessed One praises Mañjuśrī the Youth.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi bdag nyid kyi sngags dang phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid dang gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi bdag nyid kyi sngags dang phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor gyi lha thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bdag nyid dang gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid
translated: The essence of all the mantras, seals, and deities of the maṇḍala, which is the nature of the qualities of all the buddhas, is the nature of the dharmakāya, saṃbhogakāya, and nirmāṇakāya, which is nondual with the nature of all the buddhas.

original: ni 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'o zhes gsungs kyi rang bzhin ni ma bstan to zhes som nyi dang bcas pa rnams kyi sems la sems kyis yongs su rtog pa phyag na rdo rjes mkhyen nas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ni 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'o zhes gsungs kyi rang bzhin ni ma bstan to zhes som nyi dang bcas pa rnams kyi sems la sems kyis yongs su rtog pa phyag na rdo rjes mkhyen nas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Vajrapāṇi, knowing with his mind the mental thoughts of those with doubts, spoke the following in order to teach that:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Then, and so forth.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das bdag nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i sems can dpag tu med pa'i don gyi bya ba don yod par mkhyen nas gsol ba 'debs par bya ba'i phyir phyag na rdo rje la gzigs par gyur te /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das bdag nyid kyis ma 'ongs pa'i sems can dpag tu med pa'i don gyi bya ba don yod par mkhyen nas gsol ba 'debs par bya ba'i phyir phyag na rdo rje la gzigs par gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the Bhagavān, knowing that the activity for the sake of immeasurable future sentient beings would be meaningful, looked at Vajrapāṇi in order to make a request.

original: de nas de'i 'og tu phyag na rdo rjes zhus pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la @116b sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas de'i 'og tu phyag na rdo rjes zhus pa'i phyir de nas zhes bya ba la @116b sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Then, after that, in order to request, Then, and so forth.

original: yang na ting nge 'dzin gyi dra ba'i le'ur dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gsungs nas /
analyzed: yang na ting nge 'dzin gyi dra ba'i le'ur dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gsungs nas /
translated: Or, having taught the distinctions of the samādhis of the maṇḍala deities in the chapter on the net of samādhis,

original: de'i 'og tu skabs rnyed pa dang ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i mtshan nye bar bstan par bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu skabs rnyed pa dang ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i mtshan nye bar bstan par bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to explain the teaching of the name of the youthful Mañjuśrī, the essence of all meditative stabilizations, when the opportunity arises,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Then,” and so on.

original: de bas na de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni de ma thag par rab tu sbyar gyi bkra shis pa la sogs par blta bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de nas zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni de ma thag par rab tu sbyar gyi bkra shis pa la sogs par blta bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the word “then” is applied in immediate succession, and should not be viewed as auspicious, and so on.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nyan pa po'i skye bo rnams 'jug par bya ba'i phyir 'brel pa dang / brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nyan pa po'i skye bo rnams 'jug par bya ba'i phyir 'brel pa dang / brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / dgos pa dang dgos pa'i dgos pa yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: By “Then,” and so on, in order to engage the audience, the connection, the statement, the content, the purpose, and the purpose of the purpose should be stated.

original: de la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi bdag nyid mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rdze btsun gsung gi dbang phyug ni brjod par bya ba yin la de ston pa'i gzhung gi tshogs ni mtshan🔽yang dag par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi bdag nyid mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rdze btsun gsung gi dbang phyug ni brjod par bya ba yin la de ston pa'i gzhung gi tshogs ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa ste /
translated: The collection of texts that teach that are the recitation of the names.

original: de dag kyang brjod par bya ba dang brjod pa'i mtshan nyid dam bstan par bya ba dang ston par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dam thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dam rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa ste gdul bya'i khyad par gyi tshig go
analyzed: de dag kyang brjod par bya ba dang brjod pa'i mtshan nyid dam bstan par bya ba dang ston par byed pa'i mtshan nyid dam thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid dam rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa ste gdul bya'i khyad par gyi tshig go
translated: The relationship between them is the characteristic of the object of expression and the expression, or the characteristic of the taught and the teacher, or the characteristic of the means and the result of the means, or the characteristic of the cause and the effect.

original: // dgos pa ni mtshan gyi don gang yang rung ba bsgoms pa rab kyi mthar thug pa rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi ngo bo nyid rdzogs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: // dgos pa ni mtshan gyi don gang yang rung ba bsgoms pa rab kyi mthar thug pa rje btsun 'jam dpal gyi ngo bo nyid rdzogs par byas pa'o //
translated: The purpose is to perfect the nature of the venerable Manjushri by meditating on any of the meanings of the names to the highest degree.

original: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob nas 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa ste dgos pa'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i dgos pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob nas 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa ste dgos pa'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: The ultimate purpose is to benefit all beings without exception after attaining nonabiding nirvana.

original: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //🔽spyan sngar 'dug ste 'di skad gsol //
analyzed: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang // spyan sngar 'dug ste 'di skad gsol //
translated: Then, in the presence of glorious Vajradhara,🔽he sat down and made this request:

original: zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is to be connected with the above.

original: de la dpal ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: de la dpal ni bsod nams kyi tshogs dang ye shes kyi tshogs te /
translated: Here, glory is the accumulation of merit and the accumulation of wisdom.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs de dag yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan pas dpal ldan no //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs de dag yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan pas dpal ldan no //
translated: He is glorious because he possesses the perfection of those accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: rdo rje ni me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba grub pa dang / chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rtse lnga pa gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid 'chang zhing lag mthil du gzhag pa @117a * //
analyzed: rdo rje ni me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba grub pa dang / chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rtse lnga pa gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid 'chang zhing lag mthil du gzhag pa @117a * //
translated: Vajra is the essence of the mirror-like wisdom, the wisdom of equality, the wisdom of individual realization, the wisdom of successful activities, and the wisdom of the extremely pure sphere of reality. He holds two of those five-pronged vajras, which are the essence of nondual suchness, in his hands.

original: bzhin du de'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum du mdzad pa'i phyir 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje 'chang ngo //
analyzed: bzhin du de'i bdag nyid kyi mngon sum du mdzad pa'i phyir 'dzin par mdzad pas na rdo rje 'chang ngo //
translated: Thus, he is Vajradhara, the Holder, because he has made them manifest in his own nature.

original: dka' ba 'dul ba'i phyir gdul dka' ba ste /
analyzed: dka' ba 'dul ba'i phyir gdul dka' ba ste /
translated: He is the Subduer of the Difficult to Conquer because he has subdued the difficult to subdue.

original: dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The difficult to subdue are the great lords, etc.

original: gdul dka' ba rnams 'dul bas na gdul dka' 'dul ba po'o //
analyzed: gdul dka' ba rnams 'dul bas na gdul dka' 'dul ba po'o //
translated: He is the Subduer of the Difficult to Subdue because he has subdued the difficult to subdue.🔽 Moreover, even Narayana, etc. are not the Subduer of the Difficult to Subdue because they have subdued the evil titans, etc.

original: gzhan yang sred med kyi bu la sogs pas kyang lha ma yin gdug pa can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir gdul dka' 'dul ba bo ma yin no zhes rtog pa la mchog / dpa' bo 'jig rten gsum las rgyal //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sred med kyi bu la sogs pas kyang lha ma yin gdug pa can rnams 'dul ba'i phyir gdul dka' 'dul ba bo ma yin no zhes rtog pa la mchog / dpa' bo 'jig rten gsum las rgyal // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The Hero Victorious in the Three Worlds

original: mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: mchog ni phul du byung ba'o //
translated: The word supreme means excellent.

original: dpa' bo ni gnyis pa med pa dang / 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpa' bo ni gnyis pa med pa dang / 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word hero means that he is without a second and is free from all fear.

original: 'jig rten gsum las rgyal zhes bya ba la 'jig rten gsum gyi sgras ni de na gnas pa'i lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rgyal zhes bya ba la 'jig rten gsum gyi sgras ni de na gnas pa'i lha dang / lha ma yin dang / mi la sogs pa ste /
translated: The words victorious in the three worlds mean that he has conquered the three worlds.

original: de rnams btul te byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang dkyil 'khor du bcug pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la smon lam 'debs su bcug nas rang gi 'khor nyid du 'jog cing 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag por gyur pa nyid du gnas par mdzad
analyzed: de rnams btul te byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang dkyil 'khor du bcug pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la smon lam 'debs su bcug nas rang gi 'khor nyid du 'jog cing 'jig rten gsum gyi bdag por gyur pa nyid du gnas par mdzad
translated: Having subdued them, he caused them to generate the Thought of Awakening, to enter the mandala, and so forth, and having caused them to make aspirational prayers for the Awakening of a Buddha, he established them as his own retinue and caused them to remain as the lords of the three worlds.

original: pas na 'jig rten gsum las rgyal ba ste /
analyzed: pas na 'jig rten gsum las rgyal ba ste /
translated: Therefore, he is the Victorious One over the Three Worlds.

original: 'jig rten rnams las rgyal ba'i dang tshul 'di la mnga' bas na 'jig rten gsum las rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams las rgyal ba'i dang tshul 'di la mnga' bas na 'jig rten gsum las rgyal ba'o //
translated: He is the Victorious One over the Three Worlds because he possesses the method of victory over the worlds.

original: yang na thabs sna tshogs kyis 'jig rten gsum du rnam pa thams cad du rgyal ba 'di la mnga' bas na 'jig rten gsum las rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: yang na thabs sna tshogs kyis 'jig rten gsum du rnam pa thams cad du rgyal ba 'di la mnga' bas na 'jig rten gsum las rgyal ba'o //
translated: Or else, he is the Victorious One over the Three Worlds because he possesses the victory in every way over the Three Worlds by means of various methods.

original: rdo rjes nye bar mtshon pa'i rigs ni rdo rje'i rigs kyi sgrar brjod de /
analyzed: rdo rjes nye bar mtshon pa'i rigs ni rdo rje'i rigs kyi sgrar brjod de /
translated: The family characterized by the vajra is called the vajra family.

original: de bas na rdo rje'i rigs kyi bdag po ni rdo rje'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de bas na rdo rje'i rigs kyi bdag po ni rdo rje'i dbang phyug go //
translated: Therefore, the lord of the vajra family is the Vajreśvara.

original: gsang ba pa ni gnod sbyin rnams te /
analyzed: gsang ba pa ni gnod sbyin rnams te /
translated: The guhyakas are the yakṣas.

original: de gdul bar bya ba'i phyir de'i rigs su skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa nye bar bstan nas de rnams kyi dbus na rgyal por gyur pas mdzes shing snang bar gyur ba'i phyir na gsang ba'i rgyal po'o //
analyzed: de gdul bar bya ba'i phyir de'i rigs su skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa nye bar bstan nas de rnams kyi dbus na rgyal por gyur pas mdzes shing snang bar gyur ba'i phyir na gsang ba'i rgyal po'o //
translated: In order to tame them, he demonstrates the taking of birth in their class, and he is the king of the secret ones because he is beautiful and shining as the king in their midst.

original: padma dkar po rgyas pa dang 'dra bar yid 'phrog pa'i spyan gang la yod pa de ni padma dkar po rgyas 'dra'i spyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: padma dkar po rgyas pa dang 'dra bar yid 'phrog pa'i spyan gang la yod pa de ni padma dkar po rgyas 'dra'i spyan zhes bya'o //
translated: He who has eyes that captivate the mind like a full-blown white lotus is called the one with eyes like full-blown white lotuses.

original: padma rgyas 'dra'i zhal mnga' ba //
analyzed: padma rgyas 'dra'i zhal mnga' ba //
translated: He who has a face like a full-blown lotus

original: zhes bya ba ni zhal mtha' dag kyang mdzes par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhal mtha' dag kyang mdzes par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: means that his entire face is beautiful.

original: rang gi lag gis zhes pa ni rang gi lag pas so //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis zhes pa ni rang gi lag pas so //
translated: With his own hands means with his own hands.

original: rdo rje mchog ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: rdo rje mchog ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The supreme vajra is the nature of the five wisdoms.

original: yang dang yang du ni @117b yang nas yang du'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du ni @117b yang nas yang du'o //
translated: Again and again means repeatedly.

original: gsor byed pa ni shin tu gsor bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gsor byed pa ni shin tu gsor bar byed pa ste /
translated: He brandishes means he brandishes very much.

original: 'di dag gis ni khro bo sgeg pa'i gzugs nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni khro bo sgeg pa'i gzugs nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: By these he speaks of the form of the wrathful one as being charming.

original: de ltar rdo rje 'chang ba'i bye brag rnams bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje 'chang ba'i bye brag rnams bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the varieties of Vajradhara,

original: de'i 'khor gyi tshul gyis gnas pa rnams kyi yang khyad par thams cad dang ldan pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'khor gyi tshul gyis gnas pa rnams kyi yang khyad par thams cad dang ldan pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the particularities of those who abide as his retinue,

original: khro gnyer rim par ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khro gnyer rim par ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “having a frown, etc.,”

original: khro gnyer rim par ldan pa dang / 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang / dbyug sngon can dang / stobs po che dang / mi g-yo ba dang / gnod mdzes dang / sa 'og dang / rdo rje 'od 'phro dang / ghu lu ghu lu dang /
analyzed: khro gnyer rim par ldan pa dang / 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang / dbyug sngon can dang / stobs po che dang / mi g-yo ba dang / gnod mdzes dang / sa 'og dang / rdo rje 'od 'phro dang / ghu lu ghu lu dang /
translated: having a frown, Kāmarāja, Nīladaṇḍa, Mahābala, Acalā, Sumbha, Pātāla, Vajraprabha, Ghuṇḍe,

original: rdo rje kumbhi dang ; rdo rje rtse mo dang / rdo rje 'jigs byed dang / gzhan gyis mi thub pa la sogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje kumbhi dang ; rdo rje rtse mo dang / rdo rje 'jigs byed dang / gzhan gyis mi thub pa la sogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Vajrakuṇḍalī, Vajraśekhara, Vajrabhairava, Aparājitā, etc.

original: de rnams kyis yongs su bskor bas na mtha' yas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyis yongs su bskor bas na mtha' yas pa nyid do //
translated: Since they are surrounded by those, they are infinite.

original: de bas na khro gnyer rim par ldan la sogs pa lag na rdo rje mtha' yas pa dang lhan cig tu phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya bar sbyar te ;
analyzed: de bas na khro gnyer rim par ldan la sogs pa lag na rdo rje mtha' yas pa dang lhan cig tu phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya bar sbyar te ;
translated: Therefore, having bowed down together with the infinite Vajrapāṇis who have frowning faces and so forth, it is to be applied.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i lag na rdo rje gang yin pa de rnams la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i lag na rdo rje gang yin pa de rnams la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Those who are Vajrapāṇis as explained are called that.

original: de rnams kyis zhes thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis zhes thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It is to be applied to all of them, by them.

original: 'jigs pa med pas na dpa' bo'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pas na dpa' bo'o //
translated: Since they are fearless, they are heroes.

original: 'ji skad du bshad pa'i gdug pa rnams 'dul bas na gdul dka' 'dul ba po'o //
analyzed: 'ji skad du bshad pa'i gdug pa rnams 'dul bas na gdul dka' 'dul ba po'o //
translated: Since they tame the wicked as explained, they are tamers of the difficult to tame.

original: 'jigs su rung ba la sogs pa'i nyams dang ldan pas 'jigs su rung dang dpa' byad can no //
analyzed: 'jigs su rung ba la sogs pa'i nyams dang ldan pas 'jigs su rung dang dpa' byad can no //
translated: Since they have the appearance of being frightening and so forth, they are frightening and heroic.

original: rdo rje rtse mo rab 'phro ba //
analyzed: rdo rje rtse mo rab 'phro ba //
translated: With the tips of the vajras

original: rang gi lag gis gsor byed pa //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis gsor byed pa //
translated: emitting from their own hands🔽they brandish them.

original: zhes bya bas ni lag pa'i mthil na gnas pa'i rdo rje dpag tu med pa 'phro bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni lag pa'i mthil na gnas pa'i rdo rje dpag tu med pa 'phro bar ston pa'o //
translated: This shows the infinite vajras that reside in the palms of their hands emitting.

original: snying rje chen po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i thabs rnams ston pa yin te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'gro ba'i don byed pa'i thabs rnams ston pa yin te /
translated: The line beginning with “great compassion” teaches the means of working for the welfare of living beings.

original: snying rje chen po dang thabs dang shes rab kyis 'gro ba'i don byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang thabs dang shes rab kyis 'gro ba'i don byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Great compassion” and “means and wisdom” are to be connected with “working for the welfare of living beings.”

original: de yang snying rje chen po ni 'gro ba'i don la rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de yang snying rje chen po ni 'gro ba'i don la rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: Moreover, great compassion is the engagement in working for the welfare of living beings.

original: shes rab ni chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos thams cad dngos po med par rtogs pa'i tshul lo //
translated: Wisdom is the method of realizing that all phenomena are unreal.

original: thabs ni rnam pa dpag tu med pas sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni rnam pa dpag tu med pas sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'o //
translated: Means is working for the welfare of living beings through immeasurable aspects.

original: yang na shes rab dang thabs gnyis ni sems can rnams kyi don phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na shes rab dang thabs gnyis ni sems can rnams kyi don phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, wisdom and means are the unmistaken realization of the welfare of living beings.

original: snying rje chen po ni 'khor ba ji srid par sems can ma lus pa'i don byed pa'i ngo bo ste /🔽sems can la dmigs pa dang / @118a * //
analyzed: snying rje chen po ni 'khor ba ji srid par sems can ma lus pa'i don byed pa'i ngo bo ste / sems can la dmigs pa dang / @118a * //
translated: Great compassion is the essence of working for the welfare of all living beings for as long as saṃsāra lasts.🔽It has the nature of focusing on living beings

original: chos la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: and focusing on phenomena.

original: de bas na snying rje chen po dang shes rab dang thabs la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na snying rje chen po dang shes rab dang thabs la sogs pa'am /
translated: Therefore, he is the one who acts for the sake of all beings through great compassion, wisdom, and means.

original: snying rje chen po dang shes rab dang thabs kyis 'gro ba rnams kyi kun nas don byed pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang shes rab dang thabs kyis 'gro ba rnams kyi kun nas don byed pa'o //
translated: Or, he is the one who acts for the sake of all beings through great compassion, wisdom, and means.

original: de nyid kyis na mchog go //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na mchog go //
translated: He is the supreme one because of that.

original: rgyu'i khyad par mthong bas na dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par mthong bas na dga' ba'o //
translated: He is the one who is delighted by seeing the special cause.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong bas na mgu ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong bas na mgu ba'o //
translated: He is the one who is pleased by seeing the special result.

original: gnyi ga rdzogs par mthong bas na rangs pa'i bsam pa can no //🔽khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa //
analyzed: gnyi ga rdzogs par mthong bas na rangs pa'i bsam pa can no // khro bo'i lus kyi gzugs ldan pa //
translated: He is the one who has the attitude of being satisfied by seeing the completion of both.🔽He has the form of a wrathful body.

original: zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i gzugs can yin gyi khros pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i gzugs can yin gyi khros pa ni ma yin te /
translated: He has the form of a wrathful one, but he is not wrathful,

original: thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has the nature of great compassion.

original: de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas phrin las byed pa'i mgon te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na sangs rgyas phrin las byed pa'i mgon te /
translated: He is the protector who performs the activities of the buddhas.

original: mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mgon med pa rnams kyi mgon du gyur pa ste /
translated: He is the protector of those who are without a protector.

original: de rnams dang lhan cig pa ni de dag dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang lhan cig pa ni de dag dang bcas pa'o //
translated: He is the one who is together with them.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the special quality?

original: lus btud rnams dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus btud rnams dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and bowing with his body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bcom ldan 'das //
translated: The Blessed One, the Tathagata,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal nas //🔽zhes bya ba ni 'og nas rgya cher bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal nas // zhes bya ba ni 'og nas rgya cher bshad par bya'o //
translated: having bowed to the perfect Buddha,

original: thal mo sbyar ba byas nas ni //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba byas nas ni //
translated: having placed his palms together

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni 'og nas bshad pa'i gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshul smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni 'og nas bshad pa'i gsol ba 'debs pa'i tshul smos pa yin no //
translated: this refers to the manner of supplicating, which will be explained below.

original: spyan sngar 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni rjes ma yin pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir rgyab dang logs su ni mi 'dug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyan sngar 'dug ste zhes bya ba ni rjes ma yin pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir rgyab dang logs su ni mi 'dug go zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In his presence means that one should not sit behind or to the side, in order to avoid what is not proper.🔽For the sake of my welfare, O all-pervading Lord,

original: khyab bdag bdag la sman pa dang // zhes bya ba 'jig rten phyi ma'i 'bras bu rdzogs pa'i don du gsungs pa ni bdag la sman pa'o //
analyzed: khyab bdag bdag la sman pa dang // zhes bya ba 'jig rten phyi ma'i 'bras bu rdzogs pa'i don du gsungs pa ni bdag la sman pa'o //
translated: this is stated for the sake of the result in the next world.

original: tshe 'di'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni bdag gi don to //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa ni bdag gi don to //
translated: The welfare of this life is stated for the sake of completing the result in this life.

original: thugs brtse ba'i phyir ni gnyi ga rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs brtse ba'i phyir ni gnyi ga rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Out of compassion is for the sake of completing both.

original: sgyur 'phrul dra bas mngon rdzogs pa'i //
analyzed: sgyur 'phrul dra bas mngon rdzogs pa'i //
translated: The net of magical emanations is fully perfected.🔽

original: byang chub ci nas bdag thob mdzod //
analyzed: byang chub ci nas bdag thob mdzod //
translated: May I attain the enlightenment of the Web of Magic.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: sna tshogs par sprul ba ni sgyu 'phrul lo //
analyzed: sna tshogs par sprul ba ni sgyu 'phrul lo //
translated: Magic is the various emanations.

original: 'ching ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas dra ba'o //
translated: Web is the nature of bondage.

original: de ltar na sbrul ba sna tshogs pas 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor nub pa'i sems can rnams dra ba nyid kyis bton nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i thang gi skam sar gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na sbrul ba sna tshogs pas 'khor ba'i rgya mtshor nub pa'i sems can rnams dra ba nyid kyis bton nas mya ngan las 'das pa'i thang gi skam sar gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having rescued sentient beings who are drowning in the ocean of cyclic existence by means of the various emanations, and having placed them on the dry land of nirvana,

original: rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad las phyin ci ma log par mngon par byang chub pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad las phyin ci ma log par mngon par byang chub pa ni sgyu 'phrul dra bas mngon par byang chub pa'o //
translated: one attains the enlightenment of the Web of Magic, which is the complete and unerring enlightenment with regard to all phenomena in every way.

original: de bas na de lta bu'i byang chub ji ltar bdag gis thob par 'gyur ba @118b de ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mtshan yang dag par bshad du gsol zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bas na de lta bu'i byang chub ji ltar bdag gis thob par 'gyur ba @118b de ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mtshan yang dag par bshad du gsol zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, May I attain such enlightenment is to be supplied. Please explain the name of the perfect Buddha.

original: de ltar bdag la phan pa dang gzhan yang /
analyzed: de ltar bdag la phan pa dang gzhan yang /
translated: and also

original: nyon mongs pas ni sems dkrugs shing //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas ni sems dkrugs shing //
translated: whose minds are disturbed by afflictions,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis sems dkrugs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis sems dkrugs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste ;
translated: That which is called “whose minds are disturbed by afflictions” is that which is so called.

original: de rnams la phan pa dang / mi shes pa nyid 'dam yin pas na mi shes 'dam du zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams la phan pa dang / mi shes pa nyid 'dam yin pas na mi shes 'dam du zhes bya ste /
translated: For the benefit of those who are in the mud of ignorance, it is called “the mud of ignorance.”

original: mi shes pa'i 'dam du bying ba rnams la phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i 'dam du bying ba rnams la phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the benefit of those who are sunk in the mud of ignorance.

original: phan pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽sems can kun /
analyzed: phan pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir / sems can kun /
translated: In order to teach the benefit,🔽it says,

original: bla med 'bras bu thob bya'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bla med 'bras bu thob bya'i phyir // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “for the sake of attaining the unsurpassed fruit for all sentient beings.”

original: bla na med pa'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas thob bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i 'bras bu sangs rgyas thob bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of attaining the unsurpassed fruit of buddhahood,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das //
translated: the Bhagavān, the perfect Buddha,

original: 'gro ba'i bla mas bshad du gsol //🔽zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bla mas bshad du gsol // zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: the guru of the world, should explain.

original: dam tshig chen po de nyid mkhyen //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po de nyid mkhyen //
translated: The great commitment, knowing thatness,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and so on.

original: dam tshig ces bya ba'i sgra ni brda dang / grub pa'i mtha' dang / sdom pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang / sngags dang phyag rgya dang lha rnams la rab tu sbyar la /
analyzed: dam tshig ces bya ba'i sgra ni brda dang / grub pa'i mtha' dang / sdom pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang / sngags dang phyag rgya dang lha rnams la rab tu sbyar la /
translated: The term “commitment” is applied to symbols, tenets, vows, mandalas, mantras, seals, and deities.

original: brda la sogs pa'i yul thams cad kyi de kho na mkhyen pas na /
analyzed: brda la sogs pa'i yul thams cad kyi de kho na mkhyen pas na /
translated: Since he knows the reality of all objects such as symbols,

original: dam tshig chen po de nyid mkhyen //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po de nyid mkhyen //
translated: he is the knower of the great commitment.

original: zhes bya'o // dbang po bsam pa mkhyen mchog gis //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // dbang po bsam pa mkhyen mchog gis // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The supreme one who knows the various faculties of beings

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste lnga po ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste lnga po ni dbang po'o //
translated: The five faculties are faith, vigor, mindfulness, samadhi, and wisdom.

original: dbang po de rnams bsam pa sna tshogs pas chung du dang / 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas dbang po rnam pa dgur dbye ba mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po de rnams bsam pa sna tshogs pas chung du dang / 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas dbang po rnam pa dgur dbye ba mkhyen pa'o //
translated: He knows those faculties divided into nine types by their various lesser, middling, and greater inclinations.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams dang / mtho ris dang thar pa sna tshogs dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul gyis dpag tu med par phye ba ni bsam pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams dang / mtho ris dang thar pa sna tshogs dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi yul gyis dpag tu med par phye ba ni bsam pa ste /
translated: The intention is the immeasurable division of the realm of desire, the realm of form, the formless realm, the realm of desire, the realm of hatred, the realm of delusion, the realm of mundane gods, the realm of various heavens and liberation, the realm of the śrāvakas, the realm of the pratyekabuddhas, and the realm of the perfect buddhas.

original: dbang po rnams dang bsam pa rnams mkhyen pas na /
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang bsam pa rnams mkhyen pas na /
translated: Since he knows the faculties and the intentions,

original: dbang po bsam pa mkhyen mchog gis //🔽zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po bsam pa mkhyen mchog gis // zhes pa ste /
translated: he is the supreme knower of faculties and intentions.

original: phul du byung bas bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi sku mtshan yang dag par brjod pa bshad du gsol zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: phul du byung bas bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi sku mtshan yang dag par brjod pa bshad du gsol zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Since it is the best, it is the wisdom body of the Bhagavān.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi sku yin pas na bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi sku zhes bya ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i ye @119a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi sku yin pas na bcom ldan 'das kyi ye shes kyi sku zhes bya ste / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i ye @119a * //
translated: The Bhagavān’s wisdom body is called the Bhagavān’s wisdom body

original: shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the very essence of the wisdom of the body of all tathāgatas.

original: de skad du dpal rdo rje snying po'i rgyan las /
analyzed: de skad du dpal rdo rje snying po'i rgyan las /
translated: Thus it says in the Śrīvajraḍhṛdaya-alaṅkāra:

original: bde gshegs dri med shes rab ni //
analyzed: bde gshegs dri med shes rab ni //
translated: The Sugata Vimalaprajña

original: rdo rje rnon por de bshad do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rdo rje rnon por de bshad do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: is explained as Vajra-tikshna.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dri ma med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi sku ni ye shes kyi sku ste de'i gtsug tor chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshig gi bdag po ste gsung thams cad la rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dri ma med pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi sku ni ye shes kyi sku ste de'i gtsug tor chen po'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshig gi bdag po ste gsung thams cad la rab tu 'jug par byed pa'o
translated: Therefore, the body of the nature of stainless intuition of all Tathāgatas is the intuition body, and its great uṣṇīṣa is the essence of the Lord of Speech, which is the cause of all speech.

original: // ye shes sku ste rang byung ba //
analyzed: // ye shes sku ste rang byung ba //
translated: The intuition body, self-arisen,

original: zhes bya ba ni ye shes nyid kyi sku yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ye shes nyid kyi sku yin te /
translated: means that the body is of the nature of intuition.

original: phyi'i don gyi gzugs kyi sku zla ba la sogs pa ni med de /
analyzed: phyi'i don gyi gzugs kyi sku zla ba la sogs pa ni med de /
translated: The body of form of external objects, such as the moon, does not exist,

original: kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rnam par gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established conventionally.

original: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa las ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / rang nyid rnam par dag pa'i gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyun las 'khrungs pa yin pa'i phyir rang 'byung ba'o //
