translated: Or else, he displays a smile after extending his tongue.

original: gsang dbang la ni slar gsungs pa //
analyzed: gsang dbang la ni slar gsungs pa //
translated: He then speaks again to the one who is to be empowered by the secret.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how the passage should be construed.

original: 'dzum pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'dzum pa'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the special nature of the smile, he says:

original: 'jig rten gsum po snang byed cing //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po snang byed cing //
translated: Illuminating the three worlds,

original: bdud bzhi dgra rnams gdul byed pa //🔽sems can rnams kyi ngan song gsum //
analyzed: bdud bzhi dgra rnams gdul byed pa // sems can rnams kyi ngan song gsum //
translated: taming the four demons as enemies,🔽purifying the three lower realms

original: sbyong bar byed pa'i 'dzum bstan nas //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sbyong bar byed pa'i 'dzum bstan nas // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: of sentient beings, he displays a smile.

original: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar byed pa ni khams gsum po snang zhing gsal bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po snang bar byed pa ni khams gsum po snang zhing gsal bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: Illuminating the three worlds means illuminating and clarifying the three realms.

original: bdud bzhi ni phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu'i bdud ces grags pa rnams te /
analyzed: bdud bzhi ni phung po dang / nyon mongs pa dang / 'chi bdag dang / lha'i bu'i bdud ces grags pa rnams te /
translated: The four demons are the aggregates, the afflictions, the lord of death, and the son of heaven, as they are renowned.

original: de dag nyid ni dgra rnams so //
analyzed: de dag nyid ni dgra rnams so //
translated: They are enemies.

original: de rnams 'dul bar byed pa ni rang gi yul las sbos nas byang chub kyi lam la des par sbyar ba'o ;
analyzed: de rnams 'dul bar byed pa ni rang gi yul las sbos nas byang chub kyi lam la des par sbyar ba'o ;
translated: Taming them means that after he has hidden them from their own realm, he definitely joins them to the path of enlightenment.

original: / de 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzhan yang ;🔽sems can rnams kyi ngan song gsum //🔽sbyor bar byed pa'i 'dzum bstan nas //
analyzed: / de 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi gzhan yang ; sems can rnams kyi ngan song gsum // sbyor bar byed pa'i 'dzum bstan nas //
translated: And not only that, but also🔽the Buddha, with a smile,🔽teaches the Dharma to those

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: who are in the three lower realms.

original: ngan song gsum ni dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas te /
analyzed: ngan song gsum ni dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas te /
translated: The three lower realms are the hells, the realm of hungry ghosts, and the animal realm.

original: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad pa de'i tshe zhal las 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs byung nas sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams snang bar mdzad la /🔽de rnams 'od zer nges yang dag par reg pa dang sems can dmyal ba la @121a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad pa de'i tshe zhal las 'od zer kha dog sna tshogs byung nas sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams snang bar mdzad la / de rnams 'od zer nges yang dag par reg pa dang sems can dmyal ba la @121a * //
translated: When the Blessed Buddha smiles, light rays of various colors emerge from his mouth, illuminating the sentient beings who are in the hells, the realm of hungry ghosts, and the animal realm.🔽When those sentient beings are touched by the light rays, the suffering of their bodies, speech, and minds in the hells and so forth is completely pacified and ceases.

original: sogs pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi zhing rgyun chad nas sangs rgyas mthong ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi sdug bsngal nye bar zhi zhing rgyun chad nas sangs rgyas mthong ngo //
translated: They see the Buddha.

original: de mthong bas dran pa rnyed par gyur te /
analyzed: de mthong bas dran pa rnyed par gyur te /
translated: By seeing him, they regain their mindfulness.

original: de nas sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de nas sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Then they pay homage to the Buddha.

original: chos la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: chos la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Dharma!

original: dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Saṅgha!

original: zhes dkon mchog gsum dran ma thag tu /
analyzed: zhes dkon mchog gsum dran ma thag tu /
translated: Immediately after he had recalled the Three Jewels,

original: de nas shi 'phos te lha dang / mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skyes te /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos te lha dang / mi rnams dang skal ba mnyam par skyes te /
translated: he died and was reborn in the world of the gods and humans.

original: dang po byang chub kyi sems yongs su bzung nas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par byas pas rim gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su gyur te /
analyzed: dang po byang chub kyi sems yongs su bzung nas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la goms par byas pas rim gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su gyur te /
translated: Having first taken up the thought of awakening, he gradually became a Buddha Bhagavat by cultivating the perfections of generosity and so on.

original: de lta bas na ngan song gsum sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ngan song gsum sbyong ba'o //
translated: Thus, he purified the three lower realms.

original: yang na ngan song gsum gyi rgyu 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams rnam par sbyangs pas na sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: yang na ngan song gsum gyi rgyu 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams rnam par sbyangs pas na sbyong ba'o //
translated: Or else, he purified the three lower realms by purifying the causes of the three lower realms, namely, desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: yang na ngan song gsum gyi rgyur gyur pa bdag dang / rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye brag dang / 'du ba dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa yod pa nyid du ston par byed pa la snying stobs dang /
analyzed: yang na ngan song gsum gyi rgyur gyur pa bdag dang / rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / bye brag dang / 'du ba dang / dbang phyug la sogs pa yod pa nyid du ston par byed pa la snying stobs dang /
translated: Or else, he purified the three lower realms by purifying the causes of the three lower realms, namely, the existence of self, substance, quality, action, universal, particular, inherence, and so on.

original: rdul dang / mun pa'i gzugs can drag po dang / sred med kyi bu dang / tshangs pa ste de dag rnam par sbyangs pas na ngan song gsum sbyong bar byed pa zhes bya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rdul dang / mun pa'i gzugs can drag po dang / sred med kyi bu dang / tshangs pa ste de dag rnam par sbyangs pas na ngan song gsum sbyong bar byed pa zhes bya zhes bya ste /
translated: and Brahma, who has the form of the elements of space and consciousness.

original: de lta bu'i 'dzum pa sems can rnams la yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'dzum pa sems can rnams la yang dag par ston par mdzad pa'am /
translated: He displays that smile to sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams dang 'brel pa'i ngan song gsum sbyong par mdzad pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams dang 'brel pa'i ngan song gsum sbyong par mdzad pa'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Or, he purifies the three lower realms that are connected with sentient beings.

original: tshangs pa'i gsung ni snyan pa yis //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gsung ni snyan pa yis //
translated: With his melodious Brahma voice,

original: 'jig rten gsum po kun bkang nas /🔽lag na rdo rje stobs po che //🔽gsang dbang la ni slar gsungs pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po kun bkang nas / lag na rdo rje stobs po che // gsang dbang la ni slar gsungs pa //
translated: he fills the three worlds🔽and again speaks to Vajrapani,🔽the powerful one,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: the lord of secrets.

original: tshangs pa'i gsung ni ji ltar yul nye bar gnas pa dag gis thos pa de bzhin du phyi rol gyi yul thag ring ba 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyis kyang thos te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gsung ni ji ltar yul nye bar gnas pa dag gis thos pa de bzhin du phyi rol gyi yul thag ring ba 'jig rten gyi khams rnams kyis kyang thos te /
translated: His Brahma voice is such that those who are nearby hear it just as those who are far away in other world systems hear it.

original: gang na gnas pa rnams la sgrib pa med par thos pa gcig pur ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gang na gnas pa rnams la sgrib pa med par thos pa gcig pur ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is it heard unobstructedly by those who are present,

original: thag ring ba na gnas pa'am /
analyzed: thag ring ba na gnas pa'am /
translated: but even those who are far away,

original: dman zhing rna ba mi gsang ba rnams kyis kyang snyan zhing yid du 'ong la rnam par gsal ba'i don ston pa'i tshul te /🔽des / snying rje che dang ldan gyur pa //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa slar gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dman zhing rna ba mi gsang ba rnams kyis kyang snyan zhing yid du 'ong la rnam par gsal ba'i don ston pa'i tshul te / des / snying rje che dang ldan gyur pa // zhes bya ba la sogs pa slar gsungs pa yin no //
translated: or those who are lowly and have dull ears, it is pleasant, agreeable, and teaches the meaning clearly.

original: snying rje che dang ldan gyur pa //
analyzed: snying rje che dang ldan gyur pa //
translated: With that, he again said, Those who possess great compassion,

original: 'gro la phan pa'i don du khyod //
analyzed: 'gro la phan pa'i don du khyod //
translated: for the sake of benefiting beings,

original: ye shes lus can 'jam dpal gyi //
analyzed: ye shes lus can 'jam dpal gyi //
translated: the one with a wisdom body, Manjushri,

original: ming brjod @121b pa ni don che ba //
analyzed: ming brjod @121b pa ni don che ba //
translated: by uttering his name has great meaning.

original: dag par byed cing sdig sel ba //
analyzed: dag par byed cing sdig sel ba //
translated: It purifies and removes evil,

original: nga las nyan par brtson pa ni //🔽legs so dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
analyzed: nga las nyan par brtson pa ni // legs so dpal ldan rdo rje 'chang //
translated: those who strive to listen to me,🔽excellent! Glorious Vajra Holder,

original: lag na rdo rje khyod legs so //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lag na rdo rje khyod legs so //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: Vajrapani, you are excellent!

original: 'gro la phan pa'i snying rje chen po dang ldan par gyur pas don chen po dang ldan pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa nyan pa la khyod brtson par byed de /
analyzed: 'gro la phan pa'i snying rje chen po dang ldan par gyur pas don chen po dang ldan pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa nyan pa la khyod brtson par byed de /
translated: Since he is endowed with great compassion for the benefit of beings, he is endowed with the great meaning.

original: de bas na legs so legs so zhes rab tu dgyes pas na lan gnyis su gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na legs so legs so zhes rab tu dgyes pas na lan gnyis su gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is excellent, excellent!

original: sangs rgyas nyid 'thob ba'i rgyur gyur pas na don che ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid 'thob ba'i rgyur gyur pas na don che ba'o //
translated: Since it is the cause for attaining buddhahood, it is of great meaning.

original: nyes pa spyod pa'i gnyen por gyur pas na dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa spyod pa'i gnyen por gyur pas na dag par byed pa'o //
translated: Since it is the antidote for engaging in faults, it is purifying.

original: sdig pa thams cad rnam par 'gog par byed pas na sdig sel ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad rnam par 'gog par byed pas na sdig sel ba'o //
translated: Since it stops all misdeeds, it is the remover of misdeeds.

original: de lta bu'i yon tan gyis phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gang gi yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i yon tan gyis phul du byung ba dang ldan pa'i mtshan yang dag par brjod pa gang gi yin zhe na /
translated: What is the name of the one who possesses such excellent qualities?

original: ye shes lus can 'jam dpal gyi //
analyzed: ye shes lus can 'jam dpal gyi //
translated: The one with a wisdom body, Manjushri,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: is the one who possesses such excellent qualities.

original: gsang ba'i bdag po de phyir ngas //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po de phyir ngas //
translated: O Lord of Secrets, therefore

original: khyod la legs par bstan par bya //
analyzed: khyod la legs par bstan par bya //
translated: I will teach it to you well.

original: khyod ni rtse gcig yid kyis nyon ;
analyzed: khyod ni rtse gcig yid kyis nyon ;
translated: You should listen with a one-pointed mind.

original: / bcom ldan de ni legs zhes gsol //
analyzed: / bcom ldan de ni legs zhes gsol //
translated: The Blessed One said, Excellent!

original: zhes bya ba la gang gi phyir gang zhig khyod nyan pa la 'jug pa de'i phyir legs par bstan par bya'o zhes bshad par bya ba'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gang gi phyir gang zhig khyod nyan pa la 'jug pa de'i phyir legs par bstan par bya'o zhes bshad par bya ba'i khyad par yin te /
translated: In this, since one engages in listening to you, therefore it should be well-taught. This is the distinction of what is to be explained.

original: ngas khyod la phyin ci ma log par mtshan yang dag par brjod pa bshad cing bstan par bya yis /
analyzed: ngas khyod la phyin ci ma log par mtshan yang dag par brjod pa bshad cing bstan par bya yis /
translated: I will explain and teach to you the unmistaken explanation of the true nature of the Tathāgata.

original: kye gsang ba'i bdag po khyod rtse gcig pa'i yid kyis nyon cig ces pa ste /
analyzed: kye gsang ba'i bdag po khyod rtse gcig pa'i yid kyis nyon cig ces pa ste /
translated: O Lord of Secrets, listen with a one-pointed mind!

original: sems rnam par g-yengs pas ni ji skad du bshad pa'i don khong du chud par mi nus te /
analyzed: sems rnam par g-yengs pas ni ji skad du bshad pa'i don khong du chud par mi nus te /
translated: One whose mind is distracted is unable to comprehend the meaning as it is explained.

original: de bas na bshad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur zhes ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams la bslab par bya ba'i phyir 'di skad du gsungs pa yin gyi gzhan du na rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po ni ma bstan pa nyid du rtag tu sems mi g-yengs pa🔽kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na bshad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur zhes ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams la bslab par bya ba'i phyir 'di skad du gsungs pa yin gyi gzhan du na rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po ni ma bstan pa nyid du rtag tu sems mi g-yengs pa🔽kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the explanation would be fruitless. This is said for the sake of instructing future beings, but otherwise, the Great Vajra-Holder, without being taught, always has an undistracted mind.

original: bcom ldan de ni legs zhes gsol //
analyzed: bcom ldan de ni legs zhes gsol //
translated: The Blessed One said, Excellent!

original: zhes bya ba ni gang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa rtse gcig pa'i yid kyis nyon cig ces gsungs pa de legs shing mdzes pas de bzhin du mnyan par bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa rtse gcig pa'i yid kyis nyon cig ces gsungs pa de legs shing mdzes pas de bzhin du mnyan par bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that what the Blessed One said, Listen with a one-pointed mind, is excellent and beautiful, so we will listen accordingly.

original: de nas bcom ldan sh'akya thub //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan sh'akya thub //
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Sage of the Shakyas,

original: tshig gi bdag pos tshigs su bcas pa 'di gsungs pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: tshig gi bdag pos tshigs su bcas pa 'di gsungs pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: the Lord of Speech, spoke these verses.

original: de bas zhes bya ba ni mnyan par nges ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba ni mnyan par nges ma thag tu'o //
translated: Therefore, means immediately after ascertaining the listening.

original: bdud la sog pa bcom pas bcom ldan 'das so //🔽sh'akya'i rigs @122a * //
analyzed: bdud la sog pa bcom pas bcom ldan 'das so // sh'akya'i rigs @122a * //
translated: He is the Blessed One because he has conquered Mara and so forth.

original: las byung bas sh'akya'o //
analyzed: las byung bas sh'akya'o //
translated: He is a Shaky a because he comes from the Shaky a clan.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs thub pa dang ldan pas na thub pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs thub pa dang ldan pas na thub pa'o //
translated: He is a Sage because he possesses the discipline of body, speech, and mind.

original: gsang sngags rigs chen thams cad dang // zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dang / rtog pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa na gsang sngags kyi rigs so //
analyzed: gsang sngags rigs chen thams cad dang // zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang / spyod pa dang / rnal 'byor gyi rgyud dang / rtog pa la sogs pa bskyed pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa na gsang sngags kyi rigs so //
translated: The great lineage of all secret mantras is the lineage of secret mantras in the stage of generating the awareness of the Action, Performance, Yoga, and other tantras.

original: yul dang dus la sogs pa khyab pas chen po'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus la sogs pa khyab pas chen po'o //
translated: It is great because it pervades all places and times, etc.

original: de la gzigs nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs pa zhes 'og nas bshad pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzigs nas tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs pa zhes 'og nas bshad pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Having seen that, he spoke this verse. This should be applied to the following explanations as well.

original: gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba'i rigs ni de'i rgyud la gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags rig sngags 'chang ba'i rigs ni de'i rgyud la gzigs pa'o //
translated: The lineage of the holders of secret mantra and awareness is the vision of their continuum.

original: rigs gsum ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang padma'i rigs kyi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: rigs gsum ni de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang padma'i rigs kyi ngo bo ste /
translated: The three lineages are the essence of the Tathagata, Vajra, and Lotus lineages.

original: rigs thams cad bsdus ba'o //
analyzed: rigs thams cad bsdus ba'o //
translated: They include all lineages.

original: rnam par gzigs pa ni nges par rtog par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par gzigs pa ni nges par rtog par mdzad pa ste /
translated: The vision is the definite realization.

original: 'tsham pa dang mi 'tsham pa dang skal ba dang ldan nam mi ldan zhes rang gi ngo bo la nges par rtog par mdzad pa ni gzigs pa thams cad la dgos pa yin par blta'o //
analyzed: 'tsham pa dang mi 'tsham pa dang skal ba dang ldan nam mi ldan zhes rang gi ngo bo la nges par rtog par mdzad pa ni gzigs pa thams cad la dgos pa yin par blta'o //
translated: The necessity of all the views is to be seen in the ascertainment of the nature of the suitability or unsuitability, and the presence or absence of the good fortune.

original: 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i rigs //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig rten 'das pa'i rigs //
translated: The mundane and supramundane families,

original: 'jig rten snang byed rigs chen dang // zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: 'jig rten snang byed rigs chen dang // zhes bya ba la //
translated: the great family which illuminates the world,

original: 'jig rten pa'i sngags kyi rigs ni 'jig rten pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sngags kyi rigs ni 'jig rten pa'i rigs so //
translated: The mundane family is the family of mundane mantras.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gsang sngags kyi rigs ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gsang sngags kyi rigs ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rigs so //
translated: The supramundane family is the family of supramundane mantras.

original: de gnyis ka ni 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: de gnyis ka ni 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'i rigs so //
translated: Both of these are the family which illuminates the world.

original: yang na 'jig rten gyi snang bar byed pa'i rigs ni 'jig rten snang bar byed ba'i rigs te /
analyzed: yang na 'jig rten gyi snang bar byed pa'i rigs ni 'jig rten snang bar byed ba'i rigs te /
translated: Or else, the family which illuminates the world is the family which illuminates the world.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni khro bo chen po'i rigs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni khro bo chen po'i rigs so //
translated: The supramundane is the family of the Great Wrathful One.🔽The great family of the Great Seal,

original: phyag rgya chen po'i rigs mchog dang // rigs chen gtsug tor cher gzigs nas //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i rigs mchog dang // rigs chen gtsug tor cher gzigs nas //
translated: having seen the great uṣṇīṣa family,

original: zhes bya ba la phyag rgya chen po ni spyan la sogs pa rig pa'i rgyal mo rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la phyag rgya chen po ni spyan la sogs pa rig pa'i rgyal mo rnams so //
translated: The great seal is the knowledge queens such as Locana.

original: de'i rigs ni de las byung ba'i gsang sngags dang phyag rgya las skyes pa'i rgyud dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rigs ni de las byung ba'i gsang sngags dang phyag rgya las skyes pa'i rgyud dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: Their family is the tantra that arises from them, which is related to the mantras and seals that are born from them.

original: rigs chen gtsug tor yi ge gcig pa la sogs ba sngags kyi stobs las byung ba'i lha'i bye brag go //
analyzed: rigs chen gtsug tor yi ge gcig pa la sogs ba sngags kyi stobs las byung ba'i lha'i bye brag go //
translated: The great family is the different deities that arise from the power of the one-syllable uṣṇīṣa mantra and so on.

original: 'di dag ni //
analyzed: 'di dag ni //
translated: These are🔽all the great families of mantra.

original: gsang sngags rigs chen thams cad dang // zhes bsdus ba'i rab tu dbye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad du yang sngags sngon du byas nas rigs gzhag par bya'o //🔽tshig gi bdag pos tshigs su bcad //
analyzed: gsang sngags rigs chen thams cad dang // zhes bsdus ba'i rab tu dbye ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir thams cad du yang sngags sngon du byas nas rigs gzhag par bya'o // tshig gi bdag pos tshigs su bcad //
translated: Since they are the nature of the divisions that are included in that, the families should be posited everywhere after the mantra is stated.🔽The lord of words spoke in verse.

original: tshig gi bdag pos tshigs su bcas //
analyzed: tshig gi bdag pos tshigs su bcas //
translated: The lord of words spoke in verse.

original: gsang sngags rgyal po drug @122b ldan zhing //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po drug @122b ldan zhing //
translated: The six kings of mantra🔽are nondual,

original: gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang // mi skye chos can 'di gsungs pa //🔽zhes smos pa la //
analyzed: gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang // mi skye chos can 'di gsungs pa //🔽zhes smos pa la //
translated: and this is said to be the quality of being unborn.

original: tshig gi bdag po ni rje btsun gsung gi dbang phyug ste /
analyzed: tshig gi bdag po ni rje btsun gsung gi dbang phyug ste /
translated: The Lord of Speech is the exalted Lord of Speech.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The verse is spoken in connection with him.

original: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhing //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhing //
translated: Endowed with the six kings of mantra

original: zhes bya ba ni aom badzra t'i ksh'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gsang sngags drug dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni aom badzra t'i ksh'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gsang sngags drug dang ldan pa'o //
translated: means endowed with the six mantras beginning with Om Vajra Tika.

original: 'dir la la dag ni //
analyzed: 'dir la la dag ni //
translated: Here, some recite

original: gsang sngags rgyal po rjes drug ldan //🔽zhes 'don par yang byed de /
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po rjes drug ldan // zhes 'don par yang byed de /
translated: Endowed with the six kings of mantra.

original: tshig de ni glegs bam mang po las ma mthong bas mi rigs so //
analyzed: tshig de ni glegs bam mang po las ma mthong bas mi rigs so //
translated: But that word is not seen in many texts, so it is not correct.

original: gzhan yang rgyal po'i sgra dang mnyam par rgyal po dang rjes su bya ba'i sgra yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyal po'i sgra dang mnyam par rgyal po dang rjes su bya ba'i sgra yod do //
translated: Moreover, the word raja is equivalent to the word anuga.

original: des ni mtshams sbyar ba las mi snang ba yin no zhes la la zer ro //
analyzed: des ni mtshams sbyar ba las mi snang ba yin no zhes la la zer ro //
translated: Some say that it is not seen in the context,🔽but others explain it differently.

original: kha cig gzhan du yang 'chad mod kyi bcom ldan 'das kyis rton pa bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: kha cig gzhan du yang 'chad mod kyi bcom ldan 'das kyis rton pa bzhi gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One taught the four reliances:

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: don la rton gyi tshig 'brul la mi rton pa dang / ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa dang / nges ba'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton pa dang / chos nyid la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa'o //
analyzed: don la rton gyi tshig 'brul la mi rton pa dang / ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa dang / nges ba'i don gyi mdo sde la rton gyi drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton pa dang / chos nyid la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa'o //
translated: rely on the reality, not on the person.

original: de la don ni gang tshig 'bru ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la don ni gang tshig 'bru ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning? What is the letter?

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten pa'i chos dang / bya ba la 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten pa'i chos dang / bya ba la 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is that which teaches the worldly dharmas and the engagement in action.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs pa'o //🔽tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni /🔽gang sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang legs par sdom pa dang / nges pa bstan ba'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rtogs pa'o // tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni / gang sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang legs par sdom pa dang / nges pa bstan ba'o //
translated: The meaning is that which is the realization of the supramundane dharmas.🔽The letter is that which teaches generosity, self-control, restraint, and certainty.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang legs par sdom pa dang / nges pa'i mnyam pa nyid shes pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang sbyin pa dang / dul ba dang legs par sdom pa dang / nges pa'i mnyam pa nyid shes pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that which is the knowledge of the sameness of generosity, self-control, restraint, and certainty.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'khor ba'i skyon sgrogs shing brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang 'khor ba'i skyon sgrogs shing brjod pa'o //
translated: The letter is the proclamation and expression of the faults of cyclic existence.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'khor ba la mi dmigs par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'khor ba la mi dmigs par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the realization of cyclic existence as not being apprehended.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dang phan yon brjod ba'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan dang phan yon brjod ba'o //
translated: The letter is the expression of the virtues and benefits of nirvana.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the non-conceptuality of all dharmas which are naturally in nirvana.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang theg pa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du ston pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang theg pa ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du ston pa'o //
translated: The letter is the teaching of the vehicles as they are established.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang chos kyi dbyings dbyer med cing tshul gcig pa la 'jug pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang chos kyi dbyings dbyer med cing tshul gcig pa la 'jug pa shes pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the knowledge of the indivisibility and single principle of the dharma-dhātu.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang bdag pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba bstan ba'o //🔽don zhes bya ba ni gang @123a * //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang bdag pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba bstan ba'o // don zhes bya ba ni gang @123a * //
translated: The letter is the teaching of the total giving up of all possessions.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag par shes pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the knowledge of the three spheres.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi sdom pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang yod byad bsnyungs pa thams cad yang dag par blang pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang / yid kyi sdom pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang yod byad bsnyungs pa thams cad yang dag par blang pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is the teaching of the patience and the strength of patience which conquers all malice, violence, faults, anger, resentment, pride, conceit, and arrogance.🔽 The meaning is the knowledge of the non-apprehension of malice, violence, faults, anger, resentment, pride, conceit, and arrogance.🔽 The letter is the teaching of the vigor which is the basis of all virtues.🔽 The meaning is the knowledge of the non-apprehension of vigor, of all virtues, and of the basis.🔽 The letter is the teaching of the concentrations, the liberations, the meditations, and the absorptions.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang lus dang / dag dang / yid mi dmigs pa dang / sdom pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa yang dag par blang ba bstan pa yongs su dag par shes pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang lus dang / dag dang / yid mi dmigs pa dang / sdom pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bslab pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang / yo byad bsnyungs pa yang dag par blang ba bstan pa yongs su dag par shes pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the knowledge of the non-apprehension of the concentrations, the liberations, the meditations, and the absorptions.🔽 The letter is the teaching of the wisdom which destroys all the nets of false views.🔽 The meaning is the knowledge of the non-apprehension of false views and of wisdom.🔽 The letter is the teaching of the means of attaining the ten powers of the Tathagata.🔽 The meaning is the knowledge of the non-apprehension of the ten powers of the Tathagata and of the means of attaining them.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gnod sems dang / tha pa dang / skyon dang / khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa thams cad yang dag par 'joms shing bzod pa'i stobs dang nges pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gnod sems dang / tha pa dang / skyon dang / khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa thams cad yang dag par 'joms shing bzod pa'i stobs dang nges pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is the teaching of the knowledge of the unique way of the bodhisattva.🔽 The meaning is the knowledge of the non-apprehension of the unique way of the bodhisattva.🔽 The letter is the teaching of the knowledge of the unique way of the bodhisattva.🔽 The meaning is the knowledge of the non-apprehension of the unique way of the bodhisattva.🔽 The letter is the teaching of the knowledge of the unique way of the bodhisattva.🔽 The meaning is the knowledge of the non-apprehension of the unique way of the bodhisattva.🔽 The letter is the teaching of the knowledge of the unique way of the bodhisattva

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'o //
translated: The “meaning” is the acceptance of the non-arising of all dharmas.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa la brtson 'grus brtsams par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa la brtson 'grus brtsams par bstan pa'o //
translated: The “letter” is the teaching of the practice of the perfection of energy in the accomplishment of all the roots of virtue.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang blang ba dang dor ba la mi gnas pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang blang ba dang dor ba la mi gnas pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: The “meaning” is the energy that does not rest in either grasping or rejection.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The “letter” is the teaching of the concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa shes pa'o //
translated: The “meaning” is the knowledge of the absorption in cessation.

original: tshig 'bru zhes pa ni gang thos pa thams cad 'dzin pa shes rab kyi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes pa ni gang thos pa thams cad 'dzin pa shes rab kyi rtsa ba'o //
translated: The “letter” is the knowledge of the retention of all that one hears, which is the root of wisdom.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang ba 'dod du med pa'i don shes pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang ba 'dod du med pa'i don shes pa'o //
translated: The “meaning” is the knowledge of the meaning of non-desire.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The “letter” is the teaching of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sgrub pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sgrub pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: The “meaning” is the direct realization of the result of the practice of the factors of awakening.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam gyi bden pa yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam gyi bden pa yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The “letter” is the teaching of the truths of suffering, origination, and path.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'gog pa mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang 'gog pa mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: The “meaning” is the direct realization of cessation.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang ma rig pa la sogs pa rga shi'i bar du yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang ma rig pa la sogs pa rga shi'i bar du yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The “letter” is the teaching of ignorance up to old age and death.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang ma rig pa 'gog pa nas rga shi 'gog pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang ma rig pa 'gog pa nas rga shi 'gog pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The “meaning” is the cessation of ignorance up to the cessation of old age and death.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi tshogs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi tshogs bstan pa'o //
translated: The “letter” is the teaching of the accumulations of calm abiding and special insight.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang rig pa dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes so //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang rig pa dang rnam par grol ba'i ye shes so //
translated: The “meaning” is the knowledge of liberation.

original: @123b tshig 'dru zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / cha mnyam par spyod pa'i sems can rnams la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: @123b tshig 'dru zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / cha mnyam par spyod pa'i sems can rnams la bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is that which is taught to beings who are dominated by desire, hatred, ignorance, or a mixture of these three.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang sems rnam par grol ba mi 'khrugs pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang sems rnam par grol ba mi 'khrugs pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The meaning is the unshakable knowledge of the liberation of the mind.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sgrib pa dang sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sgrib pa dang sgrib par 'gyur ba'i chos yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is that which teaches the obscurations and the obscured.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes dang rnam par thar pa'o //
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes dang rnam par thar pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the knowledge and liberation that are free from obscurations.

original: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang bsngags pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan dang bsngags pa mtha' yas pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The letter is that which teaches the infinite qualities and praises of the Three Jewels.🔽 The meaning is the knowledge of the Three Jewels.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku mthong ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral zhing 'gog pa'i chos nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi yon tan sgrub pa'i ye shes so //🔽tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku mthong ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral zhing 'gog pa'i chos nyid dang / 'dus ma byas kyi sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi yon tan sgrub pa'i ye shes so // tshig 'bru zhes bya ba ni gang sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: The “meaning” is the vision of the Buddha’s Dharma Body, the reality of cessation free from passion, and the wisdom that accomplishes the qualities of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha which are uncompounded.

original: byang chub snying po la 'dug gi bar gyi byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi tshogs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub snying po la 'dug gi bar gyi byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi tshogs bstan pa'o //
translated: “The letter” is the teaching of the bodhisattva’s accumulation of good qualities from the first production of the thought of enlightenment until he sits on the seat of enlightenment.

original: don zhes bya ba ni gang sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ste /
analyzed: don zhes bya ba ni gang sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba ste /
translated: The “meaning” is the perfect enlightenment of the wisdom of omniscience in a single instant of thought.

original: mdor na gang chos kyi phyung po brgyad khri bzhi stong bstan pa 'di ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na gang chos kyi phyung po brgyad khri bzhi stong bstan pa 'di ni tshig 'bru zhes bya'o //
translated: In brief, the teaching of the eighty-four thousand component parts of the Dharma is called the “letter.”

original: gang sems can thams cad kyi skad dang / yi ge dang / tshig 'bru brjod du med pa'i don te /
analyzed: gang sems can thams cad kyi skad dang / yi ge dang / tshig 'bru brjod du med pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the inexpressible language, syllables, and words of all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la mi rton pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la mi rton pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “reliance on the meaning, not on the letter.”

original: de ltar khong du chud par byas la don gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khong du chud par byas la don gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: Having understood it in this way, one should follow the meaning.

original: yi ge'i rjes su 'brang ba ni mi bya bas /
analyzed: yi ge'i rjes su 'brang ba ni mi bya bas /
translated: One should not follow the letter.

original: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhe //
analyzed: gsang sngags rgyal po drug ldan zhe //
translated: The phrase “endowed with the six kings of mantra”

original: zhes bya ba'i sgra la ni bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgra la ni bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: should not be taken literally.

original: gnas skabs kyis na rton pa lhag ma gsum gyi rang bzhin yang rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir dri bar bya ste /🔽de la rnam par shes ba ni gang /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyis na rton pa lhag ma gsum gyi rang bzhin yang rnam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir dri bar bya ste / de la rnam par shes ba ni gang /
translated: In order to present the nature of the remaining three reliances in terms of their stages, one should ask the following questions:🔽What is consciousness?

original: ye shes ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is wisdom?

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi ste /
translated: “Consciousness” refers to the four abodes of consciousness.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam par shes pa gnas pa na gzugs la nye par 'gro zhing gnas pa dang / rnam par shes pa gnas pa na tshor ba la nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes la nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du byed la nye bar 'gro zhing gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gnas pa na gzugs la nye par 'gro zhing gnas pa dang / rnam par shes pa gnas pa na tshor ba la nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du shes la nye bar 'gro ba dang / 'du byed la nye bar 'gro zhing gnas pa ste /
translated: and when consciousness is present, it is present in relation to feeling, perception, and formations.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called consciousness.

original: de la ye shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ye shes gang zhe na /
translated: “What is wisdom?

original: gang phung po bzhi la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang phung po bzhi la gnas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: It is the thorough understanding of the aggregate of consciousness that is present in the four aggregates.

original: 'di ni ye shes @124a * //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes @124a * //
translated: This is called wisdom.

original: zhes bya'o // gzhan yang rnam par shes pa ni sa'i khams rnam par shes pa dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // gzhan yang rnam par shes pa ni sa'i khams rnam par shes pa dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: “Moreover, consciousness is the consciousness of the earth element, the consciousness of the water element, the consciousness of the fire element, and the consciousness of the wind element.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called consciousness.

original: gang khams rnam ba bzhi po 'di dag la gnas ba'i rnam par shes pa la chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa shes pa 'di ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang khams rnam ba bzhi po 'di dag la gnas ba'i rnam par shes pa la chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa shes pa 'di ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that consciousness, which is present in these four elements, is inseparable from the realm of phenomena is called wisdom.

original: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa ni gang mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la rnam par rig pa dang / de bzhin du rna bas shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams dang / snas shes par bya ba'i dri rnams dang / lces shes par bya ba'i ro rnams dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par shes pa ni gang mig gi rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams la rnam par rig pa dang / de bzhin du rna bas shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams dang / snas shes par bya ba'i dri rnams dang / lces shes par bya ba'i ro rnams dang /
translated: Moreover, consciousness is the awareness of forms that are objects of eye consciousness, and similarly, the awareness of sounds that are objects of ear consciousness, smells that are objects of nose consciousness, tastes that are objects of tongue consciousness,

original: lus kyis shes par bya ba'i reg bya rnams dang / yid kyis shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la rnam par rig pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyis shes par bya ba'i reg bya rnams dang / yid kyis shes par bya ba'i chos rnams la rnam par rig pa ste /
translated: tangibles that are objects of body consciousness, and mental phenomena that are objects of mind consciousness.

original: 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called consciousness.

original: gang yang nang nye bar zhi zhing phyi rol du rgyu ba med pa dang / ye shes la rton pas chos gang la yang mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang nang nye bar zhi zhing phyi rol du rgyu ba med pa dang / ye shes la rton pas chos gang la yang mi rtog rnam par mi rtog pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, that which is inwardly tranquil, does not move outwardly, and, by relying on wisdom, does not conceive of or discriminate any phenomenon is called wisdom.

original: gzhan yang dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / yid la byed pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / yongs su rtogs pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dmigs pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / yid la byed pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba dang / yongs su rtogs pa las rnam par shes pa skye ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, consciousness arises from an object, consciousness arises from attention, and consciousness arises from thorough understanding.

original: gang la 'dzin pa med pa dang ; mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / rnam par rig pa med pa dang / rtog pa med pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang la 'dzin pa med pa dang ; mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / rnam par rig pa med pa dang / rtog pa med pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is without grasping, without grasping at the highest, without reference, without cognition, and without conceptualization is called pristine wisdom.

original: gzhan yang 'dus byas rgyu ba'i chos rnams la rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dus byas rgyu ba'i chos rnams la rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: Moreover, consciousness arises in relation to conditioned phenomena that flow.

original: 'dus ma byas la ni rnam par shes pa rgyu ba med do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la ni rnam par shes pa rgyu ba med do //
translated: Consciousness does not flow in relation to the unconditioned.

original: gang 'dus ma byas su shes pa de ni ye shes so //
analyzed: gang 'dus ma byas su shes pa de ni ye shes so //
translated: To understand the unconditioned is pristine wisdom.

original: gzhan yang skye ba dang / 'jig pa la gnas pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang skye ba dang / 'jig pa la gnas pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, consciousness is based on arising and destruction.

original: mi 'jig pa la gnas pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jig pa la gnas pa ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Pristine wisdom is based on non-destruction.

original: mi skye ba dang mi 'gog pa la gnas pa ni ye shes te /
analyzed: mi skye ba dang mi 'gog pa la gnas pa ni ye shes te /
translated: Pristine wisdom is based on non-arising and non-cessation.

original: 'di ni ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ye shes la rton gyi rnam par shes pa la mi rton pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “reliance on wisdom, not on consciousness.”

original: de la nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang /
translated: What is a sūtra of definitive meaning?

original: drang pa'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: drang pa'i don gyi mdo sde ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is a sūtra of provisional meaning?

original: mdo sde gang dag lam la 'jug par bstan pa de dag ni drang pa'i don zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag lam la 'jug par bstan pa de dag ni drang pa'i don zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Sūtras that teach entry into the path are called sūtras of provisional meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //🔽mdo sde gang dag kun rdzob sgrub par bstan ba de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes @124b bya'o ;
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag 'bras bu la 'jug pa'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o // mdo sde gang dag kun rdzob sgrub par bstan ba de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes @124b bya'o ;
translated: Sūtras that teach for the sake of entry into the result are called sūtras of definitive meaning.🔽Sūtras that teach the establishment of the conventional are called sūtras of provisional meaning.

original: / mdo sde gang dag don dam pa bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / mdo sde gang dag don dam pa bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Sūtras that teach the ultimate are called sūtras of definitive meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag las dang bya ba la 'jug par bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag las dang bya ba la 'jug par bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Sūtras that teach engagement in actions and activities are called sūtras of provisional meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag las dang nyon mongs pa zad par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag las dang nyon mongs pa zad par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Sūtras that teach for the sake of eliminating actions and afflictions are called sūtras of definitive meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag kun nas nyon mongs pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag kun nas nyon mongs pa bshad par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that are taught in order to explain the afflictions are called interpretable in meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag rnam par byang ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes ya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag rnam par byang ba'i phyir bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes ya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that are taught in order to explain purification are called definitive in meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag 'khor ba la yid 'byung bar bya bar bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag 'khor ba la yid 'byung bar bya bar bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that are taught in order to make one feel revulsion toward cyclic existence are called interpretable in meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su med pa la 'jug par bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa gnyis su med pa la 'jug par bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that are taught in order to make one enter into the nonduality of cyclic existence and nirvāṇa are called definitive in meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge sna tshogs su bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge sna tshogs su bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that are taught with various words and letters are called interpretable in meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag zab mo mthong bar dka' ba khong du chud par dka' ba bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag zab mo mthong bar dka' ba khong du chud par dka' ba bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that are taught with the profound, difficult to see, and difficult to comprehend are called definitive in meaning.

original: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge mang zhing sems can gyis sems dga' bar bya ba stan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge mang zhing sems can gyis sems dga' bar bya ba stan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that are extensive in words and letters, and that teach to delight the minds of sentient beings, are called “interpretable in meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge nyung la sems nges par sems par byad par bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag tshig dang yi ge nyung la sems nges par sems par byad par bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: Those sūtras that are brief in words and letters, and that teach to make the mind certain, are called “definitive in meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / sgra rnam pa sna tshogs su bshad pa dang /
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / skyes bu dang / gang zag dang / shed las skyes dang / shed bu dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po dang / sgra rnam pa sna tshogs su bshad pa dang /
translated: Those sūtras that explain the self, sentient being, living being, nourished being, person, man, human, agent, and feeler, and that explain various sounds,

original: bdag po med pa la bdag po dang bcas par bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag po med pa la bdag po dang bcas par bstan pa de dag ni drang ba'i don zhes bya'o //
translated: and that teach that what is ownerless has an owner, are called “interpretable in meaning.”

original: mdo sde gang dag stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med pa dang / bdag med pa dang /
analyzed: mdo sde gang dag stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du mi byed pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / dngos po med pa dang / bdag med pa dang /
translated: Those sūtras that teach emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, non-performance, non-arising, non-occurrence, non-entity, selflessness,

original: sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang ; gang zag med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i bar du bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems can med pa dang / srog med pa dang ; gang zag med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i bar du bstan pa de dag ni nges pa'i don zhes bya ste /
translated: absence of sentient beings, absence of life-force, absence of person, absence of owner, up to the doors of liberation—those are called definitive meaning.

original: 'di ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde rton gyi drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde rton gyi drang ba'i don gyi mdo sde la mi rton pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘rely on the sūtras of definitive meaning, do not rely on the sūtras of provisional meaning.’

original: de la chos nyid ni gang /
analyzed: de la chos nyid ni gang /
translated: “What is the intrinsic nature?

original: gang zag ni gang zhe na /🔽gang gang zag @125a * //
analyzed: gang zag ni gang zhe na / gang gang zag @125a * //
translated: What is a person?”

original: tu lta ba la gnas te /
analyzed: tu lta ba la gnas te /
translated: “One who, while abiding in the view of a person,

original: gang chos kha cig la rtsom pa 'di ni gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang chos kha cig la rtsom pa 'di ni gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: composes some Dharma—this is called a person.

original: gang zag tu lta ba de'i rtsom pa yongs su shes pa 'di ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag tu lta ba de'i rtsom pa yongs su shes pa 'di ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The complete understanding of the composition of that view of a person—this is called the intrinsic nature.”

original: gzhan yang so so'i skye bo'i gang zag dang / so so'i skye bo'i dge ba'i gang zag dang dad bas rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag dang / brgyad pa'i gang zag dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i gang zag dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang so so'i skye bo'i gang zag dang / so so'i skye bo'i dge ba'i gang zag dang dad bas rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i gang zag dang / brgyad pa'i gang zag dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i gang zag dang /
translated: Furthermore, there are the person who is an ordinary being, the person who is an ordinary being and a virtuous person, the person who is a follower of faith, the person who is a follower of reality, the person who is on the eighth [stage], the person who is a stream enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ongs pa'i gang zag dang / phyir ma 'ong ba'i gang zag dang / dgra bcom pa'i gang zag dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gang zag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag dang / gang zag gcig 'jig rten du byung na skye bo mang po la phan pa dang /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ongs pa'i gang zag dang / phyir ma 'ong ba'i gang zag dang / dgra bcom pa'i gang zag dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gang zag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gang zag dang / gang zag gcig 'jig rten du byung na skye bo mang po la phan pa dang /
translated: the person who is a once returner, the person who is a non-returner, the person who is an arhat, the person who is a pratyekabuddha, the person who is a bodhisattva, and the person who, when he appears in the world, is for the benefit of many people,

original: skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi'i skye bo phal po che'i don gyi phyir /
analyzed: skye bo mang po la bde ba dang / 'jig rten la snying brtse ba dang / lha dang mi'i skye bo phal po che'i don gyi phyir /
translated: for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the sake of the great multitude of gods and humans,

original: phan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan pa'i phyir /
translated: for the benefit,

original: bde ba'i phyir lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang zag gcig po 'jig rten du byung ste /🔽de ni gang zag ces bya'o//🔽gang zag gi sgra de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob kyi tshig gi gnas kyi sems can rnams drang ba'i phyir bstan pa ste /🔽de la gang zag mngon pa zhe na pa de dag ni rton pa ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i phyir lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang zag gcig po 'jig rten du byung ste / de ni gang zag ces bya'o// gang zag gi sgra de dag thams cad ni de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob kyi tshig gi gnas kyi sems can rnams drang ba'i phyir bstan pa ste / de la gang zag mngon pa zhe na pa de dag ni rton pa ma yin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: For the sake of happiness, the Blessed Buddha, the Teacher of gods and humans, the One and Only, appears in the world.🔽This is called a person.🔽The Thus-Gone One has taught all these terms for persons in order to guide beings who are attached to the idea of a real person.🔽Those who are attached to the idea of a real person are called unreliable.🔽🔽

original: de dag rton pa la gzung ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang chos nyid la rton cig gang zag la ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so //🔽de la chos nyid dang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
