original: 'gyur ba med pa dang / sgro btags pa med pa dang / bya ba med dang / rnam par bya ba med pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / rab tu mi gnas pa dang / rtsa ba med pa dang / rtsa ba med pa dang /
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa dang / sgro btags pa med pa dang / bya ba med dang / rnam par bya ba med pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / rab tu mi gnas pa dang / rtsa ba med pa dang / rtsa ba med pa dang /
translated: and without any basis.

original: thams cad du mnyam pa med pa dbang /
analyzed: thams cad du mnyam pa med pa dbang /
translated: It is the same everywhere, without any distinction.🔽It is the same in the same, the same in the different, and the same in the same and different.🔽It is nonconceptual, non-arising, and non-ceasing.

original: mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / rtsom pa med pa dang / chos thams cad la skyon med pa rnyed pa dang /
analyzed: mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa dang / mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dag la mnyam pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / rtsom pa med pa dang / chos thams cad la skyon med pa rnyed pa dang /
translated: It is the discovery of the flawlessness of all phenomena.

original: shin tu nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid 'di ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu nam mkha'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid 'di ni chos nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the intrinsic nature.

original: de la gang dag chos nyid la rton pa dag ni khams gang la yang mi rton no //
analyzed: de la gang dag chos nyid la rton pa dag ni khams gang la yang mi rton no //
translated: Those who rely on the intrinsic nature do not rely on any element.

original: de bas na chos kyi sgo'i tshul la 'jug pa 'dis cho thams cad @125b la rton pa'i phyir chos thams cad chos nyid kho nar 'gyur ba 'di ni chos nyid la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi sgo'i tshul la 'jug pa 'dis cho thams cad @125b la rton pa'i phyir chos thams cad chos nyid kho nar 'gyur ba 'di ni chos nyid la rton gyi gang zag la mi rton pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since all dharmas are reduced to the nature of reality by this entry into the way of the Dharma-gate, this is called “reliance on the nature of reality, not on the individual. ”

original: gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis su med par 'byung ba dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Arising as non-dual” means

original: sngags kyi tshul gyis ni shes rab dang thabs ni gnyis so //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul gyis ni shes rab dang thabs ni gnyis so //
translated: by the way of mantra, wisdom and means are two.

original: de gcig tu gyur pa ni gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: de gcig tu gyur pa ni gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: Their unity is non-duality.

original: shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid ni gnyis su med pa yin par 'dod de de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs gnyis su med pa bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid ni gnyis su med pa yin par 'dod de de las byung ba'o //
translated: The non-duality of wisdom and means, the nature of great bliss, is asserted to be non-duality, and it arises from that.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul gyis ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'am /
translated: By the way of the perfections, the apprehended and the apprehender,

original: bdag dang bdag gi 'am /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi 'am /
translated: or self and what belongs to self,

original: shes pa dang shes bya ste ji srid du yid rnam par g-yo bde srid du ni thams cad gnyis so //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya ste ji srid du yid rnam par g-yo bde srid du ni thams cad gnyis so //
translated: or cognition and the cognized—as long as the mind moves in duality, everything is dual.

original: g-yo ba thams cad dang bral zhing spros pa med pa chos thams cad bdag med pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku 'byung ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba thams cad dang bral zhing spros pa med pa chos thams cad bdag med pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku 'byung ste /
translated: The body of reality, which is the nature of all things, the non-duality of the selflessness of all things, free from all movement and without conceptual elaboration, arises.

original: de bas na gnyis su med par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnyis su med par 'byung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it arises as non-dual.

original: gnyis su med par 'byung ba yang mi skye ba'i rnam pas khyad par du dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis su med par 'byung ba yang mi skye ba'i rnam pas khyad par du dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to distinguish the non-dual arising by way of the aspect of non-production,

original: mi skye chos can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi skye chos can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “having the nature of non-production.”

original: skye ba med pa'i chos gang la yod pa de ni 'dir mi skye ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i chos gang la yod pa de ni 'dir mi skye ba'i chos can no //
translated: That which has the nature of non-production of any phenomenon is here called “having the nature of non-production.”

original: 'dir yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa ste /
translated: Here, it is the non-production of the imagined nature.

original: kun brtags pa yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa yin la /
translated: The imagined is the aspect of apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi tshul gyis ni don dam par skye ba yod do zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams dang / mdo sde ba dang / sems tsam pa rnams 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi tshul gyis ni don dam par skye ba yod do zhes bye brag tu smra ba rnams dang / mdo sde ba dang / sems tsam pa rnams 'dod de /
translated: The Proponents of Mind Only, the Sautrāntikas, and the Vaibhāṣikas assert that, by way of the dependent nature, there is ultimately production.

original: don 'di la gtan tshigs ni //
analyzed: don 'di la gtan tshigs ni //
translated: The reason for this is as follows.

original: kun brtags pa yi ngo bo yis //
analyzed: kun brtags pa yi ngo bo yis //
translated: By the imagined nature,

original: chos rnams thams cad skye ba med //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad skye ba med //
translated: all phenomena are non-arisen.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la gnas na ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la gnas na ni //
translated: When one abides in the dependent,

original: mi rnams rnam rtog skye bar 'gyur ;🔽/ zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi rnams rnam rtog skye bar 'gyur ; / zhes zer ro //
translated: concepts arise for people.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is not correct,🔽because the explanation that there is no arising from the dependent nature appears in the sūtras.

original: gzhan gyi dbang las skye ba med par bshad pa mdo sde dag las snang ba'i phyir rol / de yang 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang las skye ba med par bshad pa mdo sde dag las snang ba'i phyir rol / de yang 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa'i mdo las mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid dang /
translated: Moreover, the noble Sūtra Unraveling the Intention says that the Buddha taught the non-entityness of all phenomena with three intentions:🔽the intention of the non-entityness of nature,🔽the intention of the non-entityness of arising,🔽and the intention of the ultimate non-entityness.

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la dgongs nas ngas chos thams cad dngos po med pa /
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la dgongs nas ngas chos thams cad dngos po med pa /
translated: He said, “I taught that all phenomena are unreal,

original: skye ba med pa /
analyzed: skye ba med pa /
translated: unarisen,

original: 'gag pa med pa /
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa /
translated: unceasing,

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: primordially peaceful,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs sa su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs sa su mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: and naturally in a state of nirvāṇa.

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the non-entityness of nature of all phenomena?

original: kun brtags pa'i @126a * //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i @126a * //
translated: It is the imagined nature.

original: mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the characteristic of that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni ming dang brdar rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid yin gyi /
translated: Because that is the characteristic of the establishment of names and signs.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis phung po dang khams la sogs ba 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis phung po dang khams la sogs ba 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But the own-characteristics and the universal characteristics of the aggregates, elements, etc., whether compounded or uncompounded, are not established.

original: de'i phyir de ni mtshan nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni mtshan nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that they are without characteristics.

original: chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhen /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhen /
translated: What is the essential no-essence of arising of phenomena?

original: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the relative nature of phenomena.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis 'byung ba yin gyi /🔽bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni rkyen gzhan gyi stobs kyis 'byung ba yin gyi / bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: Because that arises by the power of other conditions.🔽It does not arise by itself.

original: gang yang rang nyid med pa de ni skye ba med de /
analyzed: gang yang rang nyid med pa de ni skye ba med de /
translated: And that which does not exist by itself does not arise.

original: skye ba med pa la ni ngo bo nyid med pas de'i phyir de ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa la ni ngo bo nyid med pas de'i phyir de ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that which is not produced does not have an intrinsic nature, therefore it is called the “intrinsic nature of non-production.”

original: chos rnams kyi don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhen /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhen /
translated: What is the ultimate intrinsic naturelessness of phenomena?

original: chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is the perfected characteristic of phenomena.

original: de yang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de yang don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: That is also called the “ultimate intrinsic naturelessness.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos rnams kyi chos bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni de dag gi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: That which is the objective selflessness of phenomena is called their “intrinsic naturelessness.”

original: de'i don dam pa ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pas de'i phyir don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don dam pa ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis rab tu phye ba yin pas de'i phyir don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Since the ultimate is distinguished by the intrinsic naturelessness of phenomena, therefore it is called the “ultimate intrinsic naturelessness.”

original: 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha'i me tog ji lta ba de lta bur ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha'i me tog ji lta ba de lta bur ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid blta bar bya'o //
translated: For example, just as a sky-flower should be seen as characteristic intrinsic naturelessness.

original: 'di lta ste dper na sgyu ma byas pa ji lta ba de lta bur ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na sgyu ma byas pa ji lta ba de lta bur ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as an illusion is created, so should one view the lack of entityness of production.

original: 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid tsam gyis rab tu phye ba dang thams cad du song ba ji lta ba de lta bur ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med bde las chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid med pa nyid tsam gyis rab tu phye ba dang thams cad du song ba ji lta ba de lta bur ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med bde las chos bdag med pas rab tu phye ba
translated: Just as the lack of entityness of form in space is distinguished by mere absence of entityness and is all-pervasive, so should one view the ultimate lack of entityness distinguished by the objective selflessness and

original: dang / thams cad du song ba gcig par blta bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: dang / thams cad du song ba gcig par blta bar bya ba ste /
translated: all-pervading.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa yang ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum po de dag la dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes ngas bstan to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa yang ngo bo nyid med pa rnam pa gsum po de dag la dgongs nas chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes ngas bstan to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, intending the three kinds of lack of entityness, I have taught that all phenomena are natureless.

original: lung 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad kyi rigs pas kyang ji ltar bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: lung 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad kyi rigs pas kyang ji ltar bstan par bya ste /
translated: Not only is this taught in scripture, but it can be demonstrated by reasoning as well.

original: dngos po rnams skye bar gyur pa na rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i rgyu las sam /
analyzed: dngos po rnams skye bar gyur pa na rang gi ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i rgyu las sam /
translated: When things are produced, do they arise from a cause that is their own nature?

original: gzhan par gyur pa'i rgyu las sam /
analyzed: gzhan par gyur pa'i rgyu las sam /
translated: Or would it arise from a cause that is different?🔽Or would it arise from something that is both different and not different?

original: tha dad pa 'am tha dad pa ma yin pa las sam /
analyzed: tha dad pa 'am tha dad pa ma yin pa las sam /
translated: Or would it arise from something that is neither different nor not different?

original: rgyu dang bya ba la ltos pa med pa las skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu dang bya ba la ltos pa med pa las skye bar 'gyur /
translated: Or would it arise without relying on a cause and action?

original: rgyu yod pa'am @126b rgyu med par btags dang dum zhig gis bya ba'i dngos po gcig bskyed par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rgyu yod pa'am @126b rgyu med par btags dang dum zhig gis bya ba'i dngos po gcig bskyed par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Would a single thing be produced by a cause that exists or by a cause that does not exist?

original: yang na dngos po du ma bskyed par 'gyur ba'am /🔽yang na gcig pu nyid kyi rang bzhin gcig bskyed par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yang na dngos po du ma bskyed par 'gyur ba'am / yang na gcig pu nyid kyi rang bzhin gcig bskyed par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Or would many things be produced?🔽Or would a single thing that has the nature of oneness be produced?

original: yang na rang bzhin du ma skyes par 'gyur ba'am /🔽rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yang na rang bzhin du ma skyes par 'gyur ba'am / rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Or would a thing that has many natures be produced?🔽Would the effect arise from a cause that has ceased?

original: ma zhig pa las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma zhig pa las 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or would the effect arise from a cause that has not ceased?

original: de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa du ma 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par rtog pa du ma 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, many conceptual thoughts would arise.

original: phyogs de dag thams cad kyang rang gi phyogs la mngon par zhen pa la mchog tu brtson pas bsgrubs pa'i brtags pa tsam la snying po nyid du sems par zad do //
analyzed: phyogs de dag thams cad kyang rang gi phyogs la mngon par zhen pa la mchog tu brtson pas bsgrubs pa'i brtags pa tsam la snying po nyid du sems par zad do //
translated: All of these positions are merely imputed by those who are extremely devoted to their own positions, and they are considered to be the essence.

original: de yang rgyu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'dra bar byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de yang rgyu'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i 'bras bu ni rgyu dang 'dra bar byung ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, an effect that has the nature of a cause arises in a way that is similar to the cause.

original: de bas na de las skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na de las skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it does not arise from that.

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin dang 'dra bar 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba mi gtsang bar 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bdag tu gyur pa ni gtso bo'i ming can gyi rgyu zhes bya ba de skye ba med pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva sogs pa ltar rgyu nyid dang mi ldan no
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin dang 'dra bar 'byung ba'i phyir skye ba mi gtsang bar 'dod pa'i 'bras bu bdag tu gyur pa ni gtso bo'i ming can gyi rgyu zhes bya ba de skye ba med pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva sogs pa ltar rgyu nyid dang mi ldan no
translated: Because it arises in a way that is similar to the nature of the cause, the effect that is asserted to be pure, which is the self, does not arise, like the horn of a donkey, and so on. Therefore, it is not a cause.

original: // de yang /
analyzed: // de yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: rang 'dra de ni gzhan min phyir //
analyzed: rang 'dra de ni gzhan min phyir //
translated: because that which is similar to itself is not different,

original: rgyu ni rgyu ma yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu ni rgyu ma yin par 'gyur //
translated: the cause would not be a cause.

original: ma skyes phyir yang gang gi //
analyzed: ma skyes phyir yang gang gi //
translated: Also, because it does not arise,

original: rgyu min pa ni rgyu ru 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu min pa ni rgyu ru 'gyur //
translated: that which is not a cause would be a cause.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba yang dngos po gnyis la ltos nas bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba yang dngos po gnyis la ltos nas bshad pa yin la /
translated: “Other” is explained in terms of two things.

original: dngos po gnyis pa ni 'di na 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: dngos po gnyis pa ni 'di na 'bras bu ste /
translated: The second thing is the effect here.

original: de yang rgyu yod pa'i dus na ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rgyu yod pa'i dus na ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it does not exist at the time when the cause exists.

original: de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It does not exist.

original: de gang la ltos nas de dag la gzhan nyid du don dam par khas len te /🔽ba long gi rva ltos pa'am /
analyzed: de gang la ltos nas de dag la gzhan nyid du don dam par khas len te / ba long gi rva ltos pa'am /
translated: In terms of what would it be accepted as ultimately other?🔽The horn of a rabbit is not truly existent as other in dependence on a horse,

original: mi'i rva ltos nas rta'i gzhan pa nyid du yang dag par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mi'i rva ltos nas rta'i gzhan pa nyid du yang dag par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: nor is the horn of a human.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyus kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mi bskyed de /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyus kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu mi bskyed de /
translated: A desired cause also does not produce a desired effect,

original: gzhan du gyur pas mngon par 'dod pa'i don bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pas mngon par 'dod pa'i don bzhin no //
translated: because it is transformed, like an undesired effect.

original: 'bras pu 'dod pa yang gzhan du gyur pas 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras pu 'dod pa yang gzhan du gyur pas 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: A desired effect also is not desired because it is transformed,🔽like the other.

original: de ni gzhan bzhin no //🔽de yang / rang gi ngo bo ma byung bar //
analyzed: de ni gzhan bzhin no // de yang / rang gi ngo bo ma byung bar //
translated: Moreover,🔽How could something be other than what it is

original: gang zhig gang pas gzhan du 'dod //🔽ba lang rva 'am mi rva las //
analyzed: gang zhig gang pas gzhan du 'dod // ba lang rva 'am mi rva las //
translated: by virtue of not having arisen from itself?🔽The horn of a horse is not held to be other

original: rta yi rva gzhan 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: rta yi rva gzhan 'dod ma yin //
translated: than the horn of a cow or the horn of a human.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: rkyen gzhan gyis kyang don dam par mig la sogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rkyen gzhan gyis kyang don dam par mig la sogs pas mig gi rnam par shes pa bskyed pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, ultimately, the eye consciousness is not produced by the eye, etc., because of the other condition.

original: gzhan du gyur pas bi bar la sogs pa bzhin no //🔽mig @127a * //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pas bi bar la sogs pa bzhin no // mig @127a * //
translated: It is like the case of the son of a barren woman, etc.

original: la sogs pa'i rgyur rnam par grags pa rnams kyang mig la sogs pa'i rgyur mi 'dod de //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i rgyur rnam par grags pa rnams kyang mig la sogs pa'i rgyur mi 'dod de //
translated: The eye, etc., are not accepted as the cause of the eye consciousness, etc.,

original: gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because of the other condition,

original: snga nas med pa'i phyir bum pa dang snam bu bzhin no //
analyzed: snga nas med pa'i phyir bum pa dang snam bu bzhin no //
translated: like the case of a pot and a cloth, because of non-existence prior .

original: gnyis ka las skyed ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: gnyis ka las skyed ba mi rigs te /
translated: Production from both is not reasonable,

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag ni phan tshun 'gal bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag gcig pu 'dres nas gnas par gyur pa mi srid do //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo dag ni phan tshun 'gal bar gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag gcig pu 'dres nas gnas par gyur pa mi srid do //
translated: because the characteristics of the different and the non-different are mutually exclusive, and it is impossible for them to be mixed together in one.

original: de bas na 'di ltar brjod du med pa'i phyogs kyang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar brjod du med pa'i phyogs kyang mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore, the position of the inexpressible is also not reasonable,

original: ma brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par rtog pa las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: ma brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par rtog pa las 'das pa ste /
translated: because of the nature of the unanalyzed, and because of the transcendence of the conceptual thoughts of the different and the non-different.

original: gang de nyid 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i gzugs dor ba ste /
analyzed: gang de nyid 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i gzugs dor ba ste /
translated: “It is not this very thing that is that” means that its form is discarded.

original: de nyid ni tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni tha dad pa'o //
translated: That is difference.

original: de dgag pa ni tha dad pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dgag pa ni tha dad pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The negation of that is non-difference.

original: dngos po rnams rnam pa gzhan gang zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rnam pa gzhan gang zhig las 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: From what other aspect do things arise?

original: rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang skye ba mi rigs te /
translated: It is also unreasonable that they arise without a cause,

original: rtag tu yod pa dang med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa dang med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that they would always exist or not exist.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: It does not arise from itself, nor from another,

original: gnyis las min rgyu med min /🔽dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las min rgyu med min / dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: nor from both, nor without a cause.🔽Nowhere do any things

original: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: ever arise at all.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: de la bdag las zhes bya ba ni grangs can no //
analyzed: de la bdag las zhes bya ba ni grangs can no //
translated: In this regard, “from itself” is the Sāṃkhya.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa kha cig dang bye brag pa sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa kha cig dang bye brag pa sogs pa'o //
translated: “From another” is some Buddhists and the Vaiśeṣikas, and so on.

original: gnyi ga las zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa pa dang gcer bu pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga las zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa pa dang gcer bu pa'o //
translated: “From both” is the Mīmāṃsakas and the Jains.🔽“

original: rgyu med par smra ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dang rang bzhin rgyur smra ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa dang rang bzhin rgyur smra ba'o //
translated: The Lokayatas and those who maintain that things arise from self are proponents of causelessness.

original: da ni rgyu'i rang bzhin brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rgyu'i rang bzhin brtag par bya ste /
translated: Now, the nature of the cause will be examined.

original: yod pa las kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: yod pa las kyang mi skye ste /
translated: An existent does not arise,

original: ngo bo nyid yongs su grub zin pa ma 'ongs pa'i dus skye ba'i don du mi rigs so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yongs su grub zin pa ma 'ongs pa'i dus skye ba'i don du mi rigs so //
translated: because it is illogical that what has already been fully accomplished in the future arises.

original: gzhan du gal te yod par skye bar gyur na ni skyes zin pa yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du gal te yod par skye bar gyur na ni skyes zin pa yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if an existent were to arise, then what has already arisen would arise again.

original: med pa las kyang mi skye ste /
analyzed: med pa las kyang mi skye ste /
translated: A nonexistent also does not arise,

original: shin tu gzugs med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang 'dra zhing /
analyzed: shin tu gzugs med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang 'dra zhing /
translated: because it is like the utterly nonexistent horn of an ass and so on,

original: skye bar 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye bar 'jug pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of engagement in arising.

original: gzhan du 'di dag thams cad med par 'gyur zhing gang gi phyir dngos po'i phyogs gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig las kyang dngos po thams cad rtag tu 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'di dag thams cad med par 'gyur zhing gang gi phyir dngos po'i phyogs gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig las kyang dngos po thams cad rtag tu 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, all these would be nonexistent, and because anything whatsoever among things would arise from anything whatsoever, there would be no definite connection between cause and effect.

original: gal te so so'i nus pa des pa med par 'gyur yang dngos po 'di rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: gal te so so'i nus pa des pa med par 'gyur yang dngos po 'di rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: If the individual capacities were not distinct, then the individual capacities of these things would be distinct.

original: dngos po de rnams las cung zad cig skye bar 'gyur bas khyad @127b par med kyang thams cad med pa ma yin no zhen /
analyzed: dngos po de rnams las cung zad cig skye bar 'gyur bas khyad @127b par med kyang thams cad med pa ma yin no zhen /
translated: Since some of those things would arise, there would be no difference, but not all would be nonexistent.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: gal te 'bras bu rnams dang 'dres pa'i gzugs rnams rkyen du gyur na ni de'i cho de rnams kyi so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu dang 'brel par 'gyur bas 'bras bu gang zhig las nus pa nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu rnams dang 'dres pa'i gzugs rnams rkyen du gyur na ni de'i cho de rnams kyi so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu dang 'brel par 'gyur bas 'bras bu gang zhig las nus pa nges pa yin te /
translated: If forms mixed with effects were conditions, then they would be related to the individual effects that are distinct from them. Therefore, from which effect is the capacity determined?

original: de ltar na nus pa des pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na nus pa des pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the capacity would remain distinct.

original: de bas na thams cad las thams cad du skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs su smra ba'i nyes pa dang 'dres par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad las thams cad du skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs su smra ba'i nyes pa dang 'dres par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to avert the consequence that everything would arise from everything, and one would be mired in the faults of the positions of existence and nonexistence.

original: tshul gnyi ga las kyang skye ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul gnyi ga las kyang skye ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor does it arise from both,

original: gcig la ngo bo nyid gnyis su 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: gcig la ngo bo nyid gnyis su 'gyur ba med de /
translated: because a single thing cannot have two natures.

original: gcig pa nyid dang gnyis nyid ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //🔽de yang / yod dam med pa'i don la yang //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dang gnyis nyid ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro // de yang / yod dam med pa'i don la yang //
translated: This is because singularity and duality are mutually exclusive.🔽Moreover,🔽Conditions are not suitable

original: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: rkyen ni rung ba ma yin te //
translated: For an existent or nonexistent object.

original: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: yod na rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If it exists, what is the use of a condition?

original: med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
analyzed: med na gang gi rkyen du 'gyur //
translated: If it does not exist, what would be the condition?🔽If a phenomenon is neither

original: gang cho chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi sgrub pa //
analyzed: gang cho chos ni yod pa dang // med dang yod med mi sgrub pa //
translated: Established as existent, nonexistent, or both existent and nonexistent,

original: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu yin zhes ;
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub byed rgyu yin zhes ;
translated: How could it be a cause that establishes something?

original: / de lta yin na mi rigs so //
analyzed: / de lta yin na mi rigs so //
translated: It is illogical that it could be.🔽The effect does not exist in the assembly

original: rkyen rnams so sor 'dus pa las //🔽'bras bu de ni med pa nyid //🔽rkyen rnams la ni gang med pa //
analyzed: rkyen rnams so sor 'dus pa las // 'bras bu de ni med pa nyid // rkyen rnams la ni gang med pa //
translated: Of conditions individually or all together.🔽How could that which does not exist in conditions

original: de ni rkyen gyis ji ltar bskyed //🔽ci ste de ni med par yang //
analyzed: de ni rkyen gyis ji ltar bskyed // ci ste de ni med par yang //
translated: Be produced by conditions?

original: rkyen de dag las skye 'gyur na //🔽rkyen min las kyang 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: rkyen de dag las skye 'gyur na // rkyen min las kyang 'bras bu ni //
translated: If it were to arise from those conditions🔽Even though it does not exist,🔽Why would an effect not arise

original: ci yi phyir na skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na skye mi 'gyur //
translated: From nonconditions as well?

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: rgyu nams kyang gal te mang pos 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gcig bskyed par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rgyu nams kyang gal te mang pos 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gcig bskyed par 'gyur ram /
translated: If many causes generate a single nature of an effect,

original: de lta ma yin gyi lhan cig byed ba'i grogs tha dad pa'i rang bzhin rnams 'bras bu gcig bskyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin gyi lhan cig byed ba'i grogs tha dad pa'i rang bzhin rnams 'bras bu gcig bskyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: then it is not so. Different natures that are cooperative conditions become the cause of generating a single effect.

original: bye brag rnams bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bye brag rnams bye brag med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The differences would be without difference.

original: de la bye brag med pa rnams kyang bye brag med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la bye brag med pa rnams kyang bye brag med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And those without difference would not be without difference.

original: rgyu'i dbye ba yang bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i dbye ba yang bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the divisions of the cause are also without difference.

original: gal te bye brag can las bye brag can nyid du 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te bye brag can las bye brag can nyid du 'gyur na ni /
translated: If something with difference were to arise from something with difference,

original: bye brag med pa las kyang bye brag med pa nyid du rigs te /
analyzed: bye brag med pa las kyang bye brag med pa nyid du rigs te /
translated: then it would be logical that something without difference would arise from something without difference.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i nges pa la sogs pa yang rgyu nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i nges pa la sogs pa yang rgyu nyid ma yin te /
translated: Also, the ascertained and so on that are imputed are not the cause.

original: rgyu med pa can dang / sna tshogs pa'i bye brag can dang bye brag med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa can dang / sna tshogs pa'i bye brag can dang bye brag med par 'gyur te /
translated: Because they would be without cause, and the difference of the various things would be without difference.

original: de las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang mi srid de /
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa'i dngos po 'ga' yang mi srid de /
translated: Because it is impossible for anything to exist apart from that.

original: dngos po thams cad kyang gzhan gyi dbang las mi skye ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyang gzhan gyi dbang las mi skye ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that all things would not arise from other.

original: rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa las 'bras bu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa kun du skye par 'dod na ni rgyu dang bya bas rnam par @128a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa las 'bras bu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa kun du skye par 'dod na ni rgyu dang bya bas rnam par @128a * //
translated: If you assert that the nature of the effect arises from the nature of the cause, then the effect would be established by the cause and action.

original: bsgrubs pa rnams 'tshol bar 'gyur bas rgya'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par rnams ji ltar yul dang dbang po dang yid la byed pa'i stobs las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa yang yul las de mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: bsgrubs pa rnams 'tshol bar 'gyur bas rgya'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par rnams ji ltar yul dang dbang po dang yid la byed pa'i stobs las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa yang yul las de mi 'byung zhing /
translated: Therefore, how could consciousness arise from the power of the object, sense faculty, and attention?

original: dbang po las kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: dbang po las kyang ma yin la /
translated: It does not arise from the object.🔽It does not arise from the sense faculty.

original: yid la byed pa'i las kyang ma yin te //
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i las kyang ma yin te //
translated: It does not arise from attention.

original: dbang po las yul la 'dzin pa so sor nges par 'gyur gyi gzhan las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las yul la 'dzin pa so sor nges par 'gyur gyi gzhan las ni ma yin no //
translated: The apprehension of the object occurs from the sense faculty, not from anything else.

original: de bzhin du yid la byed pa de nyid las khong du chud par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid la byed pa de nyid las khong du chud par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Similarly, understanding occurs from that very attention.

original: tshul gzhan las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshul gzhan las ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not occur from anything else.

original: rgyu dang bya ba dang yul sna tshogs nyid kyang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi dbye ba'i rnam par dbye ba med pa'i tshul nyid las dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang bya ba dang yul sna tshogs nyid kyang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gyi dbye ba'i rnam par dbye ba med pa'i tshul nyid las dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The various causes, actions, and objects are not observed to be different from the nature of the effect.

original: de ni 'dir thub rgyal gyi gzhung la brten pa dang 'dra bar khas lan pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dir thub rgyal gyi gzhung la brten pa dang 'dra bar khas lan pa ste /
translated: Here, the opponent’s position is similar to that of the Mīmāṃsakas.

original: ji ltar dngos po 'ga' zhig gi 'bras bu'i khyad par dag kyang de dang tha mi dad pa nyid sna tshogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po 'ga' zhig gi 'bras bu'i khyad par dag kyang de dang tha mi dad pa nyid sna tshogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the specific effects of some entity are not different from it, they are not diverse.

original: sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa nyid ni phan tshun 'gal ba nyid yin no //🔽yul rnams su snang ba la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa dang tha mi dad pa can du yul ji lta ba rnams kyis byed do //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa dang gcig pa nyid ni phan tshun 'gal ba nyid yin no // yul rnams su snang ba la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa dang tha mi dad pa can du yul ji lta ba rnams kyis byed do //
translated: Diversity and oneness are mutually exclusive.🔽The appearance of objects, etc., are not different from consciousness. They are produced by objects as they are.

original: de bzhin du de dang tha mi dad pa'i khong du tshul la sogs pa dang / yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang sna tshogs pa nyid las ldog bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin du de dang tha mi dad pa'i khong du tshul la sogs pa dang / yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams kyis kyang sna tshogs pa nyid las ldog bar 'gyur la /
translated: In the same way, the diversity of objects, etc., is eliminated by the fact that they are not different from consciousness.

original: de bas na nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur bar khyad par gyi 'bras bu las tha dad pa nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: de bas na nyes pa 'dir mi 'gyur bar khyad par gyi 'bras bu las tha dad pa nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, we maintain that the special effect is different from the action.

original: de ltan yang rgyu dang bya ba las de rnams nyid dang nye bar ldan pas na 'bras bu de rgyu med par snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltan yang rgyu dang bya ba las de rnams nyid dang nye bar ldan pas na 'bras bu de rgyu med par snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But even so, since the effect is connected with the action and the cause, the effect would appear to be causeless.

original: bya ba tha dad nyid min yang //
analyzed: bya ba tha dad nyid min yang //
translated: Even though the action is not different,

original: bye brag dag ni gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: bye brag dag ni gnyis su 'dod //
translated: the particulars are held to be twofold.

original: dbye ba gzhan yin de yi phyir //
analyzed: dbye ba gzhan yin de yi phyir //
translated: The distinction is different from that,

original: khyod kyi dbang phyug gis sprul gang //
analyzed: khyod kyi dbang phyug gis sprul gang //
translated: so your God is not the creator.

original: shes pa'i tshul las gzhan min pas //
analyzed: shes pa'i tshul las gzhan min pas //
translated: Since the creation is not different from the mode of cognition,

original: de yi gzugs las byung ma yin //
analyzed: de yi gzugs las byung ma yin //
translated: it does not arise from the form.

original: de dang 'dra ba gzhan min pas //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba gzhan min pas //
translated: Since it is not another similar to that,

original: gzugs kyang 'dir ni byung ba yin //🔽gang gis 'byung dang mi 'byung ba //
analyzed: gzugs kyang 'dir ni byung ba yin // gang gis 'byung dang mi 'byung ba //
translated: the form also does not arise here.🔽Since it is not the creator of beings,

original: de bzhin skye bo skyed po min //
analyzed: de bzhin skye bo skyed po min //
translated: it is not the creator.

original: gcig tu gyur ba 'gal med pa //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur ba 'gal med pa //
translated: The noncontradictory oneness

original: cig car du ni de nyid smos //
analyzed: cig car du ni de nyid smos //
translated: is said to be reality.

original: gal te 'di dag gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag gzhan ma yin //
translated: If these are not different,

original: rnam par dbye ba gang gis byas //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba gang gis byas //
translated: by what distinction are they made?

original: smras pa'i nyes par thal 'gyur bas //
analyzed: smras pa'i nyes par thal 'gyur bas //
translated: The fault of the assertion is demonstrated by the reductio.

original: glang po'i khrus dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: glang po'i khrus dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: It is like the bathing of the elephant.

original: gal te rgyu'i dngos po gcig 'bras bu gcig bskyed par 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i dngos po gcig 'bras bu gcig bskyed par 'dod na //
translated: If one maintains that a single entity of cause produces a single effect,

original: de lta ni 'on pa dang long ba la sogs par thal bar @128b 'gyur ;🔽mig la sogs pa dang ldan cig 'byung pa'i skad cig phyi mas bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung po //
analyzed: de lta ni 'on pa dang long ba la sogs par thal bar @128b 'gyur ; mig la sogs pa dang ldan cig 'byung pa'i skad cig phyi mas bskyed pa'i rnam par shes pa mi 'byung po //
translated: then it follows that the blind and the deaf, etc.🔽are not produced by the eye, etc. because the consciousness produced by the latter does not occur in the next moment of its occurrence,

original: rnam par shes pas bskyed pa nyid yin na ni rang gi cha skad cig ma phyi ma dang ma phrad pas skad cig ma gnyis pa la mig la sogs pa med pa'i phyir rong ba la sogs pa de nyid du thal ba ni bzlog bar dga'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pas bskyed pa nyid yin na ni rang gi cha skad cig ma phyi ma dang ma phrad pas skad cig ma gnyis pa la mig la sogs pa med pa'i phyir rong ba la sogs pa de nyid du thal ba ni bzlog bar dga'o //
translated: and if it is produced by consciousness, then the eye, etc. do not exist in the second moment because they do not contact the next moment of their own part.

original: de bas na bya ba dang byed pa po dang dbang phyug la sogs ba du ma'am rgyu gcig pur smra ba'i tshad ma thams cad kyang bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bya ba dang byed pa po dang dbang phyug la sogs ba du ma'am rgyu gcig pur smra ba'i tshad ma thams cad kyang bcom pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all valid cognitions that speak of many actions, agents, and lords, or of a single cause, are refuted.

original: tshogs pa las ni 'bras bu rnams rim gyis 'byung bar ston pas 'bras bu yang gal te rgyu 'jig pa las byung na ni de ni 'dir rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te ;
analyzed: tshogs pa las ni 'bras bu rnams rim gyis 'byung bar ston pas 'bras bu yang gal te rgyu 'jig pa las byung na ni de ni 'dir rgyu med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur te ;
translated: Since the effect arises sequentially from the assembly, if the effect arises from the destruction of the cause, then it follows that the effect would be causeless,

original: nam mkha'i padmar rtog pa rgyu nyid du 'gyur pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i padmar rtog pa rgyu nyid du 'gyur pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for a cause to exist in the conception of a sky flower.

original: gzhan du ma zhig pa las skye bar 'gyur po zhen /
analyzed: gzhan du ma zhig pa las skye bar 'gyur po zhen /
translated: If the effect arises from something that is not destroyed,

original: de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dus gcig pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dus gcig pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then the cause and effect would be simultaneous.

original: de yang ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon rgyu dang 'bras bur 'dod pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon rgyu dang 'bras bur 'dod pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is illogical to assert that the right and left horns of an ox are cause and effect,

original: snga na med pa'i nus pa dang nus pa med pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan cig 'byung ba ni 'gal bar gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i nus pa dang nus pa med pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan cig 'byung ba ni 'gal bar gsal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the arising of an effect that is not previously existent and the simultaneous arising of cause and effect are clearly contradictory.

original: yang na skyes pa'i 'og tu 'bras bu dang dus mnyam pa nyid du 'dod do zhen /
analyzed: yang na skyes pa'i 'og tu 'bras bu dang dus mnyam pa nyid du 'dod do zhen /
translated: If you assert that the effect arises simultaneously with the cause,

original: lhan cig pa nyid 'gal bar brjod do //
analyzed: lhan cig pa nyid 'gal bar brjod do //
translated: then we say that simultaneity is contradictory.

original: de lta na yang skye ba'i 'og tu tshogs par 'gyur ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang skye ba'i 'og tu tshogs par 'gyur ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if it were to arise, then it would be contradictory to say that it is a collection after arising.

original: shin tu 'bras bu bskyed par byung ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: shin tu 'bras bu bskyed par byung ba mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable that it generates an effect after it has arisen.

original: yang na rgyu 'jig pa'i dus su 'bras bu 'byung ba 'di la nyes pa med do zhen /
analyzed: yang na rgyu 'jig pa'i dus su 'bras bu 'byung ba 'di la nyes pa med do zhen /
translated: Or, if you say that there is no fault in the effect arising at the time the cause ceases,

original: ting nge 'dzin du brtags pa tsam du gnas par zad do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du brtags pa tsam du gnas par zad do //
translated: then this is just a mere imputation in concentration.

original: de lta na yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: But even so, this should be stated:

original: 'di rgyu gang zhig 'jig par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di rgyu gang zhig 'jig par 'gyur /
translated: What is the cause of its cessation?

original: ci rgyu'i rang bzhin nyid dam /
analyzed: ci rgyu'i rang bzhin nyid dam /
translated: Is it the nature of the cause itself?

original: yang na dngos po rnams skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can rnam par 'jig gam /
analyzed: yang na dngos po rnams skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can rnam par 'jig gam /
translated: Or do things that have the property of momentary endurance disintegrate?

original: yang na rgyu 'gags nas sam /
analyzed: yang na rgyu 'gags nas sam /
translated: Or does the cause cease?

original: gal te rgyu'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan cig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i rang bzhin nyid yin na ni de nyid rgyu dang 'bras bu lhan cig par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the nature of the cause itself, then it follows that the cause and effect would be simultaneous.

original: yang na rgyu zhig na de yang gang las 'bras bu dang dus mnyam par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na rgyu zhig na de yang gang las 'bras bu dang dus mnyam par 'gyur /
translated: Or, if the cause ceases, then from what would the effect arise simultaneously with the cause?

original: dngos po med pa ni nam yang 'ga' zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni nam yang 'ga' zhig tu skye bar 'gyur ba med de /
translated: A non-entity never arises as anything anywhere.

original: rnam yang 'ga' zhig tu 'byung na ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam yang 'ga' zhig tu 'byung na ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: If it were to arise as anything anywhere, it would have a cause.

original: rnam par shes pa dngos por 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dngos por 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: It would be like consciousness, which is an entity.

original: yang smras pa /🔽rgyu zhig pa las kyang 'bras bu 'byung bar mi rigs la /🔽ma zhig pa las kyang mi rigs te /
analyzed: yang smras pa / rgyu zhig pa las kyang 'bras bu 'byung bar mi rigs la / ma zhig pa las kyang mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover,🔽it is not tenable that an effect arises from a cause that has disintegrated.🔽Nor is it tenable that an effect arises from a cause that has not disintegrated.

original: dngos @129a * //
analyzed: dngos @129a * //
translated: Because

original: po skye ba rnams ni rmi lam dang 'dra bar 'dod do //
analyzed: po skye ba rnams ni rmi lam dang 'dra bar 'dod do //
translated: it is maintained that things that arise are like a dream.

original: ma zhig pa las 'bras bu skye na ni de'i cho 'bras bu ci yang med do //
analyzed: ma zhig pa las 'bras bu skye na ni de'i cho 'bras bu ci yang med do //
translated: If an effect arises from a cause that has not disintegrated, then it would have no effect at all.

original: yang na zhig pas 'bras bu skye na ni de'i cho 'bras bu gang zhig las 'byung /
analyzed: yang na zhig pas 'bras bu skye na ni de'i cho 'bras bu gang zhig las 'byung /
translated: If an effect arises from a cause that has disintegrated, then from what cause would an effect arise?

original: de bas na dngos po skyes pa rnams la ji lta ji ltar rnam par brtags pa de lta de ltar rigs pa brtags bzod do //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po skyes pa rnams la ji lta ji ltar rnam par brtags pa de lta de ltar rigs pa brtags bzod do //
translated: Therefore, the arising of things is not tenable no matter how you analyze it.

original: de bas na tshad ma dang 'gal bar ma gyur par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na tshad ma dang 'gal bar ma gyur par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should not contradict valid knowledge.

original: de lta mod kyi de'i nges pa'i thabs gang zhig yod de /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi de'i nges pa'i thabs gang zhig yod de /
translated: But what is the means of ascertaining that?

original: gang gi phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas bsgrubs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por brjod par bya'o zhen /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas bsgrubs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por brjod par bya'o zhen /
translated: If you say that it is established by direct perception and inference, then you must explain the nature of cause and effect.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yang rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa dag bsdus pa nyid du 'dzin par byed pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yang rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam pa med pa dag bsdus pa nyid du 'dzin par byed pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not reasonable to hold that direct perception and inference include both the aspect and the absence of an aspect,

original: yul du byas pa'i snang ba dang bral na don du 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pas 'dis 'di shes so zhes gzhag pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: yul du byas pa'i snang ba dang bral na don du 'dzin pa'i dngos po med pas 'dis 'di shes so zhes gzhag pa mi rigs so //
translated: because if they are free from the appearance that is the object, then since there is no entity that apprehends an object, it is not reasonable to posit that this consciousness knows that object.

original: rnam pa'i don ni med pa las yang rmi lam la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams la dngos por gyur pas khyab pa med de /🔽nam mkha' la bris pa'i ri mo dang gcig pa nyid du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa'i don ni med pa las yang rmi lam la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams la dngos por gyur pas khyab pa med de / nam mkha' la bris pa'i ri mo dang gcig pa nyid du gyur pa ste /
translated: The meaning of “aspect” is not necessarily pervaded by the conditions of a dream, etc., being real.

original: rnam par shes pa med par mtshungs pa nyid pas mi rigs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa med par mtshungs pa nyid pas mi rigs so //
translated: It is like a drawing in the sky, and it is not reasonable that consciousness is the same as the absence of an aspect.

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: rnam pa med pa yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa yang mi rigs te /
translated: “The absence of an aspect is also unreasonable.”

original: shes pa'i yul 'dzin pa ni rnam pa'i tshan med pas cig shos kyang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i yul 'dzin pa ni rnam pa'i tshan med pas cig shos kyang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the object of consciousness is not a part of the form, the other alternative is also unreasonable.

original: de ltar na shes pas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa nyid du rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du grub par thabs gzhan rnam par dpyad pa yang de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na shes pas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa nyid du rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du grub par thabs gzhan rnam par dpyad pa yang de lta ma yin no //
translated: Thus, perception and inference are established as cause and effect by consciousness itself. There is no other method of investigation.

original: des na thams cad mkhyen pas rgyu dang 'bras bu gsal bar gsungs shing gzhan gyi dbang gis skad cig ma gtogs par cung zad kyang shes par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na thams cad mkhyen pas rgyu dang 'bras bu gsal bar gsungs shing gzhan gyi dbang gis skad cig ma gtogs par cung zad kyang shes par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One clearly taught cause and effect. Apart from the dependent and momentary, nothing can be known at all.

original: de ltar shin tu mkhas pa'i tshad mar smra ma bas skye ba rnams skye ba med pa nyid du byas shing rnyog pa'i nyes pa thams cad dang bral pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar shin tu mkhas pa'i tshad mar smra ma bas skye ba rnams skye ba med pa nyid du byas shing rnyog pa'i nyes pa thams cad dang bral pa nyid ni de bzhin gshegs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the very wise and authoritative Asvaghosa has made arising non-arising and free from all faults of confusion. He is the Tathagata.

original: de ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'di skad du /
translated: Why is this so?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu skye med chos //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu skye med chos //
translated: The Tathagata is always the unborn Dharma.

original: chos rnams thams cad bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad bde bar gshegs dang 'dra //
translated: All phenomena are like the Sugata.

original: byis pa'i blo can mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams //🔽'jig rten dag na med pa'i chos la spyod //
analyzed: byis pa'i blo can mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnams // 'jig rten dag na med pa'i chos la spyod //
translated: The childish, who grasp at signs,

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Practice the Dharma that does not exist in the world.

original: de ltar mi skye ba'i chos can gyi tshigs su bcad pa thugs la nye bar gzhag pa 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi skye ba'i chos can gyi tshigs su bcad pa thugs la nye bar gzhag pa 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, this verse on the non-arising of phenomena was spoken.

original: shes rab kyi 'khor lo bsgom pa la goms pa las shes rab phul du byung bar 'gyur @129b ba so so'i skye bo rnams la'ang skye bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: shes rab kyi 'khor lo bsgom pa la goms pa las shes rab phul du byung bar 'gyur @129b ba so so'i skye bo rnams la'ang skye bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Through cultivating the wheel of wisdom, one attains supreme wisdom. This wisdom arises even in ordinary beings.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mngon par rtogs shing dri ma med pa'i shes bya'i dkyil 'khor ma lus par khong du chud pa las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon sum du byed par skye bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi 'khor lo bsgom pa'i rim
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams mngon par rtogs shing dri ma med pa'i shes bya'i dkyil 'khor ma lus par khong du chud pa las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon sum du byed par skye bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab kyi 'khor lo bsgom pa'i rim
translated: Similarly, in order to demonstrate the stages of cultivating the wheel of wisdom, which leads to the realization of the Buddha's teachings and the direct realization of omniscient wisdom through fully comprehending the entire stainless sphere of knowledge,

original: pa nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pa nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the following verse is stated:

original: aa a'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: aa a'a zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The two verses beginning with “a ā” are stated.

original: dris pa tshigs su bcad pa dag gsungs so zhes bya bar rigs na /
analyzed: dris pa tshigs su bcad pa dag gsungs so zhes bya bar rigs na /
translated: It is reasonable to say that the verses are stated in response to the questions.

original: tshigs su bcad pa zhes tshig gcig par ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa zhes tshig gcig par ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: But why is the word “verse” used in the singular?

original: smras pa / sngags nye bar mtshon pa ni gtso bor 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / sngags nye bar mtshon pa ni gtso bor 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: We reply: The mantra is the primary indication,

original: dbyangs kyi ye ge nye par mtshon pa yang de nyid yan lag tu 'gyur ba yin te //
analyzed: dbyangs kyi ye ge nye par mtshon pa yang de nyid yan lag tu 'gyur ba yin te //
translated: and the indication of the vowel letters is secondary.

original: gtso bor gzung ba nyid kyis yon tan du gyur pa gzung ba bar du chos pa ma yin pas tshig gcig par gsungs pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: gtso bor gzung ba nyid kyis yon tan du gyur pa gzung ba bar du chos pa ma yin pas tshig gcig par gsungs pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Since the quality of being taken up by the primary is not interrupted, there is no contradiction in stating the verse in the singular.

original: gzhan yang ci'i phyir dbyangs kyi ye ge bcu gnyis kho na gsungs she na sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i nges ba bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci'i phyir dbyangs kyi ye ge bcu gnyis kho na gsungs she na sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i nges ba bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, why are only twelve vowel letters stated? It is in order to teach the definite number of stages and perfections.

original: sngags kyi tshul chen po las bcu gnyis dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis su nges par gsungs te /
analyzed: sngags kyi tshul chen po las bcu gnyis dang / pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis su nges par gsungs te /
translated: In the great way of mantra, the definite number of twelve stages and twelve perfections is taught.

original: yi ge aa ni skye ba med pa'i don dam pa byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid de mos pa spyod pa'i sa rab tu ston par byed pa la byang chub kyi sems rnam bar dag pa rab tu ston pas rin chen padma'i pha rol tu phyin🔽pa ston pa yang yin no //
analyzed: yi ge aa ni skye ba med pa'i don dam pa byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid de mos pa spyod pa'i sa rab tu ston par byed pa la byang chub kyi sems rnam bar dag pa rab tu ston pas rin chen padma'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa yang yin no //
translated: The letter A is the ultimate reality of non-production, the very essence of the Thought of Enlightenment. It is the teaching of the stage of action in faith. Since it teaches the purity of the Thought of Enlightenment, it is the teaching of the perfection of the jewel lotus.

original: yi ge aa ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa ston pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa yin te /
analyzed: yi ge aa ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa ston pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa yin te /
translated: The letter A teaches the stage of the Joyous and teaches the perfection of generosity.

original: byang chub spyod dang sangs rgyas nyid //
analyzed: byang chub spyod dang sangs rgyas nyid //
translated: The practice of enlightenment, Buddhahood,

original: mya ngan 'das dang 'das ma yin //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das dang 'das ma yin //
translated: Nirvana, and non-nirvana.

original: zhes gsungs pas rang dgar brtags pa ni ma yin pas aa ni byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas rang dgar brtags pa ni ma yin pas aa ni byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Since it is not a matter of arbitrary designation, A is the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: a'a ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: a'a ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa rnams so //
translated: A is the practices of the perfections such as generosity.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dri ma med pa la ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin pas na ai ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa dri ma med pa la ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin pas na ai ste /
translated: On the stainless stage of the Bodhisattva, one practices the perfection of morality to a high degree. Therefore, it is I.

original: rtog pa ngan pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa ngan pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from negative thoughts.

original: 'od byed pa'i sa la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'od byed pa'i sa la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par spyod pa yin te /
translated: On the Shining, the perfection of patience is especially practiced,

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa las byung la chos la dmigs pa'i bzod pa dang ldan par 'gyur bas pa'i ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa las byung la chos la dmigs pa'i bzod pa dang ldan par 'gyur bas pa'i ste /
translated: because one becomes endowed with patience that is focused on the Dharma, which arises from the basis of suffering and from harm done by others.

original: 'di ni yan lag dang nying lag bcad par gyur kyang 'khrug pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni yan lag dang nying lag bcad par gyur kyang 'khrug pa med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught in order to show that even if one’s limbs and minor parts are cut off, one remains undisturbed.

original: 'od 'phro ba la ni brtson 'grus @130a * //🔽kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'od 'phro ba la ni brtson 'grus @130a * // kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin te /
translated: On the Radiant, the perfection of effort is especially practiced,

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi brtson 'grus dang ldan pas au ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi brtson 'grus dang ldan pas au ste /
translated: because one is endowed with the effort of body, speech, and mind.

original: dge ba'i las rnams la kun du spro ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i las rnams la kun du spro ba'i brtson 'grus dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught in order to show that one is endowed with the effort of enthusiasm for virtuous actions.

original: sbyang dka' ba la ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin pas a'u ste /
analyzed: sbyang dka' ba la ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin pas a'u ste /
translated: On the Hard to Overcome, the perfection of meditative stabilization is especially practiced,🔽because one is endowed with the meditative stabilization of the union of calm abiding and special insight.

original: ma tshang ba dang lhag chad med pas shin tu lhag par gyur par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma tshang ba dang lhag chad med pas shin tu lhag par gyur par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show that it is extremely superior because it is not incomplete or defective,

original: mngon du gyur pa la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin pas ae ste /
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa la ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin pas ae ste /
translated: in the manifest, one practices the perfection of wisdom, so it is ai.

original: 'di lta bu'i ngo bo nyid de gzod ma nas zhi ba'o zhes rtogs par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i ngo bo nyid de gzod ma nas zhi ba'o zhes rtogs par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show that one understands that such an essence is primordially peace,

original: ring du song ba la ni thabs kyi pha rol phyin pa la spyod pa yin pas aee ste /
analyzed: ring du song ba la ni thabs kyi pha rol phyin pa la spyod pa yin pas aee ste /
translated: in the far-reaching, one practices the perfection of means, so it is ai.

original: rtsol ba rnams las gcig tu rtsol ba med par rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsol ba rnams las gcig tu rtsol ba med par rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug par 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show that one enters nonconceptuality without effort from among the efforts,

original: mi g-yo ba la ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin pas aom ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin pas aom ste /
translated: in the immovable, one practices the perfection of aspiration, so it is om.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i chu bo las brgal pa nyid du gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i chu bo las brgal pa nyid du gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show that one has crossed the river of conceptuality,

original: legs pa'i blo gros la ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin pas ae ste /🔽dpe las shin tu 'das pa'i chos chen po'i mdzod 'dzin par gyur pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs pa'i blo gros la ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin pas ae ste / dpe las shin tu 'das pa'i chos chen po'i mdzod 'dzin par gyur pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: On the ground of Perfect Joy, the perfection of generosity is fulfilled; on the ground of Stainlessness, the perfection of moral discipline; on the ground of Radiance, the perfection of patience; on the ground of Brilliance, the perfection of diligence; on the ground of Hard to Conquer, the perfection of meditative concentration; and on the ground of Presence, the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos kyi sprin la ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par spyod pa yin pas aam ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin la ni ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par spyod pa yin pas aam ste /
translated: On the ground of Immovability, the perfection of skillful means is fulfilled; on the ground of Contemplation, the perfection of aspiration; on the ground of Cloud of Dharma, the perfection of strength; and on the ground of the Universal Light of Buddhahood, the perfection of pristine awareness.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar gyur pa nyid kyis mngon par byang chub par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar gyur pa nyid kyis mngon par byang chub par 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ten perfections are fulfilled on the ten grounds in the following order.🔽On the ground of Perfect Joy, the perfection of generosity is fulfilled; on the ground of Stainlessness, the perfection of moral discipline; on the ground of Radiance, the perfection of patience; on the ground of Brilliance, the perfection of diligence; on the ground of Hard to Conquer, the perfection of meditative concentration; and on the ground of Presence, the perfection of wisdom.

original: sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od la ni rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa ye shes kyi snang ba mi g-yo zhing mi 'jigs pa rdor rje'i las kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir yi ge aa;'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis kun du 'od la ni rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa ye shes kyi snang ba mi g-yo zhing mi 'jigs pa rdor rje'i las kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir yi ge aa;'o //
translated: On the ground of Immovability, the perfection of skillful means is fulfilled; on the ground of Contemplation, the perfection of aspiration; on the ground of Cloud of Dharma, the perfection of strength; and on the ground of the Universal Light of Buddhahood, the perfection of pristine awareness.🔽The ten perfections are fulfilled on the ten grounds in the following order.

original: de ltar bcu gnyis dang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis ston pa'i yi ge bcu gnyis ni 'khor lo'i phyi'i mu khyud la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bcu gnyis dang pha rol tu phyin pa bcu gnyis ston pa'i yi ge bcu gnyis ni 'khor lo'i phyi'i mu khyud la blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the twelve [letters] and the twelve letters that teach the twelve perfections should be seen on the outer rim of the wheel.

original: badzra t'ikshna zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags drug ni shar phyogs la sogs pa'i rtsi bas drug la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: badzra t'ikshna zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags drug ni shar phyogs la sogs pa'i rtsi bas drug la dgod par bya'o //
translated: The six mantras beginning with vajra-tīkṣṇa should be placed on the six spokes beginning with the east.

original: mu khyud kyi nang gi lte ba la ni aom mu aom zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mu khyud kyi nang gi lte ba la ni aom mu aom zhes bya'o //
translated: In the center of the inner rim, [one should write] oṃ mu oṃ.

original: thams cad kyi phyi rol du ka la sogs pa nas ksha'i bar du bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi phyi rol du ka la sogs pa nas ksha'i bar du bri bar bya ste /
translated: Outside of all [of them], one should write the [letters] from ka up to kṣa.

original: thams cad kyang kha dog dkar po snying ga'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du lus thams cad snang bar byed par bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyang kha dog dkar po snying ga'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du lus thams cad snang bar byed par bsam par bya ste /
translated: All of them should be white in color, and one should imagine that they illuminate the entire body above the moon disk in the heart.

original: de lta bu ni re zhig rtsibs drug pa'i 'khor lo gcig yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni re zhig rtsibs drug pa'i 'khor lo gcig yin no //
translated: Such is the one wheel with six spokes.

original: 'khor lo rtsibs bcu @130b gnyis pa'i dbus su ni yi ge aom /
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs bcu @130b gnyis pa'i dbus su ni yi ge aom /
translated: In the center of the wheel with twelve spokes, [one should write] the letter oṃ.

original: mdun du yi ge h'um /
analyzed: mdun du yi ge h'um /
translated: In front, [one should write] the letter hūṃ.

original: rgyab tu yi ge hr'i;/
analyzed: rgyab tu yi ge hr'i;/
translated: In the back, [one should write] the letter hrīḥ.

original: g-yas su aom /
analyzed: g-yas su aom /
translated: On the right, [one should write] the letter oṃ.

original: g-yon du a'a;/ shar gyi rtsibs la la /
analyzed: g-yon du a'a;/ shar gyi rtsibs la la /
translated: On the eastern spoke,🔽“Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.

original: aom badzra t'i kshn'a ya na' ma /🔽bskor phyogs su bya ste /🔽aom du ; kha tse tsha d'a ya n'a ma /
analyzed: aom badzra t'i kshn'a ya na' ma / bskor phyogs su bya ste / aom du ; kha tse tsha d'a ya n'a ma /
translated: “Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.🔽“Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.🔽“Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.🔽“Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.

original: gnyis ba la aom pra dzny'a dzny'a ya n'a ma /🔽gsum pa la aom dzny'a na k'a y'a n'a ma /
analyzed: gnyis ba la aom pra dzny'a dzny'a ya n'a ma / gsum pa la aom dzny'a na k'a y'a n'a ma /
translated: “Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.🔽“Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.🔽“Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.🔽“Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.

original: bzhi pa la aom b'a g'i shva r'a ya n'a ma /🔽lnga pa la aom /🔽aa ra pa tsa n'a ma /
analyzed: bzhi pa la aom b'a g'i shva r'a ya n'a ma / lnga pa la aom / aa ra pa tsa n'a ma /
translated: “Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.🔽“Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.🔽“Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.🔽“Oṃ, homage to Vajraḍāka.

original: drug pa la aom bar da badzra aa gr'a ya n'a ma /
analyzed: drug pa la aom bar da badzra aa gr'a ya n'a ma /
