analyzed: de la sprul pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
translated: What is a Buddha of manifestation?

original: 'di la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gzugs thams cad ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa de dag ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: 'di la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gzugs thams cad ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa de dag ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: It is a Buddha who, having attained the concentration of the manifestation of all forms, enters into this concentration.

original: dbang thob cing snying rje chen po bskul nas sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su sprul nas sems can rnams 'dul ba 'di ni sprul ba'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang thob cing snying rje chen po bskul nas sangs rgyas kyi gzugs su sprul nas sems can rnams 'dul ba 'di ni sprul ba'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Having attained mastery over it, and being impelled by great compassion, he manifests the form of a Buddha and converts beings.

original: de la btags pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la btags pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
translated: What is a nominal Buddha?

original: 'di la la la zhig slob dpon nam mkhan po la sangs rgyas bzhin du blta sangs rgyas bzhin du bsnyen bkur byed de /
analyzed: 'di la la la zhig slob dpon nam mkhan po la sangs rgyas bzhin du blta sangs rgyas bzhin du bsnyen bkur byed de /
translated: Some people regard the master or preceptor as a Buddha and honor them as a Buddha.

original: de la slob dpon dang mkhan po la sangs rgyas bzhin du blta zhing sangs rgyas bzhin du bsnyen bkur byas pas de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rab tu 'dzin la yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: de la slob dpon dang mkhan po la sangs rgyas bzhin du blta zhing sangs rgyas bzhin du bsnyen bkur byas pas de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rab tu 'dzin la yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: By regarding the master or preceptor as a Buddha and honoring them as a Buddha, they grasp the Buddha’s teachings and bring them to completion.

original: yongs su sgrub pa 'di ni btags pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su sgrub pa 'di ni btags pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the ‘nominal Buddha.’

original: de la mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the ‘Buddha placed in front’?

original: 'di la gang la la zhig sangs rgyas kyi gzugs byas sam byed du bcug ste /
analyzed: 'di la gang la la zhig sangs rgyas kyi gzugs byas sam byed du bcug ste /
translated: Here, some people make an image of the Buddha or have it made,

original: mchod cing rim gro bya ba thams cad kyis bsti stang du byed /
analyzed: mchod cing rim gro bya ba thams cad kyis bsti stang du byed /
translated: and honor it with all kinds of worship and service.🔽They revere it,

original: bla mar byed /
analyzed: bla mar byed /
translated: respect it,

original: ri mor byed cing de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rab tu 'dzin la yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
analyzed: ri mor byed cing de sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams rab tu 'dzin la yongs su rdzogs par byed de /
translated: and grasp the Buddha’s teachings and bring them to completion.

original: yongs su sgrub pa'i 'di ni mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su sgrub pa'i 'di ni mdun du gzhag pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ste /
translated: This is the Buddha who is placed in front for the sake of thorough accomplishment.🔽Thus, the ten modes of engaging the way of the enlightenment should be understood as the Buddha.

original: de ltar na byang chub kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcu po de dag gi sangs rgyas khong du chud par bya'o zhes chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub kyi tshul la 'jug pa bcu po de dag gi sangs rgyas khong du chud par bya'o zhes chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las gsungs te /
translated: This is stated in the Sutra of the Completely Pure Dharma.

original: de dag kyang blo dman pa rnams kyis legs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bris pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang blo dman pa rnams kyis legs par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bris pa yin no //
translated: I have written this in order that those of lesser intellect may understand it well.

original: bcom ldan 'das pa ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das pa ni /
translated: The Bhagavat🔽is endowed with the six:🔽mastery, good form,🔽glory, fame, knowledge,

original: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ste /🔽drug po de la ldan zhes bya //
analyzed: dbang phyug dang ni gzugs bzang dang // dpal dang grags dang ye shes dang // brtson 'grus phun sum tshogs pa ste / drug po de la ldan zhes bya //
translated: and perfect effort.

original: de dag ma lus la 'jug pa //🔽@132b ji ltar rgyal ba ston mdzad pa //
analyzed: de dag ma lus la 'jug pa // @132b ji ltar rgyal ba ston mdzad pa //
translated: He is engaged in all of them.🔽No one else is like

original: de 'dra gzhan la yod min pas //
analyzed: de 'dra gzhan la yod min pas //
translated: the way the Victor teaches.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya //🔽zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya //🔽zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Therefore, he is called the Bhagavat.

original: yang na bdud bzhi bcom pas na nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis yi ge b'an gyis na bcom ldan 'das zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang na bdud bzhi bcom pas na nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis yi ge b'an gyis na bcom ldan 'das zhes zer ro //
translated: Or else, he is the Bhagavat because he has conquered the four demons, according to the method of etymology.

original: chos thams cad las phyin ci ma la logs par mngon par byang chub pas na rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad las phyin ci ma la logs par mngon par byang chub pas na rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is the perfect Buddha because he has fully awakened to all things as they are and as many as there are.

original: aa las byung ba ni aa ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad skye ba me dpa'i sgo ste /
analyzed: aa las byung ba ni aa ni gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i phyir chos thams cad skye ba me dpa'i sgo ste /
translated: He has arisen from A, because A is the door to the non-arising of all things, because it is originally unborn.

original: de ltar na chos thams cad skye ba med par bsgoms pa las byung bas so //
analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad skye ba med par bsgoms pa las byung bas so //
translated: Thus, he has arisen from the contemplation of the non-arising of all things.

original: yang na byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid aa yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i rnam par sems so sor rtog pa la sogs pa'i rim pa las grub pas na aa las byung ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: yang na byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo nyid aa yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i rnam par sems so sor rtog pa la sogs pa'i rim pa las grub pas na aa las byung ba zhes bshad do //
translated: Or else, he has arisen from A because he is the mind which is the nature of the Thought of Enlightenment, which has arisen from the transformation of A, and which has been accomplished by the process of the moon, the discernment of the mind, and so on.

original: 'o na yi ge dpag tu med pa yod pa las ci'i phyir aa nyid las byung ba zhes pa'i rtog par bzlog pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'o na yi ge dpag tu med pa yod pa las ci'i phyir aa nyid las byung ba zhes pa'i rtog par bzlog pa'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to eliminate the notion that he has arisen from A alone, among the infinite number of letters, it is said:

original: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog //
analyzed: aa ni yig 'bru kun gyi mchog //
translated: A is the best of all letters.

original: don chen yi ge dam pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs so /
analyzed: don chen yi ge dam pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs so /
translated: It is the supreme syllable of great meaning.

original: de yang mi gyur ba'i phyir yi ge ste chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de yang mi gyur ba'i phyir yi ge ste chos kyi sku'o //
translated: It is a syllable because it does not change, that is, it is the Dharma Body.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni aa ste yi ge'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni aa ste yi ge'o //
translated: Its essence is the syllable A.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don chen te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don chen te /
translated: Therefore it is of great meaning.

original: gang la don chen po yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang la don chen po yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: He who has great meaning is so-called.

original: de bas na yi ge thams cad kyi mchog ni yi ge aa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yi ge thams cad kyi mchog ni yi ge aa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the supreme of all syllables is the syllable A.

original: yang na yi ge aa ni yi ge thams cad kyi dang por gnas pas na kun gyi mchog go //
analyzed: yang na yi ge aa ni yi ge thams cad kyi dang por gnas pas na kun gyi mchog go //
translated: Or else, the syllable A is the supreme of all because it is the first of all syllables.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na aa ni mi bskyod pa dang / 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na aa ni mi bskyod pa dang / 'od dpag tu med pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In another way, A is the supreme of all because it is the essence of Akshobhya and Amitabha.

original: don yod par grub par ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na kun gyi mchog ste /
analyzed: don yod par grub par ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na kun gyi mchog ste /
translated: It is the supreme of all because it is the essence of Amoghasiddhi.

original: rigs thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pas na sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pas na sna tshogs pa'i gzugs can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the supreme of all families because it has a variegated form.

original: don 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na don chen no //
analyzed: don 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid rin chen 'byung ldan gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na don chen no //
translated: It is the great meaning because it is the reality of Ratnasaṃbhava, the reality of the meaning that arises.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi bdag nyid can yin pas na yi ge dam pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi bdag nyid can yin pas na yi ge dam pa'o //
translated: It is the supreme syllable because it is the nature of Vairocana.

original: de ltar yi ge rnams sbyar ba byas pa la don med pa yin nam 'on te dgos pa yod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yi ge rnams sbyar ba byas pa la don med pa yin nam 'on te dgos pa yod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Thus, is the application of the syllables meaningless, or does it have a purpose?

original: don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don med pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not meaningless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mtshan nyid don gyi re re nas bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid don gyi re re nas bsgom par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is said that one should meditate on each of the characteristics and meanings.

original: mtshan rnams yang dag par bsdus pa ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: mtshan rnams yang dag par bsdus pa ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa yin la /
translated: The enumeration of the characteristics is the enumeration of the characteristics.

original: de yang mtshan rnams don dang bcas pas sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang mtshan rnams don dang bcas pas sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: And that is the attainment of buddhahood, because the characteristics are meaningful.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yon tan la dmigs pa'i phyir yi ge rnams nges par sbyar ba yang don dang ldan par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yon tan la dmigs pa'i phyir yi ge rnams nges par sbyar ba yang don dang ldan par byas pa yin no //
translated: The application of the syllables is also made meaningful, because it is the observation of the qualities of the buddhas.

original: @133a * // khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
analyzed: @133a * // khong nas 'byung ba skye ba med //
translated: Arising from within, it is unborn.

original: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa ste //
translated: It is beyond verbal expression,🔽The supreme cause of all expression,

original: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: brjod pa kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: It illuminates all words.

original: ces bya ba la 'bad pa chen pos brjod pa na khong nas byung ba ste yi ge aa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la 'bad pa chen pos brjod pa na khong nas byung ba ste yi ge aa'o //
translated: When one is expressing it with great effort, it arises from within, the syllable A.

original: chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes ston pas na skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes ston pas na skye ba med pa'o //
translated: It is non-arisen, because it teaches that all phenomena are primordially non-arisen.

original: rang nyid skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na tshig tu brjod pa spangs pa'o //
translated: It is beyond verbal expression, because it has become the nature of non-arisen itself.

original: 'o na ji ltar na de bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsung gi 'khor lo rdzogs par 'gyur zhes rtog pa la /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar na de bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsung gi 'khor lo rdzogs par 'gyur zhes rtog pa la /
translated: Now, how does the wheel of speech become complete by the power of meditating on that?🔽The supreme cause of all expression,

original: brjod ba kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed //🔽ces gsungs te /🔽'dis don rnams brjod par 'gyur bas na brjod pa ste sgra rnams so //
analyzed: brjod ba kun gyi rgyu yi mchog / tshig kun rab tu gsal bar byed // ces gsungs te / 'dis don rnams brjod par 'gyur bas na brjod pa ste sgra rnams so //
translated: It illuminates all words.🔽It is expression because it expresses the meanings.

original: brjod pa yang yin la kun yang yin pas na brjod pa kun te /
analyzed: brjod pa yang yin la kun yang yin pas na brjod pa kun te /
translated: It is all expression because it is all expressions.

original: de rnams rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni brjod pa kun gyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: de rnams rgyur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni brjod pa kun gyi rgyu ste /
translated: That which is the cause of those is the cause of all expressions.

original: de rnams kyi mchog dang gtso bo 'jam dpal gyi ye shes skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog dang gtso bo 'jam dpal gyi ye shes skyed par byed de /
translated: It generates the pristine wisdom of Manjusri, who is the best and chief of those.

original: de bas na ngag thams cad la 'jug bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ngag thams cad la 'jug bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it causes the engagement of all speech.

original: ngag thams cad kyi don ma lus par ston pas na rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ngag thams cad kyi don ma lus par ston pas na rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of all expressions because it reveals the meaning of all speech without exception.

original: des ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: yi ge aa ni ma skyes pa'i rnam pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan rnams kyi gnas byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid 'jam dpal gyi rang bzhin bskyed pas na chos kyi 'khor lo skor🔽bar byed cing /
analyzed: yi ge aa ni ma skyes pa'i rnam pas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan rnams kyi gnas byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid 'jam dpal gyi rang bzhin bskyed pas na chos kyi 'khor lo skor bar byed cing /
translated: The letter A, by the aspect of non-arising, generates the nature of Manjusri, which is the cause of the pristine wisdom of non-conceptualization, which is the forerunner of the Thought of Enlightenment, which is the basis of all the qualities of all the Buddhas, and therefore it is the cause of the turning of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: tshig thams cad rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i gsung gi 'khor lo'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir brjod pa thams cad kyi rgyu'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: tshig thams cad rab tu gsal bar byed pa'i gsung gi 'khor lo'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir brjod pa thams cad kyi rgyu'i mchog yin no //
translated: And because it is the cause of the wheel of speech which reveals all words, it is the best cause of all expressions.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i tshul gyis gnyis su rnam par rtog pa'i nye bar dmigs pa'i thog ma med pa'i stobs 'jig par mdzad pas na khong nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i tshul gyis gnyis su rnam par rtog pa'i nye bar dmigs pa'i thog ma med pa'i stobs 'jig par mdzad pas na khong nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: Otherwise, it is the emergence from the heart because it destroys the power of the beginningless conceptualization of duality in the form of the body of enjoyment, which is the nondual essence.

original: chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na skye ba med pa'o //
translated: It is unborn because it is the essence of the Tathagatas, who are of the nature of the body of truth.

original: so sor rang gi rig pa'i mchog tu dga' ba gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na tshigs tu brjod pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rang gi rig pa'i mchog tu dga' ba gnyis su med pa'i bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na tshigs tu brjod pa spangs pa'o //
translated: It is beyond speech because it is the essence of the supreme bliss of nondual, self-experienced, highest joy.

original: de ltar rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa lhun gyis grub nas chos ston pa'i sgra sna tshogs pas gdul bya'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir dam pa'i chos rnams ston par mdzad pas na brjod pa kun rgyu'i mchog go //
analyzed: de ltar rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa lhun gyis grub nas chos ston pa'i sgra sna tshogs pas gdul bya'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir dam pa'i chos rnams ston par mdzad pas na brjod pa kun rgyu'i mchog go //
translated: Thus, having spontaneously perfected one's own aim, it is the supreme cause of all speech because it teaches the true Dharma by means of various sounds of Dharma teaching in order to train sentient beings who are to be trained.

original: yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar @133b sems can ma lus pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i tshig rnams bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na tshig kun no //
analyzed: yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar @133b sems can ma lus pa'i mngon par 'dod pa'i tshig rnams bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pas na tshig kun no //
translated: All words means that, like a wish-fulfilling gem, it is the cause for producing all the desired words of every sentient being.

original: sprul pa'i 'od zer gyis sems can ma lus pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i ma rig pa'i mun sel bar mdzad pas na rab tu gsal bar byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'od zer gyis sems can ma lus pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i ma rig pa'i mun sel bar mdzad pas na rab tu gsal bar byed ces bya'o //
translated: Since it clears away the darkness of ignorance that exists in the mind-streams of all sentient beings with its emanating light rays, it is called very clear.🔽In order to rely on it as being supreme by way of desire and so forth,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshul gyis phul du byung ba nyid du bsten par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i tshul gyis phul du byung ba nyid du bsten par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: mchod pa chen po 'dod chags che //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po 'dod chags che //
translated: The great offering is great desire,

original: sems can thams cad dga' bar byed //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dga' bar byed //
translated: which delights all sentient beings.

original: mchod pa chen po zhe sdang che //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po zhe sdang che //
translated: The great offering is great anger,

original: nyon mongs kun gyi dgra che ba //
analyzed: nyon mongs kun gyi dgra che ba //
translated: the great enemy of all afflictions.

original: mchod pa chen po gti mug che //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po gti mug che //
translated: The great offering is great ignorance,

original: gti mug blo ste gti mug sel //
analyzed: gti mug blo ste gti mug sel //
translated: the mind of ignorance, which clears away ignorance.

original: mchod pa chen po khro ba che //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po khro ba che //
translated: The great offering is great wrath,

original: khro bo chen po dgra che ba //
analyzed: khro bo chen po dgra che ba //
translated: the great wrath, the great enemy.

original: mchod pa chen po chags pa che //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po chags pa che //
translated: The great offering is great attachment,

original: chags pa thams cad sel bar byed //
analyzed: chags pa thams cad sel bar byed //
translated: which clears away all attachment.

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de yang 'dod chags che ba ni lha chen po yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags che ba ni lha chen po yin te /
translated: Moreover, the great desire is the great god.

original: des lha'i lo stong gi bar du 'khrig pa chen po spyad kyang cung zad tsam ngoms par ma byas te /
analyzed: des lha'i lo stong gi bar du 'khrig pa chen po spyad kyang cung zad tsam ngoms par ma byas te /
translated: Even though he practices great sex for a thousand divine years, he is not satisfied in the least.

original: au ma gcig pu yang tshim par ma gyur to ;
analyzed: au ma gcig pu yang tshim par ma gyur to ;
translated: Even just one Uma does not satisfy him.

original: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyun mi 'chad cing phul du byung ba'i dga' ba skyed pa'i de kho na nyid ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad cing phul du byung ba'i dga' ba skyed pa'i de kho na nyid ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not know the reality that generates uninterrupted, supreme bliss.

original: rdze btsun 'jam dpal gyis ni smes can thams cad skye ba med pa'i dga' bas tshim par mdzad de /
analyzed: rdze btsun 'jam dpal gyis ni smes can thams cad skye ba med pa'i dga' bas tshim par mdzad de /
translated: The Bhagavat Manjusri satisfies all lustful ones with the bliss of non-production.

original: che bas kyang ches che ba'i phyir //
analyzed: che bas kyang ches che ba'i phyir //
translated: Because he is greater than the great,

original: mchod pa chen po 'dod chags che //
analyzed: mchod pa chen po 'dod chags che //
translated: he is the great worship, great desire.

translated: “it removes all passion.”

original: de nyid kyis na /🔽mchod pa chen po chags pa che //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na / mchod pa chen po chags pa che //
translated: And for that very reason,

original: ches bya ba'o //
analyzed: ches bya ba'o //
translated: it is the great offering, the great passion.

original: 'dir yang mchod pa chen po chags pa che ba ni bcom ldan 'das rin chen 'byung ldan te /
analyzed: 'dir yang mchod pa chen po chags pa che ba ni bcom ldan 'das rin chen 'byung ldan te /
translated: Here, the great offering, the great passion, is Bhagavān Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: gser gyi mdog can zhal bzhi pa phyag brgyad pa /
analyzed: gser gyi mdog can zhal bzhi pa phyag brgyad pa /
translated: who is golden-colored, has four faces, and eight arms.

original: zhal gyi rnams par dbye bas na /
analyzed: zhal gyi rnams par dbye bas na /
translated: The face is divided into four parts:

original: ser po dang / nag po dang / dkar po dang / dmar po'o //
analyzed: ser po dang / nag po dang / dkar po dang / dmar po'o //
translated: yellow, black, white, and red.

original: phyag g-yas dang g-yon rnams na rdo rje dang / ral gri dang / mda' dang / lcags @135b kyu dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan dang / dril bu dang / gzhu dang / zhags pa bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas dang g-yon rnams na rdo rje dang / ral gri dang / mda' dang / lcags @135b kyu dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu'i rgyal mtshan dang / dril bu dang / gzhu dang / zhags pa bsnams pa /
translated: The right and left hands hold a vajra, sword, arrow, goad, wish-granting gem, banner, bell, bow, and noose.

original: rgyal po'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
analyzed: rgyal po'i skyil mo krung gis bzhugs pa /
translated: He sits in the posture of royal poise.

original: ba spu'i bu ga thams cad las rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sprin byung bas sems can thams cad ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin du bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad cing rin po che la sogs pa'i char phab par chags pa'i rdul zhi bar
analyzed: ba spu'i bu ga thams cad las rin chen 'byung ldan gyi sprin byung bas sems can thams cad ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa bzhin du bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad cing rin po che la sogs pa'i char phab par chags pa'i rdul zhi bar
translated: From all the pores of his body, clouds of Ratnasaṃbhava come forth, fulfilling all the wishes of all sentient beings just as they desire, and they rain down jewels and so forth.

original: mdzad cing sems can rnams kyi smes chags pa dang bral bar mdzad de /
analyzed: mdzad cing sems can rnams kyi smes chags pa dang bral bar mdzad de /
translated: They pacify the dust of attachment and free sentient beings from desire.

original: chags pa dang bral bar byas pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid la sbyar bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang bral bar byas pa rnams sangs rgyas nyid la sbyar bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: Those who are freed from desire should be imagined as being brought to buddhahood.

original: ci'i de ltar sbyor ba byas she na ;
analyzed: ci'i de ltar sbyor ba byas she na ;
translated: Why is it applied in that way?

original: rgyud gzhan dag las /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan dag las /
translated: In other tantras it is said:

original: sangs rgyas thams cad chags las 'khrungs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad chags las 'khrungs //
translated: All buddhas arise from passion,

original: de bzhin rmongs dang sdang las 'khrung //
analyzed: de bzhin rmongs dang sdang las 'khrung //
translated: Likewise, they arise from delusion and anger.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: And so on.

original: de yang 'di ltar bshad par rigs pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar bshad par rigs pa nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is taught in order to demonstrate that it is reasonable to explain it in this way.

original: gzhan du 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / khro ba dang / chags pa rnams ni 'khor ba'i rgyu mtshang ba med pa yin zhing rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan du 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / khro ba dang / chags pa rnams ni 'khor ba'i rgyu mtshang ba med pa yin zhing rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: If passion, aggression, delusion, wrath, and attachment are the uncorrupted causes of samsara and have the nature of concepts,

original: ji ltar 'tshang rgya ba nyid khyi rgyur 'gyur /🔽gal te thabs dang bcas pa las 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'tshang rgya ba nyid khyi rgyur 'gyur / gal te thabs dang bcas pa las 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: how could they be the causes of buddhahood?

original: thabs kyis yongs su zin pa na /
analyzed: thabs kyis yongs su zin pa na /
translated: If you say they are causes when they are accompanied by methods,

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin las 'phos sam 'on te ma yin /
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin las 'phos sam 'on te ma yin /
translated: then is the nature of the former transformed by the methods or is it not?

original: gal te rang bzhin snga ma las 'phos na de lta ni de lta na ni de khyad par can nyid kyis rdzas gzhan skyes nas sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed ni nged kyang 'dod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin snga ma las 'phos na de lta ni de lta na ni de khyad par can nyid kyis rdzas gzhan skyes nas sangs rgyas nyid thob par byed ni nged kyang 'dod pa nyid yin no //
translated: If it is transformed from the previous nature, then in that case, since it is distinctive, it would be a different substance that arose and attained buddhahood.

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis par ltar na ni rgyu mtshang ba med pa las phyin ci log gi 'bras bu 'byung ba ni 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis par ltar na ni rgyu mtshang ba med pa las phyin ci log gi 'bras bu 'byung ba ni 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: But if it is the second position, then it is contradictory that a result that is the opposite of the cause would arise from a cause that is not faulty.

original: yang na dug gi nas pa med par byas pa bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i nud pa nyid bsal nas 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis ston no zhe na /
analyzed: yang na dug gi nas pa med par byas pa bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i nud pa nyid bsal nas 'dod chags la sogs pa yang rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis ston no zhe na /
translated: Or, like the potency of poison being removed, if the potency that is the cause of cyclic existence is removed, then desire and so on are revealed to be essentially peaceful.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nus pas ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa la med de /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa'i nus pas ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi bstan pa la med de /
translated: But potency that is different from its nature does not exist in the teaching of the sugatas.

original: nus pa dang bral ba nyid rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba yin pas rdzas gzhan pa 'byung ba'i phyogs nyid yin la ;
analyzed: nus pa dang bral ba nyid rang gi ngo bo dang bral ba yin pas rdzas gzhan pa 'byung ba'i phyogs nyid yin la ;
translated: Since being free from potency is free from its nature, it is the position that it is a different substance.

original: rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi 'gyur ba'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: There is no entity whatsoever that is unchanging by nature,

original: thams cad kyang skad cig ma nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / khro ba dang / chags pa rnams ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnams par dag pa'i rang @136a * //
analyzed: thams cad kyang skad cig ma nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro // de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / khro ba dang / chags pa rnams ni chos kyi dbyings shin tu rnams par dag pa'i rang @136a * //
translated: because all are taught to be momentary.

original: bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid du rtogs na 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi rgyur bas de bzhen gshegs pa la sogs pa'i nga rgyal gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa la brten pa ni sngags kyi tshul las 'gal ba med padm'a /
analyzed: bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid du rtogs na 'tshang rgya ba nyid kyi rgyur bas de bzhen gshegs pa la sogs pa'i nga rgyal gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa la brten pa ni sngags kyi tshul las 'gal ba med padm'a /
translated: Therefore, if one realizes that the nature of the five thus-gone ones, namely desire, hatred, obscuration, wrath, and passion, is the essence of the utterly pure realm of reality, then relying on desire, etc. with the pride of being a thus-gone one, etc. is not contradictory in the mantra system.

original: ngo bo nyid med cing sgyu ma lta bur lhag par mos pas ni thams cad legs par gnas pa yin no //🔽'dod pa chen po bde ba che //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med cing sgyu ma lta bur lhag par mos pas ni thams cad legs par gnas pa yin no // 'dod pa chen po bde ba che //
translated: And by having superior devotion to the lack of inherent nature and illusion-like nature, everything is well-established.🔽Great desire, great bliss,

original: dga' ba chen po mgu ba che //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po mgu ba che //
translated: great joy, great satisfaction,

original: zhes bya ba ni yid kyi chos nyid khyad par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yid kyi chos nyid khyad par bstan pa ste /
translated: This teaches the distinctive mental reality.

original: sems can ma lus pa sangs rgyas nyid la rab tu 'god par 'dod par bzhed pa gang la yod pa'am /
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa sangs rgyas nyid la rab tu 'god par 'dod par bzhed pa gang la yod pa'am /
translated: He is the great desire because he has the great desire to establish all sentient beings in buddhahood.

original: chen po rnams kyi de 'dod par bya ba yin pas 'dod pa chen po ste /
analyzed: chen po rnams kyi de 'dod par bya ba yin pas 'dod pa chen po ste /
translated: Or, he is the great desire because he is the object of desire of the great ones.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das ngag gi dbang phyug go// thar pa'i bde bskyed par byed par 'gyur bas na bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das ngag gi dbang phyug go// thar pa'i bde bskyed par byed par 'gyur bas na bde ba chen po'o //
translated: He is the great bliss because he generates the bliss of liberation.

original: gong nas gong du rab tu dga' ba'i rgyur gyur pas dga' ba chen po'o //
analyzed: gong nas gong du rab tu dga' ba'i rgyur gyur pas dga' ba chen po'o //
translated: He is the great joy because he is the cause of increasing joy.

original: yang na bde ba chen po ni dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis lha mo thams cad la rol bar mdzad pas de rnams kyi 'dod par bya ba yin pas de ni 'dod pa chen po ste /
analyzed: yang na bde ba chen po ni dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul gyis lha mo thams cad la rol bar mdzad pas de rnams kyi 'dod par bya ba yin pas de ni 'dod pa chen po ste /
translated: Or, he is the great desire because he is the object of desire of all goddesses who enjoy him in the manner of the great mandala.

original: de nyid kyis 'di ltar bde ba chen po 'byung ba'i gnas skabs kyi kun du dga' ba'i byang chub kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas bde ba chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis 'di ltar bde ba chen po 'byung ba'i gnas skabs kyi kun du dga' ba'i byang chub kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas bde ba chen po'o //
translated: He is the great bliss because he is the nature of enlightenment, which is the state of the arising of great bliss.

original: de rnams dang bdag nyid rgyun mi 'chad pa yangs shing rgyang che ba'i rab tu dga' ba 'phel bar gyur pas na dga' chen po'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang bdag nyid rgyun mi 'chad pa yangs shing rgyang che ba'i rab tu dga' ba 'phel bar gyur pas na dga' chen po'o //
translated: And since the self and those beings are continuously expanding in the ever-increasing joy of the first spiritual level, it is great joy.

original: de nyid du tshad med cing rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba rab tu 'phel ba'i mthar thug pa ni mgu ba chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid du tshad med cing rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba rab tu 'phel ba'i mthar thug pa ni mgu ba chen po'o //
translated: And since the joy and bliss of that level are immeasurable and uninterrupted, it is great delight.🔽And since all of them are individually cognized as the nondual reality that is like an illusion, it is great mental equanimity.

original: de dag thams cad kyang sgyu ma dang 'dra ba gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid so sor rig pas lhun gyis grub par sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa la mkhas pa'i blos bstan pa yin pas log par sgrub par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang sgyu ma dang 'dra ba gnyis su med pa'i chos nyid so sor rig pas lhun gyis grub par sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa la mkhas pa'i blos bstan pa yin pas log par sgrub par ni mi bya'o //
translated: And since the mind is skilled in spontaneously accomplishing the benefit of all sentient beings, it is great wisdom.🔽All of this is taught by the Buddha's mind, so one should not misrepresent it.

original: yang dag par sgrub pa'am rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang ba las rang nyid kyis rtogs par bya yi /
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa'am rnal 'byor rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang ba las rang nyid kyis rtogs par bya yi /
translated: One should understand it either through correct practice or by following the yoga tantras.

original: rang dags  log par brtag par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: rang dags  log par brtag par ni mi bya'o //
translated: One should not misrepresent it through one's own imagination.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i sgo nas khyad par du byas pa ni /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku'i sgo nas khyad par du byas pa ni /
translated: Now, the Buddha's body is distinguished as follows.

original: gzugs che lus kyang che ba ste //
analyzed: gzugs che lus kyang che ba ste //
translated: His form is large and his body is large.

original: kho dog chen zhing lus bong che //
analyzed: kho dog chen zhing lus bong che //
translated: He is great in size and has a large body.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: de la gzugs che ba ni skye bo rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir sna tshogs gzugs can gyis 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dbang gis gzugs sna tshogs pa'i tshul dang ldan par bdag nyid kyi dngos po sprul zhing 'gro ba thams cad khyab cing che ba'i gzugs bas na🔽gzugs che ba'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs che ba ni skye bo rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir sna tshogs gzugs can gyis 'gro ba 'dul ba'i dbang gis gzugs sna tshogs pa'i tshul dang ldan par bdag nyid kyi dngos po sprul zhing 'gro ba thams cad khyab cing che ba'i gzugs bas na gzugs che ba'o //
translated: Therein, he is great in form because he emanates his own body in the manner of various forms, by the power of controlling the world with various forms in order to guide beings. He is great in form because he pervades all worlds.

original: ji ltar @136b tshad phra rab dang che ba la sogs pa'i gzugs can gyi gdul ba'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir lha la sogs pa bas lhag par che ba'i su ston pas na lus kyang che ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar @136b tshad phra rab dang che ba la sogs pa'i gzugs can gyi gdul ba'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir lha la sogs pa bas lhag par che ba'i su ston pas na lus kyang che ba ste /
translated: He is great in body because he shows himself as greater than the gods and so on in order to guide those beings who are to be guided by form, such as the subtle and gross elements.

original: lus kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas lus che ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas lus che ba'o //
translated: He is great in body because he is a body and is great.

original: ser po dang / nag po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ljang gu dang / 'dren ma'i kha dog gi shin tu 'bar bas na kha dog chen po ste /
analyzed: ser po dang / nag po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / ljang gu dang / 'dren ma'i kha dog gi shin tu 'bar bas na kha dog chen po ste /
translated: Great color means that it is very bright with the colors of white, yellow, black, red, green, and variegated.

original: 'di la kha dog chen po mnga' bas na kha dog che ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la kha dog chen po mnga' bas na kha dog che ba'o //
translated: He is great in color because he possesses great color.

original: de yang kha dog gis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang kha dog gis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is for the sake of taming those beings who are to be tamed by color.

original: lus kyi sku'i mdangs 'od 'bar ba ste /
analyzed: lus kyi sku'i mdangs 'od 'bar ba ste /
translated: The body is the radiance of the kāya.

original: rang gi 'od kyis lha la sogs pa'i mdangs zil gyis gnon pas na lus bong chen po mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi 'od kyis lha la sogs pa'i mdangs zil gyis gnon pas na lus bong chen po mnga' ba ste /
translated: He is great in body because his own radiance outshines the radiance of the gods and so forth.

original: de yang lus po'i che ba'i gdul bya dag 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang lus po'i che ba'i gdul bya dag 'dul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is for the sake of taming those to be tamed by the greatness of the body.

original: 'od la sogs pa khyad par du 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'od la sogs pa khyad par du 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the superiority of the light and so on,

original: ming yang che zhing rgya che ba //
analyzed: ming yang che zhing rgya che ba //
translated: it is said, “The name is also great and vast.”

original: dkyil 'khor chen po yangs pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po yangs pa yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The great maṇḍala is vast.

original: gang la ming chen po yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste ;
analyzed: gang la ming chen po yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste ;
translated: That which has a great name is so called.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi skad dang rjes su mthun pa'i ming dang brda dang tha snyad du btags pas rab tu grangs pa'i phyir ming yang che ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi skad dang rjes su mthun pa'i ming dang brda dang tha snyad du btags pas rab tu grangs pa'i phyir ming yang che ba'o //
translated: It is a great name because it is well known as a name, symbol, and convention that accords with the language of all worlds.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs mang zhing rgya che ba mnga' bas na rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs mang zhing rgya che ba mnga' bas na rgya che ba'o //
translated: It is vast because it possesses a great and vast accumulation of merit from generosity and so forth.

original: 'do zer gyi tshogs kyis zlum por bskor bas na dkyil 'khor chen po'o //
analyzed: 'do zer gyi tshogs kyis zlum por bskor bas na dkyil 'khor chen po'o //
translated: It is a great mandala because it is surrounded by a circle of light rays.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad khyab pas yangs pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor mnga' bas na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad khyab pas yangs pa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor mnga' bas na /
translated: It is a vast mandala because it possesses a vast circle of light that pervades all world systems.

original: dkyil 'khor chen po yangs pa yin //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po yangs pa yin //
translated: Thus it is called a great vast mandala.

original: zhes bya'o // mtshon chas khyad par du 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // mtshon chas khyad par du 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the distinction of weapons, it is said:

original: shes rab mtshon chen 'chang ba ste //
analyzed: shes rab mtshon chen 'chang ba ste //
translated: It is the great weapon of wisdom,

original: nyon mongs chen po lcags kyu mchog //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs chen po lcags kyu mchog //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: the supreme hook for great afflictions.

original: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rtogs pa'i tshul gyi nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab chen po shes rab ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mngon par rtogs pa'i tshul gyi nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab chen po shes rab ste /
translated: Wisdom is the great wisdom of discernment that fully realizes all phenomena in all their aspects.

original: thos pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: thos pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of hearing and so on.

original: de nyid ni mtshon cha ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni mtshon cha ste /
translated: It is a weapon

original: nye bar dmigs pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa sel bar byed pas na mtshon no //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa sel bar byed pas na mtshon no //
translated: because it eliminates the afflictions of the apprehension of objects and so on.

original: de bsnams pa ni 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de bsnams pa ni 'chang ba'o //
translated: To hold it is to possess it.

original: yang man shes rab dang mtshon cha dag ni shes rab mtshon cha ste /
analyzed: yang man shes rab dang mtshon cha dag ni shes rab mtshon cha ste /
translated: Further, wisdom and weapon are wisdom weapon.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam dang ral gri phyag g-yon dang g-yas na bsnams pa'i rdo rje rnon po'i ting nge 'dzin yin pas na shes rab mtshon chen 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam dang ral gri phyag g-yon dang g-yas na bsnams pa'i rdo rje rnon po'i ting nge 'dzin yin pas na shes rab mtshon chen 'chang ba'o //
translated: Since it is the concentration of sharp vajra that holds the Perfection of Wisdom scripture and sword in the left and right hands, it holds the great wisdom weapon.

original: glang po che myos pa dang 'dra bar bzlog par dka' zhing che ba'i @137a * //
analyzed: glang po che myos pa dang 'dra bar bzlog par dka' zhing che ba'i @137a * //
translated: It is difficult to turn back like a crazy elephant, and it is great🔽because it is the great wisdom that eliminates the afflictions.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyan mongs pa bzlog nas rang dbang du mdzad pas lcags kyu dang 'dra ba'i phyir lcags kyu'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyan mongs pa bzlog nas rang dbang du mdzad pas lcags kyu dang 'dra ba'i phyir lcags kyu'o //
translated: Since it controls the afflictions such as passion and so on, and makes them one's own, it is like a hook, and so it is a hook.

original: mchog ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: mchog ni gtso bo'o //
translated: Supreme means foremost.

original: 'dir yang lcags kyu smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'dir yang lcags kyu smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa'i don tsam du zad do //
translated: Here, the mention of the hook is merely for the sake of illustration.

original: des na gzhag pa yang gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: des na gzhag pa yang gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the other [emblems] should also be taken.

original: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam dang / ral gri dang / zhags pa dang / lcags kyu bsnams pa'i rje btsun rdo rje rnon po nyid 'dod pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis phul du byung bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i glegs bam dang / ral gri dang / zhags pa dang / lcags kyu bsnams pa'i rje btsun rdo rje rnon po nyid 'dod pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis phul du byung bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the Venerable Vajra-sharpness, who holds the book of the perfection of wisdom, the sword, the noose, and the hook, should be seen as supreme, distinguished by such qualities as great desire and so on.

original: phyi dang nang gi grangs pa dang ye shes kyi bye brag gis khyad par du gyur pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir //🔽grags chen snyan grangs chen po ste //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi grangs pa dang ye shes kyi bye brag gis khyad par du gyur pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir // grags chen snyan grangs chen po ste //
translated: In order to demonstrate the distinction of the external and internal, the number, and the specific wisdom,🔽[the text] says:🔽Greatly renowned, greatly famous,

original: snang ba chen po gsal ba che //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: snang ba chen po gsal ba che //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Great light, great illumination.

original: gang la grangs pa chen po yod pa de ni grangs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: gang la grangs pa chen po yod pa de ni grangs pa chen po'o //
translated: She is the Great Numeration because she has a great number.

original: shes rab dang rtogs pa dang ye shes kyi shin tu phul du byung bas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir grags pa chen mo mnga' bas na grags chen /
analyzed: shes rab dang rtogs pa dang ye shes kyi shin tu phul du byung bas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir grags pa chen mo mnga' bas na grags chen /
translated: She is the Great Fame because she has great fame due to the excellence of her wisdom, realization, and gnosis.

original: cho 'phrul shin tu rmad du byung ba sna tshogs pas phyi rol gyi grags pa'i gnas su nye bar mtshon par gyur pas snyan grags chen po'o //
analyzed: cho 'phrul shin tu rmad du byung ba sna tshogs pas phyi rol gyi grags pa'i gnas su nye bar mtshon par gyur pas snyan grags chen po'o //
translated: She is the Great Renown because she is indicated as a place of external fame by means of various marvelous miracles.

original: nang gi sems kyi snang ba dang ldan pa'i tshul can bas snang ba chen mo'o //🔽gsal ba chen po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi sems kyi snang ba dang ldan pa'i tshul can bas snang ba chen mo'o // gsal ba chen po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: She is the Great Light because she has the mode of possessing the inner mental appearance.🔽She is the Great Illumination because she possesses the great illumination.

original: phyi rol du 'do zer gyis kun nas bskor ba'i rang bzhin mnga' ba ste gsal ba che ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'do zer gyis kun nas bskor ba'i rang bzhin mnga' ba ste gsal ba che ba'o //
translated: She is the Great Illumination because she possesses the great illumination.

original: sprul pa'i sgo'i khyad par du gyur par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽mkhas pa sgyu 'phrul chen po 'chang //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sgo'i khyad par du gyur par bstan pa'i phyir / mkhas pa sgyu 'phrul chen po 'chang //
translated: In order to teach the distinction of the door of emanation,🔽she is the Great Illusion Holder,

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i don grub pa //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i don grub pa //
translated: the Accomplisher of the Great Illusion.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i dga' bas dga' //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i dga' bas dga' //
translated: He is the great magician, the great illusionist.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i mig 'phrul can //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i mig 'phrul can // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He is the great magician, the great illusionist.

original: skye bo rnams la ji ltar sdug pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi sku ston par mdzad pas na mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo rnams la ji ltar sdug pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin can gyi sku ston par mdzad pas na mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is the expert, because he displays a body of such a nature as is pleasing to beings.

original: gdul bya'i sems can ji ltar 'dul ba dang / rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs su sprul pa ste /
analyzed: gdul bya'i sems can ji ltar 'dul ba dang / rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs su sprul pa ste /
translated: He is the emanator of forms in accordance with the disciples, the sentient beings to be trained.

original: de lta bu'i sgyu 'phrul mnga' bas na sgyu 'phrul chen po 'chang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sgyu 'phrul mnga' bas na sgyu 'phrul chen po 'chang ngo //
translated: He is the great magician, because he possesses such an illusion.

original: sems can dang ngan song rnams ni dngos po med pa nyid de de lta na yang sgyu 'phrul chen po'i don sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: sems can dang ngan song rnams ni dngos po med pa nyid de de lta na yang sgyu 'phrul chen po'i don sgrub pa ste /
translated: He is the great magician, because he accomplishes the aim of the great illusion, even though sentient beings and the evil destinies are non-existent.

original: gdul bya'i sems can sangs rgyas nyid la rab tu 'jog pa de sgrub par mdzad pas na sgyu 'phrul chen po'i don du grub pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i sems can sangs rgyas nyid la rab tu 'jog pa de sgrub par mdzad pas na sgyu 'phrul chen po'i don du grub pa'o //
translated: He is the great magician, because he accomplishes the aim of the great illusion, since he establishes the sentient beings to be trained in Buddhahood.

original: rnam pa thams cad du sems can gyi don mdzad pa la mngon par dgye pas sgyu 'phrul chen po'i dga' ba la dgyes pas sgyu 'phrul chen po dga' bas @137b dga'o ;🔽/ de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du sems can gyi don mdzad pa la mngon par dgye pas sgyu 'phrul chen po'i dga' ba la dgyes pas sgyu 'phrul chen po dga' bas @137b dga'o ; / de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: He is delighted by the great magic of delight, since he is delighted in the performance of the aims of sentient beings in every way.

original: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i mig 'phrul can //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul chen po'i mig 'phrul can //
translated: Therefore, he is the great magician, the one with the magic of great magic.

original: zhes bya'o // da ni sa bcu la bzhugs shing sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i yon tan gyi rang gi ngo bos shin tu phul du byung ba'i bdag nyid chen pos khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // da ni sa bcu la bzhugs shing sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i yon tan gyi rang gi ngo bos shin tu phul du byung ba'i bdag nyid chen pos khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate his superiority by the nature of his own excellence in the ten perfections such as generosity while dwelling on the ten stages, he says:

original: sbyin bdag chen po gtso bo ste /
analyzed: sbyin bdag chen po gtso bo ste /
translated: He is the great donor, the chief,🔽The supreme holder of the great morality,

original: tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i mchog / bzod chen 'chang ba brtan pa po //
analyzed: tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i mchog / bzod chen 'chang ba brtan pa po //
translated: The patient one who has great patience,

original: brtson 'grus chen po brtul ba yin //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po brtul ba yin //
translated: The one with great effort who is persevering,

original: bsam gtan chen po ting nge 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: bsam gtan chen po ting nge 'dzin gnas //
translated: The one with great concentration who abides in meditative concentration,

original: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba //
analyzed: shes rab chen po lus 'chang ba //
translated: The one with great wisdom who holds the body,

original: stobs po che la thams cad che ba //
analyzed: stobs po che la thams cad che ba //
translated: The great powerful one who is great in every way.

original: smon lam ye shes rgya mtsho ste //
analyzed: smon lam ye shes rgya mtsho ste //
translated: The ocean of wisdom aspirations.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyad pas na de la bzhugs te /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyad pas na de la bzhugs te /
translated: On the bodhisattva ground Very Joyful, the bodhisattva practices the perfection of generosity to an extraordinary degree.

original: sbyin pa'i las tshad med pa mdzad pas na /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i las tshad med pa mdzad pas na /
translated: By performing immeasurable acts of generosity,

original: de yang blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: as taught in the Sūtra of the Teaching of Akṣayamati:

original: btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yongs su sbyang ba tshad med pa ste 'di ltar tshe dang / spobs pa dang / bde ba dang / stobs dang / kha dog nye bar bstan pa'i phyir zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yongs su sbyang ba tshad med pa ste 'di ltar tshe dang / spobs pa dang / bde ba dang / stobs dang / kha dog nye bar bstan pa'i phyir zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas sbyin pa'o //
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the bodhisattvas’ purification of generosity is immeasurable. Thus, in order to demonstrate life, eloquence, happiness, strength, and complexion, they give food to those who desire food.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / sred pa thams cad bsal ba'i phyir ba 'dod pa rnams la btung ba sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / sred pa thams cad bsal ba'i phyir ba 'dod pa rnams la btung ba sbyin pa'o //
translated: In order to dispel all afflictions and craving, they give drink to those who desire drink.

original: bde ba dang 'byor ba'i dngos po thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang 'byor ba'i dngos po thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: To gather all the things that are pleasant and useful, he gives vehicles to those who want vehicles.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang gser gyi kha dog lta bu'i mdog yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir gos 'dod pa rnams la gos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang gser gyi kha dog lta bu'i mdog yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir gos 'dod pa rnams la gos sbyin pa'o //
translated: To purify the golden color of his skin, which is the sign of his shame and modesty, he gives clothes to those who want clothes.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan yongs su gzigs par bya ba'i phyir mar 'dod pa rnams la mar me sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i spyan yongs su gzigs par bya ba'i phyir mar 'dod pa rnams la mar me sbyin pa'o //
translated: To have the vision of the Tathagata's divine eye, he gives lamps to those who want lamps.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir rol mos sgra 'dod pa rnams la rol mo'i sgra sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir rol mos sgra 'dod pa rnams la rol mo'i sgra sbyin pa'o //
translated: To have the purity of the Tathagata's divine ear, he gives music to those who want music.

original: tshul khrims dang thos pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi spos kyis byug pa'i phyir spos dang byug pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang thos pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi spos kyis byug pa'i phyir spos dang byug pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: To be anointed with the perfume of morality, learning, and samadhi, he gives perfumes and ointments.

original: gzung dang spobs pa dang byang chub kyi yang lag gi me tog thob par bya ba'i phyir me tog phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la me tog phreng ba sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzung dang spobs pa dang byang chub kyi yang lag gi me tog thob par bya ba'i phyir me tog phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la me tog phreng ba sbyin pa'o //
translated: The giving of garlands to those who want garlands, in order to obtain the hand flowers of retention, eloquence, and enlightenment.

original: lus kyi dri yid du 'ong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir phye ma 'dod pa rnams la phye ma sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dri yid du 'ong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir phye ma 'dod pa rnams la phye ma sbyin pa'o //
translated: The giving of powders to those who want powders, in order to obtain a pleasing bodily fragrance.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba'i mchog yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro thams cad 'dod pa rnams la ro thams cad sbyin pa'o //🔽sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang skyabs dang mgon dang @138a * //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba'i mchog yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro thams cad 'dod pa rnams la ro thams cad sbyin pa'o // sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang skyabs dang mgon dang @138a * //
translated: The giving of all kinds of flavors to those who want them, in order to perfect the supreme flavor of the marks of a great person.

original: dpung gnyen bya ba'i phyir gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dpung gnyen bya ba'i phyir gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas sbyin pa'o //
translated: The giving of dwellings to those who want dwellings, in order to be a refuge, a protection, a place of rest, and a support for all beings.

original: sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spang ba dang / lha dang / tshangs ba'i gnas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzigs cha thob par bya ba'i phyir mal cha 'dod pa rnams lam la cha sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spang ba dang / lha dang / tshangs ba'i gnas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzigs cha thob par bya ba'i phyir mal cha 'dod pa rnams lam la cha sbyin pa'o //
translated: The giving of beds to those who want beds, in order to obtain the state of Brahma and the state of a Tathagata, and to eliminate all obscurations.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i sa thams cad kyi byang chub kyi snying po'i rdo rje'i gdan thob par bya ba'i phyir stan 'dod pa rnams la stan sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i sa thams cad kyi byang chub kyi snying po'i rdo rje'i gdan thob par bya ba'i phyir stan 'dod pa rnams la stan sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is the giving of seats to those who want seats in order to obtain the vajra seat at the site of enlightenment in all the great trichiliocosm.

original: byang chub kyi yo byad thams cad yongs su bskang ba'i phyir yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yo byad thams cad yongs su bskang ba'i phyir yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is the giving of necessities to those who want necessities in order to fulfill all the requisites for enlightenment.

original: mi rga mi 'chi ba'i bdud rtsi'i bde bas yongs su bskang ba'i phyir na ba dang sgra na 'dod pa thams cad la sman sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mi rga mi 'chi ba'i bdud rtsi'i bde bas yongs su bskang ba'i phyir na ba dang sgra na 'dod pa thams cad la sman sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is the giving of medicine to all the sick and the infirm in order to fulfill the bliss of immortality and deathlessness.

original: rang dbang dang rang nyams dang / rang byung gi ye shes bskang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bran pho dang bran mo yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rang dbang dang rang nyams dang / rang byung gi ye shes bskang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bran pho dang bran mo yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: It is the giving of male and female servants to the bodhisattvas in order to fulfill self-mastery, self-enjoyment, and self-arisen intuition.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis yongs su bskang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gser dang / dngul dang ; nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'u rya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / bye ru dang /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan dam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis yongs su bskang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gser dang / dngul dang ; nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'u rya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / bye ru dang /
translated: In order to fulfill the thirty-two marks of a great person, the bodhisattvas' generosity is giving away all their gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, moonstones, coral,

original: rin po che thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: and all kinds of precious substances.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyan sna tshogs sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rgyan sna tshogs sbyin pa'o //
translated: In order to perfect the eighty minor marks, the bodhisattvas' generosity is giving away all kinds of ornaments.

original: gtsug tor bltar mi mthong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtsug gi nor bu dang cod pan sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor bltar mi mthong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gtsug gi nor bu dang cod pan sbyin pa'o //
translated: In order to attain the invisible crown protrusion, the bodhisattvas' generosity is giving away their crown jewels and diadems.

original: theg pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rta dang / ba la dang / shing rta dang / dpung bu chu dang / bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rta dang / ba la dang / shing rta dang / dpung bu chu dang / bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: In order to perfect the Great Vehicle, the bodhisattvas' generosity is giving away their horses, elephants, chariots, troops, and vehicles.

original: bsam gtan gyi yan lag dang yan lag gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi yan lag dang yan lag gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to perfect the limbs of concentration and the collection of limbs,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyed mos tshal dang / gzhal med kha dang / dka' thub kyi gas tshal dang / gtsug lag khang yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyed mos tshal dang / gzhal med kha dang / dka' thub kyi gas tshal dang / gtsug lag khang yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas give parks, palaces, and monasteries.

original: bla med pa yang dag par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bla med pa yang dag par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to attain unsurpassable, true, complete enlightenment,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bu pho dang / chung ma dang / sdug pa yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bu pho dang / chung ma dang / sdug pa yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas give their sons, daughters, and beloved spouses.

original: dam pa'i chos mdzod dang / bang ba dag yongs su dgong ba'i phyir byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mdzod dang / bang ba dag yongs su dgong ba'i phyir byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: In order to give away the treasury and storehouse of the holy Dharma, the bodhisattvas give their wealth, grain, treasuries, and storehouses.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang @138b ldan pa dam pa'i chos kyi rgyal po byang chub kyi snying par 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi grong dang / grong khyer dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang @138b ldan pa dam pa'i chos kyi rgyal po byang chub kyi snying par 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi grong dang / grong khyer dang / yul 'khor dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor dang /
translated: In order to go to the seat of awakening, the city of the bodhisattvas, the capital of the sacred Dharma, endowed with the most sublime of all aspects, the bodhisattvas are to be honored with the most sublime offerings.🔽

original: 'dzam bu'i gling dang / gling bzhin pa'i rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling dang / gling bzhin pa'i rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas' generosity of giving away all their towns, cities, countries, and capitals, as well as their universal sovereignty over Jambudvipa and the four-continent world system, is for the purpose of going to the site of enlightenment, the sovereignty of the Dharma, endowed with the highest of all aspects.

original: chos la dga' zhing mos pa thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi bde ba dang / dga' ba dang / rtsed mo thams cad gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: chos la dga' zhing mos pa thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi bde ba dang / dga' ba dang / rtsed mo thams cad gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas' generosity of giving away all their pleasures, enjoyments, and amusements is for the purpose of attaining delight in and devotion to the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi rkang pas byang chub kyi chos kyi snying por 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rkang ba sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi rkang pas byang chub kyi chos kyi snying por 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rkang ba sbyin pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas' generosity of giving away their feet is for the purpose of going to the site of enlightenment by means of the feet of the holy Dharma.

original: sems can thams cad la dam pa'i chos kyi lag pa sbyin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lag mthil sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la dam pa'i chos kyi lag pa sbyin pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lag mthil sbyin pa'o //
translated: The palm of the hand is the bodhisattvas' gift of the hand, in order to give the gift of the holy Dharma to all sentient beings.

original: dbang po ma nyams pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnab dang sna sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po ma nyams pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rnab dang sna sbyin pa'o //
translated: The nose and ears are the bodhisattvas' gift of the nose and ears, in order to perfect the unimpaired sense faculties.

original: sems can thams cad kyis sgrib pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang chos kyi spyan thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub rnams kyi mig sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis sgrib pa med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang chos kyi spyan thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub rnams kyi mig sbyin pa'o //
translated: The eyes are the bodhisattvas' gift of the eyes, in order that all sentient beings attain the unobstructed Buddha eye and Dharma eye.

original: khams gsum thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i mtshan thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par phyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yan lag gi dam pa mgo sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i mtshan thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par phyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yan lag gi dam pa mgo sbyin pa'o //
translated: The head, the best of all the limbs, is the bodhisattvas' gift of the head, in order to attain the gnosis of omniscience, which is superior to all the marks of the three realms.

original: snying po med pa'i lus snying po blang zhing nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi sha dang khrag yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: snying po med pa'i lus snying po blang zhing nye bar 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi sha dang khrag yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity of giving away one’s flesh and blood is for the Bodhisattvas to take the essence from a body that has no essence, and to nourish those in need.

original: 'jam pa dang snum pa dang gser gyi kha dog lta bu'i mdog yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi bags pa yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa dang snum pa dang gser gyi kha dog lta bu'i mdog yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi bags pa yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity of giving away one’s skin is for the Bodhisattvas to obtain a skin that is soft, smooth, and the color of gold.

original: sangs rgyas kyi su rdo rje lta mi shigs shing sra ba sred med kyi bu ltar mkhregs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi rus pa dang / rkang sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi su rdo rje lta mi shigs shing sra ba sred med kyi bu ltar mkhregs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub smes dpa' rnams kyi rus pa dang / rkang sbyin pa'o //
translated: The generosity of giving away one’s bones and marrow is for the Bodhisattvas to obtain the vajra-like body of a Buddha, which is indestructible, solid, and as hard as Nārāyaṇa.

original: btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub smes dpa' rnams la mi mthun pa'i longs spyod yongs su tshol ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub smes dpa' rnams la mi mthun pa'i longs spyod yongs su tshol ba'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Subhūti, there is no generosity of the Bodhisattvas that involves seeking out incompatible enjoyments.

original: sems can thams cad la gnod pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la gnod pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity of the Bodhisattvas that involves harming any being.

original: nga rgyal bskyed cing sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: nga rgyal bskyed cing sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is motivated by pride.

original: 'jigs pa dang sdug pa dang 'dzem pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang sdug pa dang 'dzem pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is fearful, or that is done out of love or respect.

original: mgron du gnyer te yongs su mi gtong ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: mgron du gnyer te yongs su mi gtong ba'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given with the expectation of being invited.

original: ji skad smras pa las chung ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa las chung ba'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is less than what was promised.

original: bzang po yod la bzang po ma yin pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: bzang po yod la bzang po ma yin pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is bad, when good is available.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa ma yin pas sbyin @139a * //🔽ba med do //🔽g-yo dang sgyus sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa ma yin pas sbyin @139a * // ba med do // g-yo dang sgyus sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is not done with a higher motivation.🔽There is no generosity that is deceitful or fraudulent.

original: bcom pa'i sbyin pa med do //🔽las kyi rnam par smin pa dang rgod pas sbyin pa med do //🔽log pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: bcom pa'i sbyin pa med do // las kyi rnam par smin pa dang rgod pas sbyin pa med do // log pa'i bsam pas sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given with contempt.🔽There is no generosity that is given thoughtlessly.🔽There is no generosity that is given with a perverted motivation.

original: gti mug gi bsam pas sbyin pa med do //🔽'chol ba'i bsam pas sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: gti mug gi bsam pas sbyin pa med do // 'chol ba'i bsam pas sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given with a motivation of confusion.🔽There is no generosity that is given with a motivation of dependency.

original: phyin ci log gi bsam pas sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi bsam pas sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given with a perverted motivation.

original: ma dad par sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: ma dad par sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given without faith.

original: mi dga' bar sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: mi dga' bar sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given without joy.

original: nye bar gnas pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given with the expectation of a reward.

original: ngor bltas te sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: ngor bltas te sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to reputation.

original: sems can thams cad tha dad pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad tha dad pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to the distinctions among sentient beings.

original: sbyin pa'i gnas 'dam zhing sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gnas 'dam zhing sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to the distinctions among the fields of merit.

original: sems can thams cad la sbyin pa'i gnas ma yin par brnyas shing sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sbyin pa'i gnas ma yin par brnyas shing sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to the distinctions among sentient beings as fields of merit.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang tshul khrims 'chal ba la bstod pa dang smad pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang tshul khrims 'chal ba la bstod pa dang smad pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to praising the morally disciplined and blaming the immoral.

original: lan la re ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: lan la re ba'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to receiving something in return.

original: grangs pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa'i phyir sbyin pa med do //🔽bdag la bstod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: grangs pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa'i phyir sbyin pa med do // bdag la bstod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to fame, reputation, or praise.🔽There is no generosity that is done with a view to praising oneself and blaming others.

original: yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i sbyin pa med do //🔽yid la gcags pa'i sbyin pa med do //🔽'gyod pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: yongs su gdung bar byed pa'i sbyin pa med do // yid la gcags pa'i sbyin pa med do // 'gyod pa'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to tormenting others.🔽There is no generosity that is done with a view to regret.

original: gnod par sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: gnod par sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is done with a view to remorse.🔽There is no generosity that is done with a view to harming others.

original: gzhan gyi re ba la bab pa'i sbyin pa med do //🔽smad par sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi re ba la bab pa'i sbyin pa med do //🔽smad par sbyin pa med do //

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa la re ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa la re ba'i sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that hopes for the ripening of karma.

original: dpags te sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: dpags te sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is measured.

original: khro ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / gnod smes can bskyed pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: khro ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / gnod smes can bskyed pa'i sbyin pa med do //

original: slong ba rnams la gnod pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: slong ba rnams la gnod pa'i sbyin pa med do //

original: 'phya ba dang co 'dri ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: 'phya ba dang co 'dri ba'i sbyin pa med do //

original: phyin phyogs su sbyin pa med do //🔽bskyur te sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: phyin phyogs su sbyin pa med do // bskyur te sbyin pa med do //
translated: There is no generosity that is given in the wrong way.🔽There is no generosity that is given with contempt.

original: bsti stang du ma byas pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: bsti stang du ma byas pa'i sbyin pa med do //

original: bdag gi lag ma bdar ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: bdag gi lag ma bdar ba'i sbyin pa med do //

original: mi rtag pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i sbyin pa med do //

original: shin tu ma sbyangs pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: shin tu ma sbyangs pa'i sbyin pa med do //

translated: There is no generosity that is given with a mind that is disturbed with regard to others.🔽There is no generosity that is given in a way that is incomplete.🔽There is no generosity that is given in a way that is less than what was offered.

original: spro ba las mi spro bar 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: spro ba las mi spro bar 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa med do //

original: log par sgrub pa'i sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: log par sgrub pa'i sbyin pa med do //

analyzed: skye ba 'dod pa'i sbyin pa med do //
