analyzed: brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang 'jig rten skyong ba dang lha thams cad du skye bar smon cing sbyin pa med @139b do ;

analyzed: sgrar ma yin / snar ma yin / drir ma yin / lcer ma yin /
translated: not imputed as the sign of sound,🔽not imputed as the sign of the nose,

original: ror ma yin /
analyzed: ror ma yin /
translated: not imputed as the sign of smell,🔽not imputed as the sign of the tongue,🔽not imputed as the sign of taste,

original: lus su ma yin /
analyzed: lus su ma yin /
translated: not imputed as the sign of the body,🔽and not imputed as the sign of touch,

original: reg byar ma yin zhing yid kyi mtshan mar sgro btags pa med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: reg byar ma yin zhing yid kyi mtshan mar sgro btags pa med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality not to be attached to the object of touch, and not to superimpose a mental sign.

original: gang la lus dang ngag dang sems su sgro btags pa med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang la lus dang ngag dang sems su sgro btags pa med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality not to superimpose body, speech, and mind.

original: gang tshe gcig pa'i phyir zhi gnas kyi mtshan nyid de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang tshe gcig pa'i phyir zhi gnas kyi mtshan nyid de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality which is the characteristic of calm abiding because of being one-pointed.

original: chos rab tu 'byed pa la mkhas pas lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid de ni tshul khrims so ;
analyzed: chos rab tu 'byed pa la mkhas pas lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid de ni tshul khrims so ;
translated: It is morality which is the characteristic of insight because of being skilled in discriminating phenomena.

original: / gang stong pa nyid rig pa dang / mtshan ma'i mtha' dang / smon pa med cing khams gsum pa dang ma 'dres pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: / gang stong pa nyid rig pa dang / mtshan ma'i mtha' dang / smon pa med cing khams gsum pa dang ma 'dres pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality which is emptiness, the extreme of signs, and wishlessness, and which is not mixed with the three realms.

original: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa skyes pas rab tu phye ba'i skye ba la bzod pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang mngon par 'du ma byas pa skyes pas rab tu phye ba'i skye ba la bzod pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality which is the acceptance of birth that is distinguished by the arising of the unconditioned.

original: gang la ma byas shing bya ba med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang la ma byas shing bya ba med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality which is not done and is not to be done.

original: gang sngon gyi mthar ma byung ba dang ; phyi ma'i mthar ma 'phos pa dang / bar du mi gnas pa ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang sngon gyi mthar ma byung ba dang ; phyi ma'i mthar ma 'phos pa dang / bar du mi gnas pa ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is that which does not come from the past, does not go to the future, and does not remain in the present.

original: gang sems dri ma med pa dang / rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa dang ma 'dres pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang sems dri ma med pa dang / rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pa dang / yid la byed pa dang ma 'dres pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is that which is not sullied by the mind, does not dwell in consciousness, and is not mixed with mental activity.

original: gang 'dod pa'i khams la mi brten pa dang / gzugs kyi khams la mi gnas pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams la mi 'dug pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i khams la mi brten pa dang / gzugs kyi khams la mi gnas pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams la mi 'dug pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is that which does not rest in the desire realm, does not abide in the form realm, and does not remain in the formless realm.

original: gang 'dod chags kyi rdul med pa dang / gnod sems dang tha ba dang skyon dang khong khro ba bsal ba dang / gti mug gi mun pa dang ma rig pa med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang 'dod chags kyi rdul med pa dang / gnod sems dang tha ba dang skyon dang khong khro ba bsal ba dang / gti mug gi mun pa dang ma rig pa med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is that which is free from the dust of desire, free from the faults of anger and malice, and free from the darkness of ignorance and delusion.

original: gang rtag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / brten nas byung ba dang 'gal ba med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang rtag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / brten nas byung ba dang 'gal ba med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is that which is not eternal, not annihilated, and does not contradict dependent origination.

original: gang ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / ngar 'dzin pa bor ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba la mi gnas pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang ngar 'dzin pa med pa dang / ngar 'dzin pa bor ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba la mi gnas pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality not to grasp at “I” and “mine,” to abandon the grasping at “I” and “mine,” and not to abide in the view of the transitory collection.

original: gang ming dang brda par ma zhen pa dang / gzugs khyi mtshan nyid la mi gnas pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang ma 'dres pa de ni tshul khrims so /
analyzed: gang ming dang brda par ma zhen pa dang / gzugs khyi mtshan nyid la mi gnas pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang ma 'dres pa de ni tshul khrims so /
translated: It is morality not to be attached to names and conventional expressions, not to abide in the characteristics of form, and not to be mixed up with names and forms.

original: gang rgyu'i bag la nyal med pa dang / lta ba dang kun nas ldang ba kun nas ma langs pa dang / sgrib pa dang 'gyod pa la mi gnas pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang rgyu'i bag la nyal med pa dang / lta ba dang kun nas ldang ba kun nas ma langs pa dang / sgrib pa dang 'gyod pa la mi gnas pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality not to have the latent tendencies of causes, not to have the latent tendencies of views, not to have the latent tendencies of the afflictions, and not to abide in obscurations and regrets.🔽It is morality not to have a basis for the roots of nonvirtue, such as attachment,🔽not to have a basis for the roots of nonvirtue, such as aversion,

original: gang la chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas med pa dang / zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas med pa dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i @142a * //🔽rtsa ba'i gnas med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang la chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas med pa dang / zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas med pa dang / gti mug mi dge ba'i @142a * //🔽rtsa ba'i gnas med pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: and not to have a basis for the roots of nonvirtue, such as delusion.

original: gang mi dge ba med pa dang yongs su gdung ba med pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang mi dge ba med pa dang yongs su gdung ba med pa dang shin tu sbyangs pa'i mtshan nyid de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: That which is characterized by non-demerit, non-affliction, and non-exhaustion is morality.

original: gang chos kyi skus sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi gcod pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'i phyir chos kyi rigs mi gcod pa dang 'dus ma byas kyi rab tu phye ba'i phyir dge 'dun gyi rigs mi gcod pa de ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang chos kyi skus sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi gcod pa dang / chos kyi dbyings dbyer med pa'i phyir chos kyi rigs mi gcod pa dang 'dus ma byas kyi rab tu phye ba'i phyir dge 'dun gyi rigs mi gcod pa de ni tshul khrims so //
translated: That which is morality is the non-exhaustion of the lineage of the Buddha because of the Dharma Body, the non-exhaustion of the lineage of the Dharma because of the indivisibility of the Dharma-element, and the non-exhaustion of the lineage of the Saṅgha because of the division into the unconditioned.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu tshul khrims mi zad pa ni rgyun mi zad pa'i phyir blta'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu tshul khrims mi zad pa ni rgyun mi zad pa'i phyir blta'o //
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, morality is to be seen as inexhaustible because of its continuity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi tshul khrims ni skye ba'i gnas rnams kyis zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi tshul khrims ni skye ba'i gnas rnams kyis zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of ordinary people is exhausted by the places of rebirth.

original: phyi rol pa'i lnga mngon par shes pa rnams kyi tshul khrims ni mngon par shes pa nyams pas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i lnga mngon par shes pa rnams kyi tshul khrims ni mngon par shes pa nyams pas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of the non-Buddhist seers is exhausted by the loss of their superknowledges.

original: mi rnams kyi tshul khrims ni dge ba bcu'i lam zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi tshul khrims ni dge ba bcu'i lam zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of humans is exhausted by the exhaustion of the path of the ten virtues.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu rnams kyi tshul khrims ni bsod nams zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu rnams kyi tshul khrims ni bsod nams zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of the gods of the desire realm is exhausted by the exhaustion of merit.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi lha'i bu rnams kyi tshul khrims ni tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi lha'i bu rnams kyi tshul khrims ni tshad med pa dang / bsam gtan zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of the gods of the form realm is exhausted by the exhaustion of the immeasurables and the dhyanas.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu rnams kyi tshul khrims ni ji lta bur snyoms par zhugs pa skyes pa zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu rnams kyi tshul khrims ni ji lta bur snyoms par zhugs pa skyes pa zad pas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of the gods of the formless realm is exhausted by the exhaustion of whatever birth is attained through meditative absorption.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa dang nyan thos thams cad kyi tshul khrims ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa dang nyan thos thams cad kyi tshul khrims ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthar zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of all the learners and non-learners and the śrāvakas is exhausted at the end of nirvāṇa.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshul khrims ni snying rje chen po dang bral bas zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi tshul khrims ni snying rje chen po dang bral bas zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of the pratyekabuddhas is exhausted by the lack of great compassion.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims ni mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims ni mi zad pa ste /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the morality of the bodhisattvas is inexhaustible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar tshul khrims de las tshul khrims thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tshul khrims de las tshul khrims thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because all morality arises from that morality.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu dper na sa bon mi zad pa thob pa mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu dper na sa bon mi zad pa thob pa mi zad pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, for example, the seed of the inexhaustible is inexhaustible.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon mi zad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims mi zad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon mi zad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims mi zad par rig par bya ste /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, in the same way, because the seed of the mind of awakening is inexhaustible, the morality of the Tathāgata should be known as inexhaustible.

original: de'i phyir na skye bu dam pa de dag ni tshul khrims mi zad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na skye bu dam pa de dag ni tshul khrims mi zad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, those holy beings are called “those with inexhaustible morality.”

original: de lta bu'i tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i phyir tshul khrims 'chang ba thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pas na mchog go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul khrims chen po 'chang ba'i phyir tshul khrims 'chang ba thams cad kyi gtso bor gyur pas na mchog go //
translated: Because they uphold such great morality, they are supreme, being the foremost of all those who uphold morality.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa la ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa la ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin te /
translated: On the Bodhisattva stage of the Luminous, the perfection of patience is especially practiced.

original: de bas na /🔽bzod che 'chang ba rta pa po //
analyzed: de bas na / bzod che 'chang ba rta pa po //
translated: Therefore,

original: zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ste /
translated: the one who possesses great patience is a hero.

original: de yang rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis byang chub sems @142b dpa' rnams kyi bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis byang chub sems @142b dpa' rnams kyi bzod par blta'o //
translated: Patience is to be seen in thirty-two ways by the Bodhisattvas.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the thirty-two?

original: bag la nyal spangs pas bzod de par blta'o //🔽mi gnod pas bzod par blta'o /
analyzed: bag la nyal spangs pas bzod de par blta'o // mi gnod pas bzod par blta'o /
translated: Patience is to be seen in the abandonment of the proclivities.🔽Patience is to be seen in the absence of harm.

original: yongs su mi gdung bas bzod par blta'o //🔽gnod sems med pas bzod par blta'o //🔽khon du 'dzin pa me dpas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi gdung bas bzod par blta'o // gnod sems med pas bzod par blta'o // khon du 'dzin pa me dpas bzod par blta'o //
translated: Patience is to be seen in the absence of torment.🔽Patience is to be seen in the absence of malice.🔽Patience is to be seen in the absence of resentment.

original: mi khro bas bzod par blta'o //🔽'thab mo med pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: mi khro bas bzod par blta'o // 'thab mo med pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: Patience is to be seen in the absence of anger.🔽Patience is to be seen in the absence of strife.

original: rtsod pa med pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa med pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: Patience is to be seen in the absence of dispute.

original: yul gyi rma mi phyin pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: yul gyi rma mi phyin pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: Patience is to be seen in the absence of wounds from objects.

original: bdag dang gzhan srung bas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan srung bas bzod par blta'o //
translated: Patience is to be seen in the protection of self and others.

original: byang chub kyi sems dang mthun pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems dang mthun pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: “Patience should be regarded as being in accord with the mind of awakening.

original: tshul bzhin rab tu rtogs pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin rab tu rtogs pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: “ Patience should be regarded as being in accord with proper understanding.

original: yid byung zhing 'dod chags dang bral bas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: yid byung zhing 'dod chags dang bral bas bzod par blta'o //
translated: “ Patience should be regarded as being in accord with renunciation and freedom from desire.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa la rton pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: “ Patience should be regarded as being in accord with the ripening of karma.

original: lus kyi rgyun gyis bzod par blta'o //🔽dag dang sems yongs su dag pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: lus kyi rgyun gyis bzod par blta'o // dag dang sems yongs su dag pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: “ Patience should be regarded as being in accord with the continuity of the body.🔽“ Patience should be regarded as being in accord with the purification of body and mind.

original: bsam pa brtan pas bzod par blta'o //🔽yi ge ya ma brla yin pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: bsam pa brtan pas bzod par blta'o // yi ge ya ma brla yin pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: “ Patience should be regarded as being in accord with a firm intention.🔽“ Patience should be regarded as being in accord with the absence of meaningless syllables.

original: yongs su rtogs pa med pas bzod par blta'o //🔽rang gi sems la nges par sems pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa med pas bzod par blta'o // rang gi sems la nges par sems pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: “ Patience should be regarded as being in accord with the absence of conceptualization.🔽“ Patience should be regarded as being in accord with the contemplation of one’s own mind.

original: gzhan gyi sems srung pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems srung pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: “ Patience should be regarded as being in accord with the protection of the minds of others.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi lam du 'gro bas bzod bar blta'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi lam du 'gro bas bzod bar blta'o //
translated: “ Patience should be regarded as being in accord with the path to the world of Brahmā.

original: lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa myong ba'i phyir bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa myong ba'i phyir bzod par blta'o //
translated: “ Patience should be regarded as being in accord with the experience of the excellence of gods and humans.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su rdzogs par bye cad pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po yongs su rdzogs par bye cad pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: One should see patience as the perfection of the major and minor marks.

original: tshangs pa'i sgra skad 'byin pa'i dbyangs thob pas bzod par blta'o //🔽nyes pa thams cad bcom pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sgra skad 'byin pa'i dbyangs thob pas bzod par blta'o // nyes pa thams cad bcom pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: One should see patience as the attainment of the melodious voice of Brahmā.🔽One should see patience as the destruction of all faults.

original: gnod sems dang skyon dang tha ba thams cad bcom pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: gnod sems dang skyon dang tha ba thams cad bcom pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: One should see patience as the destruction of all malice, faults, and harshness.

original: khong khro ba thams cad spangs pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba thams cad spangs pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: One should see patience as the abandonment of all anger.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad spangs pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad spangs pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: One should see patience as the abandonment of all roots of nonvirtue.🔽One should see patience as the destruction of all adversaries.

original: phyir rgol ba thams cad rab tu bcom pas bzod par blta'o / gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba thams cad las shin tu 'das pas bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba thams cad rab tu bcom pas bzod par blta'o / gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba thams cad las shin tu 'das pas bzod par blta'o //
translated: One should see patience as the transcendence of all harm from others.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thob pas bzod par blta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thob pas bzod par blta ste /
translated: One should see patience as the attainment of all the qualities of a buddha.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod par blta'o //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu rnam pa sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bzod par blta'o //
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, one should see the patience of bodhisattvas through these thirty-two aspects.”

original: de la bzod pa gang zhe na /🔽dag brag ca'i sgra dang mtshungs pa shin tu rtogs pa'i phyir sbyor ba la slar mi spyod ba dang / lus gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par @143a * //🔽rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir brdeg pa la slar mi brdeg pa dang / sems sgyu ma dang mtshungs par rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir shes pa la phyir mi gshe ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa zhi ba'i phyir khros pa la phyir mi khro ba dang /
analyzed: de la bzod pa gang zhe na / dag brag ca'i sgra dang mtshungs pa shin tu rtogs pa'i phyir sbyor ba la slar mi spyod ba dang / lus gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs par @143a * // rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir brdeg pa la slar mi brdeg pa dang / sems sgyu ma dang mtshungs par rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir shes pa la phyir mi gshe ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa zhi ba'i phyir khros pa la phyir mi khro ba dang /
translated: What is patience?🔽It is the absence of counteraction in the face of injury, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like a magical creation. It is the absence of counteraction in the face of harm, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like an echo. It is the absence of counteraction in the face of abuse, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like a reflection. It is the absence of counteraction in the face of anger, because one has a thorough knowledge that the mind is like an illusion.

original: rang gi yon tan yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir bsngags pa ma yin pas khong khro bar mi 'gyur pa dang / ma thos par mi sems pa'i phyir bsngags pas rjes su chags par mi 'gyur pa dang / shin tu dul ba'i phyir rnyed pas dga' ba med pa dang /
analyzed: rang gi yon tan yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir bsngags pa ma yin pas khong khro bar mi 'gyur pa dang / ma thos par mi sems pa'i phyir bsngags pas rjes su chags par mi 'gyur pa dang / shin tu dul ba'i phyir rnyed pas dga' ba med pa dang /
translated: It is the absence of anger in the face of criticism, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like an illusory creation. It is the absence of anger in the face of praise, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like a reflection. It is the absence of attachment in the face of praise, because one has a thorough knowledge that the mind is like an illusion. It is the absence of aversion in the face of criticism, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like a magical creation. It is the absence of pride in the face of praise, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like an echo. It is the absence of arrogance in the face of praise, because one has a thorough knowledge that the mind is like an illusion. It is the absence of dejection in the face of criticism, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like a magical creation. It is the absence of elation in the face of praise, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like an echo. It is the absence of elation in the face of gain, because one has a thorough knowledge that the mind is like an illusion. It is the absence of dejection in the face of loss, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like a magical creation. It is the absence of elation in the face of a good reputation, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like an echo. It is the absence of dejection in the face of a bad reputation, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like a magical creation. It is the absence of elation in the face of happiness, because one has a thorough knowledge that the mind is like an illusion. It is the absence of dejection in the face of suffering, because one has a thorough knowledge that the body is like a magical creation. It is the absence of counteraction in the face of the secondary defilements

original: rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ma rnyed pas khong khro ba med pa dang / shes pas rab tu brtags pa'i phyir snyan pa la ngo mtshar du mi 'dzin pa dang ; blo yangs pa'i phyir mi snyan pas zhum par mi 'gyur pa dang / legs par gnas pa'i phyir smad pas dmas par mi sems pa dang /
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba'i phyir ma rnyed pas khong khro ba med pa dang / shes pas rab tu brtags pa'i phyir snyan pa la ngo mtshar du mi 'dzin pa dang ; blo yangs pa'i phyir mi snyan pas zhum par mi 'gyur pa dang / legs par gnas pa'i phyir smad pas dmas par mi sems pa dang /
translated: They are not angry at not receiving gifts because they are very peaceful. They are not amazed by praise because they are well examined by wisdom. They are not discouraged by criticism because their minds are vast.

original: mi g-yo ba'i phyir bstod pas mtho bar mi sems pa dang / sems can la blta ba'i phyir sdug bsngal gyis yongs su mi spyo ba dang // 'dus byas kyi bde ba mi rtag pa'i phyir bde bas dga' bar mi 'gyur ba dang / mi gnas pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi gos pa dang /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i phyir bstod pas mtho bar mi sems pa dang / sems can la blta ba'i phyir sdug bsngal gyis yongs su mi spyo ba dang // 'dus byas kyi bde ba mi rtag pa'i phyir bde bas dga' bar mi 'gyur ba dang / mi gnas pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis mi gos pa dang /
translated: They do not think of themselves as inferior because of criticism because they are well established. They do not think of themselves as superior because of praise because they are unmoving. They are not discouraged by suffering because they look at sentient beings. They are not delighted by pleasure because compounded pleasures are impermanent. They are not defiled by worldly dharmas because they are non-abiding.

original: gzhan la mi gnod pa'i phyir bdag la gnod pa bzod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yan lag dang nyid lang gcod pa'ang nyams su len pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku 'dod pa'i phyir bdag gi lus gcod pa'ang bzod pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan la mi gnod pa'i phyir bdag la gnod pa bzod pa dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir yan lag dang nyid lang gcod pa'ang nyams su len pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku 'dod pa'i phyir bdag gi lus gcod pa'ang bzod pa dang /
translated: It is to be patient with harm done to oneself because it does not harm others. It is to practice the amputation of limbs and fingers in order to perfect the limbs of awakening. It is to be patient with the cutting of one’s body because one desires the body of a buddha.

original: legs par byas pa'i las kyis stobs bskyed pa'i phyir ngan du byas pa thams cad bzod pa dang / mu stegs thams cad 'joms pas dpa'i ba'i phyir gdung ba dang yongs su gdung ba la mi med pa dang / brgya sbyin dang tshangs pa dang 'jig rten skyongs pa rnams zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir brtul zhugs thams cad la rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: legs par byas pa'i las kyis stobs bskyed pa'i phyir ngan du byas pa thams cad bzod pa dang / mu stegs thams cad 'joms pas dpa'i ba'i phyir gdung ba dang yongs su gdung ba la mi med pa dang / brgya sbyin dang tshangs pa dang 'jig rten skyongs pa rnams zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir brtul zhugs thams cad la rtsom pa'o //
translated: It is to be patient with all that is badly done because one has developed strength through good actions. It is to be patient with heat and cold because one is victorious over all extremists. It is to undertake all austerities because one outshines Śakra, Brahmā, and the world protectors.

analyzed: gang ma skyes pa ma bskyed pa ma byung ba ma phyung ba de la 'jig pa gang yang med de /
translated: That which is unborn, not produced, not arisen, and not manifested has no destruction at all.

original: 'jig pa med pas na zad pa med de /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pas na zad pa med de /
translated: Since there is no destruction, there is no exhaustion.

original: gang 'di la bzod pa de ni shin tu bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'di la bzod pa de ni shin tu bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience with that is supreme patience.

original: gang ma byas pa mngon par 'du ma byas pa /
analyzed: gang ma byas pa mngon par 'du ma byas pa /
translated: That which is uncreated, unconditioned,

original: sgro 'dogs pa med pa /🔽rnam par ma brtags pa /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa med pa / rnam par ma brtags pa /
translated: not a superimposition,🔽not an imputation,

original: ma bsgrubs pa ;
analyzed: ma bsgrubs pa ;
translated: not accomplished,

original: ma bstan pa /
analyzed: ma bstan pa /
translated: not taught,

original: nye bar ma gtugs pa de la skye ba gang yang med de /
analyzed: nye bar ma gtugs pa de la skye ba gang yang med de /
translated: and not engaged has no arising at all.

original: gang skye ba med pa de ni mi skye ba'o / gang mi skye ba de ni shin tu bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa de ni mi skye ba'o / gang mi skye ba de ni shin tu bzod pa'o //
translated: That which has no arising is unborn. That which is unborn is supreme patience.

original: gang de ltar bzod pa de ni mi skye ba la bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar bzod pa de ni mi skye ba la bzod pa'o //
translated: He who is patient in that way is patient with the unarisen.

original: gang mi skye ba la bzod pa de ni skye ba med par bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi skye ba la bzod pa de ni skye ba med par bzod pa'o //
translated: He who is patient with the unarisen is patient with the non-arisen.

original: gang skye ba med par bzod pa de ni shin tu bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gang skye ba med par bzod pa de ni shin tu bzod pa'o //
translated: He who is patient with the non-arisen is patient with the well-arisen.

original: de lta bu'i bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur cing de'i bdag nyid 'chang bas bzod che 'chang che 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur cing de'i bdag nyid 'chang bas bzod che 'chang che 'chang ba'o //
translated: He who has the nature of such patience, who bears that nature, is the great patient, the great bearer.

original: rab tu mi g-yo bas brtan pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu mi g-yo bas brtan pa'o //
translated: He is firm, because he is unmoving.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba la ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od 'phro ba la ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin te /
translated: On the Bodhisattva stage of Radiant Light, he practices the perfection of effort especially.

original: de bas na //🔽brtson 'grus chen po brtul ba yin //
analyzed: de bas na // brtson 'grus chen po brtul ba yin //
translated: Therefore,

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he is the one with great effort, the one with great exertion.

original: de yang brtson 'grus yang dag par blang ba ni brgyad de /
analyzed: de yang brtson 'grus yang dag par blang ba ni brgyad de /
translated: The undertaking of effort is eightfold.

original: brgyad po gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: cho ga mi zad pa dang / brtul ba mi zad pa dang / yang dag par 'grub pa mi zad pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mi zad pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa dang /
analyzed: cho ga mi zad pa dang / brtul ba mi zad pa dang / yang dag par 'grub pa mi zad pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mi zad pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa dang / ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa dang /
translated: the inexhaustibility of ritual, the inexhaustibility of commitment, the inexhaustibility of perfect accomplishment, the inexhaustibility of bringing sentient beings to maturity, the inexhaustibility of the accumulation of merit, the inexhaustibility of the accumulation of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi tshogs mi zad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa'i tshogs mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi tshogs mi zad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa'i tshogs mi zad pa'o //
translated: the inexhaustibility of the accumulation of insight, and the inexhaustibility of the accumulation of the accomplishment of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa'i go cha mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de la byang chub sems dpa'i go cha mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, what is the bodhisatvas’ inexhaustibility of armor?

original: gang 'khor ba na yongs su mi skyo ba ste /🔽de bskal ba 'di snyed cig tu go cha bgo /
analyzed: gang 'khor ba na yongs su mi skyo ba ste / de bskal ba 'di snyed cig tu go cha bgo /
translated: It is not being discouraged by saṃsāra.🔽They do not seek awakening by counting the eons, thinking, ‘I will don the armor for this many eons,

original: bskal ba 'di snyed cig tu go cha mi bgo'o zhes bskal pa bgrangs pas byang chub mi tshol gyi /
analyzed: bskal ba 'di snyed cig tu go cha mi bgo'o zhes bskal pa bgrangs pas byang chub mi tshol gyi /
translated: and I will not don the armor for that many eons.’

original: go cha bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid gon par byed de /
analyzed: go cha bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid gon par byed de /
translated: They don the inconceivable armor itself.

original: gal te 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' ji snyed pa de snyed kyis nyin zhag gcig gyur la /
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba'i sngon gyi mtha' ji snyed pa de snyed kyis nyin zhag gcig gyur la /
translated: If the number of days and nights that have passed since the beginning of samsara were a single day,🔽and if the number of days and nights in fifteen such days were a half-month,

original: de lta bu'i nyin zhag gis zhag bco lnga zhing zla ba phyed zhag sum cus zla ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i nyin zhag gis zhag bco lnga zhing zla ba phyed zhag sum cus zla ba ste /
translated: and the number of days and nights in thirty such half-months were a month,

original: zla ba bcu gnyis shing @145a * //🔽lor gyur la /🔽lo'i bgrang ba 'di lta bu'i lo stong phrag brgya la byang chub kyi sems gcig bskyed cing de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gcig mthong la /
analyzed: zla ba bcu gnyis shing @145a * // lor gyur la / lo'i bgrang ba 'di lta bu'i lo stong phrag brgya la byang chub kyi sems gcig bskyed cing de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gcig mthong la /
translated: and the number of such twelve months were a year,🔽and if the number of years in a hundred thousand years were a single generation of bodhichitta, and if the number of such generations of bodhichitta in a hundred thousand such generations were a single buddha, a tathagata, an arhat, a complete and perfect buddha,

original: 'jug pa de lta bu dang bgrang ba de 'dra bas gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed kye byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas sems can gcig gi sems kyi spyod pa shes te /
analyzed: 'jug pa de lta bu dang bgrang ba de 'dra bas gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed kye byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas sems can gcig gi sems kyi spyod pa shes te /
translated: and if the number of such generations of bodhichitta and such buddhas were as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges, and if through such generations of bodhichitta and such buddhas one were to understand the mental activity of a single sentient being,

original: 'jug pa de lta bu dang bgrang ba de 'dra bas sems can thams cad la yang de snyed de snyed kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas so so re rer sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa shes kyang mi 'gong ba'i go cha'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa de lta bu dang bgrang ba de 'dra bas sems can thams cad la yang de snyed de snyed kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas so so re rer sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa shes kyang mi 'gong ba'i go cha'o //
translated: By such an engagement and such a reckoning, he generates that much enlightenment mind for all sentient beings, and by seeing the Tathagatas, he knows the mental behavior of all sentient beings, one by one, without becoming arrogant.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa 'di nyid dang 'grangs ba 'di nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed la rim gro byed pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa 'di nyid du bgrang ba nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la rim gro byed pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa 'di nyid dang 'grangs ba 'di nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed la rim gro byed pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa 'di nyid du bgrang ba nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la rim gro byed pa dang /
translated: For the sake of perfecting the perfection of generosity, he serves the Tathagatas equal to the sands of the Ganges River with just this engagement and just this reckoning, and for the sake of perfecting the perfection of morality, he serves the Tathagatas equal to the sands of the Ganges River with just this engagement and just this reckoning.

original: de bzhin du bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la rim gro byed pa dang / de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed la rim gro byed pa dang / de bzhin du byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang /
translated: Likewise, in order to perfect the transcendent perfections of patience, diligence, concentration and wisdom, they serve the thus-gone ones as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges river. Likewise, in order to perfect all the factors of awakening,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed la rim gro byed pa dang / 'jug pa 'di nyid dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa gang ga'i klung gi bye ma snyed la rim gro byed pa dang / 'jug pa 'di nyid dang /
translated: and in order to perfect the powers, fearlessnesses, and all the unique qualities of the buddhas, they serve the thus-gone ones as numerous as the grains of sand in the Ganges river.

original: bgrang ba 'di nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed mthong ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dag gis skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gcig mngon par sgrub cing rnam grangs 'dis mtshan dang dpe byad thams cad yongs su 'grub pa mngon par sgrub par byed kyang mi 'gong ba'i go cha gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i
analyzed: bgrang ba 'di nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa gang g'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed mthong ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dag gis skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gcig mngon par sgrub cing rnam grangs 'dis mtshan dang dpe byad thams cad yongs su 'grub pa mngon par sgrub par byed kyang mi 'gong ba'i go cha gang yin pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s

original: go cha mi zad pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: go cha mi zad pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: inexhaustible armor.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba mi zad pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba mi zad pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva’s inexhaustible valor?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba mi zad pa ni na gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i @145b 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba las kyang 'bogs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba mi zad pa ni na gang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i @145b 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba las kyang 'bogs te /
translated: The bodhisattva’s inexhaustible valor is the valor that is enthusiastic about going through a world system consisting of a triple-thousand great one-thousand worlds filled with fire

original: de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar spro ba'o /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar spro ba'o /
translated: in order to see the Tathāgata.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba ni chos nyan pa'i phyir spro ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba ni chos nyan pa'i phyir spro ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva’s valor is enthusiasm in order to hear the Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir spro ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba ni sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir spro ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's enthusiasm is for the full maturation of beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi phyir spro ba'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi phyir spro ba'o /
translated: The bodhisattva's enthusiasm is for all virtuous qualities.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi phyir spro ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi phyir spro ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's enthusiasm is for the knowledge of an Omniscient One.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba ni pha rol gyi don gyi phyir 'jug pas na de'i phyir brtul ba mi zad pa zhe bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba ni pha rol gyi don gyi phyir 'jug pas na de'i phyir brtul ba mi zad pa zhe bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva's enthusiasm is for the benefit of others, and therefore it is called inexhaustible enthusiasm.

original: pha rol zhi ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol zhi ba'i phyir /
translated: It is for the sake of others' peace,

original: pha rol la gdul ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol la gdul ba'i phyir /
translated: for the sake of others' training,

original: pha rol yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir /
translated: for the sake of others' complete liberation,

original: 'jug pas na de'i phyir brtul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug pas na de'i phyir brtul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and therefore it is called enthusiasm.

original: mi lhod pa dang / ma zhum pa dang / brten pa dang / mi bzlog pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa dang / snying rje chen po la gnas shing rtag tu sems can gyi don la brtson par 'jug pas na de'i phyir brtul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi lhod pa dang / ma zhum pa dang / brten pa dang / mi bzlog pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa dang / snying rje chen po la gnas shing rtag tu sems can gyi don la brtson par 'jug pas na de'i phyir brtul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is not lax, not fainthearted, steadfast, not diverted, has a virtuous attitude, and is grounded in great compassion. He is always engaged in striving for the welfare of sentient beings. Therefore, it is called “steadfastness.”

original: gom pa 'dor ba dang // gom pa 'jog cing 'gro ba thams cad du byang chub kyi sems mngon du byed do //
analyzed: gom pa 'dor ba dang // gom pa 'jog cing 'gro ba thams cad du byang chub kyi sems mngon du byed do //
translated: He manifests the thought of awakening in all his movements, in all his steps, in all his comings and goings.

original: sems can lta bar yang lta zhing nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su yang mi ltung ste /
analyzed: sems can lta bar yang lta zhing nyon mongs pa'i phyogs su yang mi ltung ste /
translated: He looks at sentient beings and does not fall into the side of reactive emotions.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par 'grub pa mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i brtul ba mi zad pa zhes bya'o // de la byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par 'grub pa mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: This is called “the bodhisattvas’ steadfastness that is inexhaustible.”🔽“What, Blessed One, is the bodhisattvas’ accomplishment that is inexhaustible?”🔽“Blessed One, how is it that the bodhisattvas’ accomplishment is inexhaustible?”

original: gang ji ltar dge ba'i sems skyes shing byung ba byang chub kyi phyir yongs su sngo bar byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par 'grub pa mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: gang ji ltar dge ba'i sems skyes shing byung ba byang chub kyi phyir yongs su sngo bar byed pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par 'grub pa mi zad pa'o //
translated: “Blessed One, how is it that the bodhisattvas’ accomplishment is inexhaustible?”

original: de ci pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir te //
translated: Because it is dedicated to enlightenment.

original: byang chub tu yongs su bsdos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni byang chub kyi snying po la ma 'dug gi bar du bar ma dor yongs su zad pa 'am gtugs par 'gyur gha gang yang med do //
analyzed: byang chub tu yongs su bsdos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni byang chub kyi snying po la ma 'dug gi bar du bar ma dor yongs su zad pa 'am gtugs par 'gyur gha gang yang med do //
translated: There is no way that the roots of virtue dedicated to enlightenment can be exhausted or come to an end before one sits on the seat of enlightenment.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is like this:

original: dper na chu'i thigs pa rgya mtsho chen por ltung ba ni bskal bas ma bsregs kyi bar du bar ma dor yongs su zad pa'am gtugs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na chu'i thigs pa rgya mtsho chen por ltung ba ni bskal bas ma bsregs kyi bar du bar ma dor yongs su zad pa'am gtugs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, a drop of water that falls into the great ocean will not be exhausted and come to an end until the end of an eon.

original: de bzhin du byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang byang chub kyi snying po la ma 'dug gi bar du bar ma dor yongs su zad pa'am gtugs par 'gyur ba gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang byang chub kyi snying po la ma 'dug gi bar du bar ma dor yongs su zad pa'am gtugs par 'gyur ba gang yang med do //
translated: In the same way, there is no way that the roots of virtue dedicated to enlightenment can be exhausted or come to an end before one sits on the seat of enlightenment.

original: dbyang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni gang 'di yang dag pa'i sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: dbyang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni gang 'di yang dag pa'i sgrub pa ste /
translated: The phrase accomplishment of purity refers to right accomplishment.

original: yang dag par zhugs @146a * //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs @146a * //
translated: It is to be correctly engaged.🔽

original: pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yang dag par sgrub pa sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba la gzud pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su sngo bar byed de /
analyzed: pa de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag yang dag par sgrub pa sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba la gzud pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su sngo bar byed de /
translated: That correct practice is the correct accomplishment of the roots of virtue, which is the dedication of those roots of virtue in order to protect all sentient beings, in order to ripen all sentient beings, and in order to introduce all sentient beings to the roots of virtue.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: Those roots of virtue are dedicated in order to accomplish the wisdom of omniscience.

original: sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: Those roots of virtue are dedicated in order to support all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ste /
translated: Those roots of virtue are dedicated in order to lead all sentient beings to nirvāṇa and to establish them in the wisdom of omniscience.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par 'grub pa mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par 'grub pa mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the bodhisatvas’ imperishable correct accomplishment.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable bringing of beings to maturity?

original: sems can gyi khams ni tshad med de /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ni tshad med de /
translated: The realm of beings is immeasurable.

original: de la byang chub sems dpas bgrod pa 'di lta bus 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas bgrod pa 'di lta bus 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should enter it with this kind of progress.

original: gal te bdag gis nyin gcig la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis nyin gcig la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ste /
translated: If I were to bring to maturity all the beings included in the trichiliocosm in a single day,

original: tshul 'dis bskal ba dpag tu med pa grangs med bsam gyi mi khyab par sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par bya zhing /
analyzed: tshul 'dis bskal ba dpag tu med pa grangs med bsam gyi mi khyab par sems can gyi khams yongs su smin par bya zhing /
translated: and if I were to bring beings to maturity in this way for immeasurable, countless, inconceivable eons,

original: sems can gyi khams de snyed du dpag tu med pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams de snyed du dpag tu med pa /
translated: and if there were that many beings in the realm of beings,

original: de snyed du grangs med pa de snyed du bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su smin par bya ste /
analyzed: de snyed du grangs med pa de snyed du bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su smin par bya ste /
translated: and if I were to bring to maturity that many beings in an immeasurable, countless, inconceivable way,

original: de lta bur byas kyang sems can rnams kyi brgya'i cha gcig kyang smin par ma byas /
analyzed: de lta bur byas kyang sems can rnams kyi brgya'i cha gcig kyang smin par ma byas /
translated: even though I did so, I would not have brought even one hundredth of a portion of beings to maturity.

original: brgya stong gi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba brgya stong gi cha dang / grangs dang cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang rgyur yongs su smin par ma byas so zhes gal te rab tu brjod pa 'di thos nas byang chub sems dpa' mi skrag mi dang zhing dang bar mi 'gyur ba de ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i byang chub sems dpar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: brgya stong gi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba brgya stong gi cha dang / grangs dang cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang rgyur yongs su smin par ma byas so zhes gal te rab tu brjod pa 'di thos nas byang chub sems dpa' mi skrag mi dang zhing dang bar mi 'gyur ba de ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i byang chub sems dpar rig par bya ste /
translated: If, having heard this declaration, the bodhisattva does not tremble, is not frightened, and is not full of dread, then he should be known as a bodhisattva who has undertaken enthusiastic perseverance.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mi zad pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable activity of bringing beings to spiritual maturity.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable accumulation of merit?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod rnams ni tshad med de //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bsod rnams ni tshad med de //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ merit is immeasurable.

original: de la byang chub sems dpas bgrangs ba 'di 'dra bas 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpas bgrangs ba 'di 'dra bas 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should engage in this kind of enumeration.

original: sems can thams cad dang / 'das @146b pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i slob pa dang / mi slob pa thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bsod nams ji snyed pa bsod nams de snyed brgyar 'gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la sbu'i khung bu gcig 'grub bo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang / 'das @146b pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / ma 'ongs pa'i slob pa dang / mi slob pa thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bsod nams ji snyed pa bsod nams de snyed brgyar 'gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la sbu'i khung bu gcig 'grub bo //
translated: The merit of all sentient beings, and of all those in training and beyond training in the past, present and future, and of all the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, multiplied a hundred times, is the merit that establishes a single pore of a Tathāgata’s body.

original: de bzhin du spu'i khung bu thams cad re re nas yongs su 'grub pa'i sbu'i khung bu thams cad du gtogs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa brgyar bsgyur te gtan pa med pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po gcig yang dag par bsgrubs pa de bzhin🔽gshegs pa'i sku la dpe byad bzang po gcig 'grub ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du spu'i khung bu thams cad re re nas yongs su 'grub pa'i sbu'i khung bu thams cad du gtogs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa brgyar bsgyur te gtan pa med pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po gcig yang dag par bsgrubs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dpe byad bzang po gcig 'grub ste /
translated: In the same way, each of the pores is established. The mass of merit belonging to all the pores, multiplied a hundred times, is the single mass of merit that establishes a single minor mark of a Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin du dpe byad bzang po thams cad re re nas yongs su 'grub po //
analyzed: de bzhin du dpe byad bzang po thams cad re re nas yongs su 'grub po //
translated: In the same way, each of the minor marks is established.

original: dpe byad bzang po thams cad du gtogs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa stong du bsgyur te gtan pa med pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po gcig bsgrubs pa des /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po thams cad du gtogs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa stong du bsgyur te gtan pa med pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po gcig bsgrubs pa des /
translated: Multiplying the mass of merit belonging to all the major marks by a thousand, one accomplishes a single mass of merit of the irreversible level.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gcig mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan gcig mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: The mass of merit belonging to all the excellent minor marks, multiplied by a thousand, is the cause for the establishment of a single mark of a great person on the body of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin du sku la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu re re nas mngon par 'grub bo //🔽skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cur gtogs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa stong phrag bcur bsgyur te gtan pa med pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po gcig yang dag par bsgrubs pa des de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la smin mtshams kyi mdzod sbu skyes bu
analyzed: de bzhin du sku la skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu re re nas mngon par 'grub bo // skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cur gtogs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa stong phrag bcur bsgyur te gtan pa med pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po gcig yang dag par bsgrubs pa des de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la smin mtshams kyi mdzod sbu skyes bu
translated: In this way, each of the thirty marks of a great person is established on the body of the Tathāgata.

original: chen po'i mtshan mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: chen po'i mtshan mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: The mass of merit belonging to the thirty marks of a great person, multiplied by ten thousand, is the cause for the establishment of the urṇā hair between the eyebrows, which is a mark of a great person, on the body of the Tathāgata.

original: mdzod sbur gtogs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de las stong phrag brgyar bsgyur ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de las stong phrag brgyar bsgyur ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po dag dag par bsgrubs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dbu'i🔽gtsug tor spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba skyes bu chen po'i mtshan mngon par 'grub bo //
analyzed: mdzod sbur gtogs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de las stong phrag brgyar bsgyur ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po ji snyed pa de las stong phrag brgyar bsgyur ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po dag dag par bsgrubs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dbu'i gtsug tor spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba skyes bu chen po'i mtshan mngon par 'grub bo //
translated: The merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa is the merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa.🔽The merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa is the merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa.🔽The merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa is the merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa.🔽The merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa is the merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa.🔽The merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa is the merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa.

original: gtsug tor du gtogs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po de las bye ba phrag stong du bsgyur ba de bas kyang lhag pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po yang dag par bsgrubs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi dung yongs su 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gtsug tor du gtogs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po de las bye ba phrag stong du bsgyur ba de bas kyang lhag pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po yang dag par bsgrubs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi dung yongs su 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa is the merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa.🔽The merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣa is the merit that is the cause for the Tathāgata’s uṣṇīṣ

original: chos kyi dung des de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed na 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag dbyangs kyis go bar mdzad cing chos kyis 'dul bar bsam pa dang / dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi dbang po rnams tshim par mdzad do //
analyzed: chos kyi dung des de bzhin gshegs pa bzhed na 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag dbyangs kyis go bar mdzad cing chos kyis 'dul bar bsam pa dang / dad pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi dbang po rnams tshim par mdzad do //
translated: With that Dharma conch, if the Tathāgata wishes, he can make an infinite, limitless world-system understand with his voice and can satisfy the faculties of all beings with the Dharma, according to their faith.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi tshogs la 'jug pa 'di @147a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams kyi tshogs la 'jug pa 'di @147a * //
translated: “Having heard this engagement with the accumulation of merit,

original: thos nas mi skrag mi dangs zhing dangs par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thos nas mi skrag mi dangs zhing dangs par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattvas are not frightened, not terrified, and not fearful. This is called the bodhisattvas’ imperishable accumulation of merit.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattvas’ imperishable accumulation of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi tshogs ni tshad me de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi tshogs ni tshad me de /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ accumulation of wisdom is immeasurable.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' bgrang ba 'di 'dra bas 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' bgrang ba 'di 'dra bas 'jug par bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattvas should engage with it through this kind of enumeration:

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems cad gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur kyang /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems cad gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur kyang /
translated: If all the sentient beings that exist in the great trichiliocosm were endowed with the knowledge of one who practices in accordance with faith,

original: de dag gi chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro //🔽stong gi cha dang / brgya stong gi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba brgya stong gi cha dang / grangs dang cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang /
analyzed: de dag gi chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro // stong gi cha dang / brgya stong gi cha dang / bye ba'i cha dang / bye ba brgya'i cha dang / bye ba stong gi cha dang / bye ba brgya stong gi cha dang / grangs dang cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang /
translated: their knowledge would not approach even a hundredth part of the knowledge of one who practices in accordance with the Dharma.

original: rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: rgyur yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: It would not approach even a thousandth, a hundred thousandth part, a koṭīth, a niyuta-koṭīth, a lakhth, a hundred thousand lakhth, a hundred thousand koṭīth, a hundred thousand niyuta-koṭīth, a hundred thousand nayuta-koṭīth part, nor would it be comparable, equal, or measurable.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni brgyad pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni brgyad pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: Similarly, the knowledge of one who practices in accordance with the Dharma does not approach even a hundredth part of the knowledge of one who has entered the stream.

original: brgyad pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams la'o //
translated: The knowledge of one who has entered the stream does not approach even a hundredth part of the knowledge of a once-returner.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams la'o //
translated: Those endowed with the knowledge of stream-enterers are in those endowed with the knowledge of once-returners.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams la'o //
translated: Those endowed with the knowledge of once-returners are in those endowed with the knowledge of non-returners.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni dgra bcom pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni dgra bcom pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: Those endowed with the knowledge of non-returners are in those endowed with the knowledge of arhats.

original: dgra bcom pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni rnag sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni rnag sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: Those endowed with the knowledge of arhats are in those endowed with the knowledge of buddhas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni bskal ba brgyas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas dpe dang rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni bskal ba brgyas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas dpe dang rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: Those endowed with the knowledge of pratyekabuddhas do not approach even a hundredth part of those endowed with the bodhisattva knowledge that definitely emerges in a hundred eons, up to they do not approach even a similitude or a cause.

original: bskal ba brgyas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan pa la'o //🔽bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni phyir mi ldog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: bskal ba brgyas nges par 'byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan pa la'o // bzod pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni phyir mi ldog pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: The wisdom of the bodhisattvas who are certain of liberation in one hundred eons is not even a hundredth of the wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have attained acceptance.🔽The wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have attained acceptance is not even a hundredth of the wisdom of the bodhisattvas who have attained irreversibility.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i brgya'i char yang nye @147b bar mi 'gro ba nas dpe dang rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams ni skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i brgya'i char yang nye @147b bar mi 'gro ba nas dpe dang rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: The wisdom of the bodhisattvas who are irreversible is not even a hundredth of the wisdom of the bodhisattvas who are impeded by one birth. It does not approach it even as an analogy or cause.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur kyang byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i bang chub sems pa'i ye🔽shes dang ldan pa'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas dpe dang rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sems can gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur kyang byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i bang chub sems pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas dpe dang rgyu'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: Even if all the sentient beings in the great trichiliocosm were endowed with the wisdom of a bodhisattva who is only obstructed by one lifetime, that would not come close to a hundredth of the wisdom of a bodhisattva who is seated at the site of awakening, and so on up to: it would not even bear comparison.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na sems can gang 'khod pa dag thams cad byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur kyang /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas mu med pa dag na sems can gang 'khod pa dag thams cad byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur kyang /
translated: Even if all the sentient beings in infinite, limitless world systems were endowed with the wisdom of a bodhisattva who is seated at the site of awakening,

original: de dag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas rgyu dang dpe'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dag gi de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro ba nas rgyu dang dpe'i bar du yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: The wisdom power of the Tathagata's knowledge of the possible and impossible does not approach even a hundredth part of that, nor does it approach any number, fraction, calculation, example, or likeness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyud thams cad yongs su grub pa'i rim pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyud thams cad yongs su grub pa'i rim pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: The same is true of the stages of the Tathagata's perfection of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gang ye shes kyi tshogs la 'jug pa 'di thos nas mi skrag mi dang zhing dang bar mi 'gyur pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gang ye shes kyi tshogs la 'jug pa 'di thos nas mi skrag mi dang zhing dang bar mi 'gyur pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When a Bodhisattva hears this entry into the accumulation of wisdom and is not frightened, is not fearful, and is not full of dread, this is called the Bodhisattva's imperishable accumulation of wisdom.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi tshogs mi zad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the Bodhisattva's imperishable accumulation of wisdom?

original: gang sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa zhes pa de ni shes rab kyi tshogs mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: gang sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa zhes pa de ni shes rab kyi tshogs mi zad pa'o //
translated: The entry into the mental activity of all sentient beings is the imperishable accumulation of wisdom.

original: sems can thams cad kyi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sems ji snyed pa de dag sems can gcig gis sems kyi 'jug pa gcig la yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sems ji snyed pa de dag sems can gcig gis sems kyi 'jug pa gcig la yod par 'gyur la /
translated: All the minds of all sentient beings, past, future, and present, are present in a single sentient being’s single instant of mind.

original: tshul 'dis sems can thams cad de snyed du tshad med pa'i sems kyis gang ba rgyun te /
analyzed: tshul 'dis sems can thams cad de snyed du tshad med pa'i sems kyis gang ba rgyun te /
translated: And in the same way, all sentient beings are filled with immeasurable minds.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sems can de dag thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang / zhes sdang dang / gti mug gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad sems can gcig gi sems gcig la yod par gyur la /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i sems can de dag thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang / zhes sdang dang / gti mug gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad sems can gcig gi sems gcig la yod par gyur la /
translated: All the attachment, anger, and ignorance of all sentient beings, past, future, and present, are present in a single sentient being’s single instant of mind.

original: rnam grangs 'dis sems can thams cad de snyed du tshad med pa'i nyon mongs pas gang pa'i sems su gyur na yang /
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis sems can thams cad de snyed du tshad med pa'i nyon mongs pas gang pa'i sems su gyur na yang /
translated: And in the same way, all sentient beings are filled with immeasurable afflictions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi tshogs gcig bsgrubs pas sems can de dag gi sems su gtogs pa'i sems bskyed pa ji snyed pa'i sems bskyed pa de dag thams cad so so'i dmigs pas @148a * //🔽byung ste zhig cing zhu ba rnams shes par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i shes rab kyi tshogs bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' gang shes rab kyi tshogs gcig bsgrubs pas sems can de dag gi sems su gtogs pa'i sems bskyed pa ji snyed pa'i sems bskyed pa de dag thams cad so so'i dmigs pas @148a * // byung ste zhig cing zhu ba rnams shes par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i shes rab kyi tshogs bskyed par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should generate the accumulation of wisdom by which he knows the arising and dissolution of all those thoughts that occur to the minds of those sentient beings, through the individual objects of those thoughts.

original: shes rab des kyang sems can de dag gi sems can de dag gi sems su snang ba dang nyon mongs par snang ba dus gsum dang ldan pa gang yang mi shes pa med do //
analyzed: shes rab des kyang sems can de dag gi sems can de dag gi sems su snang ba dang nyon mongs par snang ba dus gsum dang ldan pa gang yang mi shes pa med do //
translated: And by that wisdom, he knows all the appearances in the minds of those sentient beings, the appearances of afflictions, and whatever is connected with the three times.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' 'dis ma khyab pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di lta ste dper na nam mkha' 'dis ma khyab pa gang yang med do //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, it is like this: there is nothing that is not pervaded by this space.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab 'dis kyang sems can de dag gi sems snang ba 'am nyon mongs par snang ba dus gsum dang ldan pa de dag gsal bar ma gyur pa'am yongs su mi shes pa med de /

translated: In the same way, this bodhisattva wisdom does not fail to illuminate or fully understand the appearances in the minds of those sentient beings, whether appearances of afflictions or appearances of the three times.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi tshogs mi zad pa zhes bya'o //

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs thams cad bsags pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad bsags pa gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa'i tshogs mi zad pa'o //
