original: 'di ni sems kyi brtson 'grus mi zad pa de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gang 'jug pa @149b thams cad dang gnas pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba dang / de mtshan ma'i las thams cad du yang 'jug la ye shes kyi las yang dag par gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sems kyi brtson 'grus mi zad pa de yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir gang 'jug pa @149b thams cad dang gnas pa dang / mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba dang / de mtshan ma'i las thams cad du yang 'jug la ye shes kyi las yang dag par gnas pa ste /
translated: It is the stability of the activities of wisdom.

original: de las thams cad kyang ye shes kyi bya ba bya'o //
analyzed: de las thams cad kyang ye shes kyi bya ba bya'o //
translated: All activities are to be done with the activity of wisdom.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi las gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi las gang zhe na /
translated: What is the activity of wisdom of the bodhisattvas?

original: gang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu dang / sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i rgyur 'dus byas su yang mi gtong zhing /
analyzed: gang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu dang / sems can thams cad la snying rje chen po'i rgyur 'dus byas su yang mi gtong zhing /
translated: It is not to be conditioned by the cause of the roots of virtue, nor by the cause of great compassion for all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rgyur 'dus ma byas su mi lta bas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rgyur 'dus ma byas su mi lta bas te /
translated: It is not to view the unconditioned as the cause of the Buddha’s pristine awareness.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattvas’ imperishable perfection of effort.

original: de ltar ji skad gsungs pa'i brtson 'grus yongs su rdzogs pas na /
analyzed: de ltar ji skad gsungs pa'i brtson 'grus yongs su rdzogs pas na /
translated: Thus, by perfecting the effort as taught,

original: brtson 'grus chen po brtul ba yin //
analyzed: brtson 'grus chen po brtul ba yin //
translated: he is one who has undertaken great effort.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa sbyang dka' ba la ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa sbyang dka' ba la ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la lhag par spyod pa yin te /
translated: On the bodhisattva stage Difficult to Conquer, the perfection of meditation is preeminent.

original: de bas na //
analyzed: de bas na //
translated: Therefore,

original: bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: bsam gtan chen po ting 'dzin gnas //
translated: he abides in the great meditative absorption.

original: zhes bya'o // de yang bsam gtan ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // de yang bsam gtan ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four meditative absorptions.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi thun mong yin pa las byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam pa'i rnam pa chen por gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi thun mong yin pa las byang chub sems dpa' rnams bsam pa'i rnam pa chen por gyur pa yin te /
translated: It is shared by all śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, buddhas, and bodhisattvas, but the bodhisattvas have a great aspect of intention.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i ni 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos la sa dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i ni 'dod pa dag las dben pa sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos la sa dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas
translated: Here the bodhisattva, isolated from sense desires, isolated from negative and nonvirtuous dharmas, endowed with investigation and analysis, and having the joy and bliss born of isolation,

original: te gnas so //
analyzed: te gnas so //
translated: completes and dwells in the first concentration.

original: des 'dod pa rnams ni bsam gtan dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: des 'dod pa rnams ni bsam gtan dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
translated: He knows that sense desires are the adversary of the first concentration,

original: gang sred ba de dag las dben pa'o //
analyzed: gang sred ba de dag las dben pa'o //
translated: and he is isolated from those sense desires.

original: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ste /
analyzed: de la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams ni chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ste /
translated: There, negative and nonvirtuous dharmas are attachment, aversion, and confusion.

original: gzhi de las srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / rdzub tu smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal ba dang / brnab pa sems dang / gnod sems dang /
analyzed: gzhi de las srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / rdzub tu smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal ba dang / brnab pa sems dang / gnod sems dang /
translated: From that basis, there is killing, taking what is not given, sexual misconduct, false speech, slander, harsh speech, frivolous speech, covetousness, malice,

original: log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba'o //
translated: and wrong views.

original: 'di ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: These are called evil, unwholesome dharmas.

original: de dag las dben pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i //
analyzed: de dag las dben pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i //
translated: Being separated from them is the first dhyāna.

original: rtog pa dang lhan cig pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa dang lhan cig pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: That which is together with conceptualization is conceptual.

original: rtog pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are those conceptualizations?

original: gang dag bsam gtan dang po dang mthun pa'i rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag bsam gtan dang po dang mthun pa'i rtog pa ste /
translated: They are conceptualizations that accord with the first dhyāna.

original: de cho ga bzhin du rtog cing de dag kun kyang 'dul bas na de dag ni rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de cho ga bzhin du rtog cing de dag kun kyang 'dul bas na de dag ni rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because they conceptualize according to the rules and all of them are disciplined, they are called conceptualizations.

original: shes pa dang khong du chud pa dang dpyod pa @150a * //
analyzed: shes pa dang khong du chud pa dang dpyod pa @150a * //
translated: They are understanding, comprehension, investigation,

original: dang rab tu rtog pa dang ting nge 'dzin du byed pa ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dang rab tu rtog pa dang ting nge 'dzin du byed pa ni rtog pa'o //
translated: and thorough analysis, and they make one attain concentration.

original: de la dpyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dpyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is investigation there?

original: bsam gtan dang po dang mthun pa'i rtog pa de dag nyid la dpyod pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang nye bar longs spyod pa dang kun du longs spyod pa dang ting nge 'dzin du byed pa dang / sems rjes su 'gro ba ni dpyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang mthun pa'i rtog pa de dag nyid la dpyod pa dang rnam par dpyod pa dang nye bar longs spyod pa dang kun du longs spyod pa dang ting nge 'dzin du byed pa dang / sems rjes su 'gro ba ni dpyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The first meditation is associated with investigation and with deliberation.

original: de dag dang lhan cig pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / dpyod pa dang bcas pa bsam gtan dang po'o //
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / dpyod pa dang bcas pa bsam gtan dang po'o //

original: dga' ba dang bde ba dben pa las skyes pas de'i phyir dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba zhes bya'o //🔽rdzogs par byas te gnas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba dben pa las skyes pas de'i phyir dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba zhes bya'o // rdzogs par byas te gnas zhes bya ba la /

original: rdzogs par byas zhes bya ba ni sngom pa dang sngom par byed pa dang / sbed pa dang sbed par byed pa dang / ro myang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba ste /
analyzed: rdzogs par byas zhes bya ba ni sngom pa dang sngom par byed pa dang / sbed pa dang sbed par byed pa dang / ro myang ba dang / mngon par dga' ba ste /
translated: It is born of seclusion, born from the separation of body and mind from the five sense pleasures and from the five hindrances.🔽It is

original: bsam gtan dang po de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa khong du chud par bya ba'i 'dun pa dang 'dod pa thob ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa khong du chud par bya ba'i 'dun pa dang 'dod pa thob ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in the first concentration obtains the aspiration and desire to understand the acceptance of non-arising.

original: de mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i 'dun pa dang 'dod pa des bsam gtan dang po snying po 'du shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa'i 'dun pa dang 'dod pa des bsam gtan dang po snying po 'du shes pa ma yin no //
translated: By that aspiration and desire for the acceptance of non-arising, he does not take the essence of the first concentration.

original: de bsam gtan gnyis ba rtsom ste /
analyzed: de bsam gtan gnyis ba rtsom ste /
translated: He undertakes the second concentration.

original: de bsam gtan dang po'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa de dag zhi bar byed nye bar zhi bar byed /
analyzed: de bsam gtan dang po'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa de dag zhi bar byed nye bar zhi bar byed /
translated: He pacifies and completely pacifies the investigation and analysis of the first concentration.

original: de dag las sems rab tu zhi bar byed cing bsam gtan gnyis pa'i yongs su 'grub pa'i rgyu tshol te /
analyzed: de dag las sems rab tu zhi bar byed cing bsam gtan gnyis pa'i yongs su 'grub pa'i rgyu tshol te /
translated: He completely pacifies the mind from those, and seeks the cause for accomplishing the second concentration.

original: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral bas nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral bas nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: Free from investigation and analysis, internally clear,

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa dga' ba dang ldan pa bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa dang / dpyod pa med pa dga' ba dang ldan pa bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: with a one-pointed mind continuum, he abides having accomplished the second concentration, which is free from investigation and analysis, and possesses joy and pleasure.

original: de la nang yongs su dang ba ni de'i bsam gtan gnyis pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang yin pa de dag nye bar zhi ba dang / dang ba yin te /
analyzed: de la nang yongs su dang ba ni de'i bsam gtan gnyis pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos gang yin pa de dag nye bar zhi ba dang / dang ba yin te /
translated: Inner clarity is the pacification of the factors that are incompatible with the second meditative concentration and the clarity that results from that.

original: de'i phyir nang yongs su dang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nang yongs su dang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called inner clarity.

original: rgyud gcig tu gyur zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa de dag thams cad rab tu zhi nas rgya mtsho'i chu ltar ro gcig tu gyur pa thob pa'o //🔽'di lta ste dper na rgya mtsho chen por chu 'bab pa rnams lan tshva'i ror ro gcig par 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs pa bsam gtan dang po'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa de dag thams cad zhi
analyzed: rgyud gcig tu gyur zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang po'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa de dag thams cad rab tu zhi nas rgya mtsho'i chu ltar ro gcig tu gyur pa thob pa'o // 'di lta ste dper na rgya mtsho chen por chu 'bab pa rnams lan tshva'i ror ro gcig par 'gyur ba de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' bsam gtan gnyis pa la snyoms par zhugs pa bsam gtan dang po'i rtog pa dang dpyod pa de dag thams cad zhi
translated: Becoming a single taste means that, having completely pacified the investigation and analysis of the first meditative concentration, one attains a state of single taste, like the water in the ocean.

original: nas ro gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: nas ro gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: For example, just as the waters that flow into the great ocean all have a single taste, the taste of salt, in the same way, when the bodhisattva who is absorbed in the second meditative concentration has completely pacified all the investigation and analysis of the first meditative concentration, he or she attains a state of single taste.

original: de ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called meditative absorption.

original: ting nge 'dzin de las de sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun la dga' ba skyes te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las de sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun la dga' ba skyes te /
translated: From this concentration, he produces joy in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: @150b dkon mchog gsum la dga' bas dge ba'i chos rnams rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @150b dkon mchog gsum la dga' bas dge ba'i chos rnams rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: By this joy in the Three Jewels, all wholesome actions are perfected.🔽From this, he obtains a very strong, very clear, and very pleasant aspiration for the acceptance of dharmas that do not arise.

original: de las mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i 'dun pa shin tu 'bar pa dang / shin tu 'dod gsal ba dang / shin tu yid du 'ong ba 'thob po// de la chos la bzod pa la 'dun pa des bsam gtan gnyis pa de la ma chags te /
analyzed: de las mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i 'dun pa shin tu 'bar pa dang / shin tu 'dod gsal ba dang / shin tu yid du 'ong ba 'thob po// de la chos la bzod pa la 'dun pa des bsam gtan gnyis pa de la ma chags te /
translated: By this aspiration for the acceptance of dharmas, he is not attached to the second concentration,

original: bsam gtan gsum pa kun du tshol lo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa kun du tshol lo //
translated: but seeks the third concentration.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks:🔽Joy is an obscuration to the third concentration.

original: dga' ba ni bsam gtan gsu pa'i sgrib pa yin no snyams nas de dga' ba de la 'dod chag dang bral nas btang snyoms can dran pa yongs su dag pa 'phags pa rnams kyi gang de dga' ba med pa bde ba la gnas pa zhe brjod pa bsam
analyzed: dga' ba ni bsam gtan gsu pa'i sgrib pa yin no snyams nas de dga' ba de la 'dod chag dang bral nas btang snyoms can dran pa yongs su dag pa 'phags pa rnams kyi gang de dga' ba med pa bde ba la gnas pa zhe brjod pa bsam
translated: Thus, being free from desire for that joy, he abides in equanimity, with mindfulness purified, experiencing that pleasure which the noble ones declare to be due to complete equanimity and mindfulness.

original: gtan sum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: gtan sum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: He thus accomplishes and abides in the third concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes ba'i dga' ba la 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob pa de gang de dga' ba med pa'i bde ba de ni gtan du bde ba ma yin gyi zad pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes ba'i dga' ba la 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob pa de gang de dga' ba med pa'i bde ba de ni gtan du bde ba ma yin gyi zad pa'i chos can te /
translated: He obtains the freedom from attachment to the joy born of concentration. He thinks, “That joy is not permanent happiness, but has the nature of exhaustion.

original: de mi rtag cing mi brtan la ther zug ma yin zhing de yid brtan du mi rung ngo snyam pa'i sems de lta bu 'thob po //
analyzed: de mi rtag cing mi brtan la ther zug ma yin zhing de yid brtan du mi rung ngo snyam pa'i sems de lta bu 'thob po //
translated: It is impermanent, unstable, not eternal, and cannot be relied upon.”

original: de de ltar shes nas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob pa'i sems 'dun pa drag po chen po'i 'thob po //
analyzed: de de ltar shes nas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rab tu thob pa'i sems 'dun pa drag po chen po'i 'thob po //
translated: Having understood thus, he obtains the mind that is the great intense aspiration for the acceptance of non-arising dharmas.

original: de mi skye ba'i chos kyi 'dun pa drag po des bde ba dang sdug bsngal la mngon par chags pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: de mi skye ba'i chos kyi 'dun pa drag po des bde ba dang sdug bsngal la mngon par chags pa mi skye'o //
translated: By that intense aspiration for non-arising dharmas, attachment to pleasure and suffering does not arise.

original: de bde ba yang spangs te snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba nub pas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa brtan snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi ba yongs su rdzogs par🔽byas te gnas so //
analyzed: de bde ba yang spangs te snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba nub pas bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa brtan snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi ba yongs su rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: Having abandoned pleasure, and previously having abandoned pain, and with the subsiding of mental happiness and unhappiness, he dwells having attained the fourth concentration, which is neither painful nor pleasant and is endowed with pure equanimity and mindfulness.

original: de bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pas sems mnyen pa dang / sems 'dod par bya ba dang / sems las su rung ba dang / sems 'dod gsal ba dang / sems drang ba dang / sems bde bde sems can thams cad kyi phyir mngon par dga' ba dang /
analyzed: de bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pas sems mnyen pa dang / sems 'dod par bya ba dang / sems las su rung ba dang / sems 'dod gsal ba dang / sems drang ba dang / sems bde bde sems can thams cad kyi phyir mngon par dga' ba dang /
translated: Having entered the fourth concentration, his mind is pliant, his mind is workable, his mind is wieldy, his mind is clear, his mind is composed, his mind is delighted, and his mind is fully engaged in benefiting all sentient beings.

original: de sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar mngon par phyogs par 'gyur pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i snang ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar mngon par phyogs par 'gyur pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob pa'i snang ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: He becomes oriented toward the welfare and happiness of all sentient beings, and the light of acceptance of the nonarising of phenomena arises for him.

original: de'i gong du de la lhun gyis grub par lam la 'jug cing gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gong du de la lhun gyis grub par lam la 'jug cing gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: From then on, he enters and abides in the path spontaneously.

original: rnam pa gzhan yang btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa ni rnam pa bcu drug ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan yang btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi zad pa ni rnam pa bcu drug ste /
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāradvatīputra, the perfection of concentration of the bodhisattvas is imperishable in sixteen ways.

original: de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs kyis thams cad la med do //🔽de la rnam pa bcu drug po @151a * //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos dang rang sangs kyis thams cad la med do // de la rnam pa bcu drug po @151a * //
translated: This is not found in the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas at all.

original: dag gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dag gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are those sixteen ways?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni de la chags pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni de la chags pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ concentration is attached to that in order to perfect the concentration of the tathāgatas.

original: bdag bde ba la ma chags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni ro myang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag bde ba la ma chags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni ro myang ba med pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ concentration is without relishing, since they are not attached to their own happiness.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni snying rje chen po la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni snying rje chen po la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas’ concentration is focused on great compassion in order to eliminate the afflictions of all sentient beings.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni ting nge 'dzin ldog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su dmigs pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni ting nge 'dzin ldog pa'o //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is the reversal of samadhi, because it focuses on the desire realm.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa kun shes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni mngon par shes pa yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa kun shes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni mngon par shes pa yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'o //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is the purification of superknowledge, because it knows the mental activity of all sentient beings.

original: sems kyi dbang phyug shes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni sems las su rung ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang phyug shes pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni sems las su rung ba'o //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is the flexibility of mind, because it knows the mastery of mind.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ldan ba thams cad shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ldan ba thams cad shes pa'o //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is the knowledge of all the concentrations, liberations, samadhis, and attainments associated with the subjugation of the form and formless realms.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi snyoms par 'jug pa zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni zhi ba dang rab tu zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi snyoms par 'jug pa zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni zhi ba dang rab tu zhi ba'o //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is peaceful and tranquil, because it surpasses the concentrations of all the disciples and hermit buddhas.

original: shin tu mthar thug pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni mi 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu mthar thug pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni mi 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is unshakable, because it is well-established.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad legs par 'joms pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni log par bsgrub pa'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad legs par 'joms pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni log par bsgrub pa'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is the antidote to false practice, because it thoroughly destroys all the connections of the afflictions and their instincts.

original: 'jig rten thams cad las bsgral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni shes rab la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad las bsgral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni shes rab la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is the entrance to wisdom, because it liberates the whole world.

original: sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bsgral ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is preceded by the welfare of all sentient beings, because it liberates all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan mi zad pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs mi gcod pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan mi zad pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs mi gcod pa'o //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is the non-interruption of the lineage of the Three Jewels, in order to perfect the imperishable concentration of the Tathagatas.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni ma nyams pa'o //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is unbroken, because they are always in equipoise.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su @151b rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni chos thams cad la dbang byed pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su @151b rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni chos thams cad la dbang byed pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is the knowledge that controls all dharmas, in order to perfect all the dharmas of the Buddha.

original: ye shes kyi bdag nyid che ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni nam mkha' ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi bdag nyid che ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan ni nam mkha' ste /
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is space, because of the greatness of the nature of knowledge.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bcu drug ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam pa bcu drug ste /
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, these are the sixteen aspects of the perfection of concentration of the bodhisattvas,

original: gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la med pa'o //
analyzed: gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag la med pa'o //
translated: which are not found in the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de la bsam gtan yongs su sbyangs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan yongs su sbyangs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the purification of concentration?

original: gang mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is the completion of the superknowledges and of knowledge.

original: de la mngon par shes pa ni gang /
analyzed: de la mngon par shes pa ni gang /
translated: “What is the superknowledge?

original: ye shes ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is knowledge?

original: gang gi gzugs su snang ba thams cad mthong ba 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi gzugs su snang ba thams cad mthong ba 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The seeing of all forms that appear is called the superknowledge.

original: gang gi gzugs thams cad kyi chos nyid mi zad par shes kyang mi zad pa'i chos mngon sum du mi byed pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi gzugs thams cad kyi chos nyid mi zad par shes kyang mi zad pa'i chos mngon sum du mi byed pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the imperishability of the nature of all forms without actualizing the imperishable Dharma is called knowledge.

original: gang gi sgrar grag pa thams cad shes pa de ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi sgrar grag pa thams cad shes pa de ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of all sounds that are heard is called the superknowledge.

original: gang sgra thams cad sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mthar brjod du med par shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sgra thams cad sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mthar brjod du med par shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge that all sounds are inexpressible in the past and the future is called knowledge.

original: gang gis sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rnams shes pa 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa rnams shes pa 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the mental activity of all beings is called the superknowledge.

original: gang sems 'gog par shes la sems 'gog pa mngon sum du mi byed pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sems 'gog par shes la sems 'gog pa mngon sum du mi byed pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the cessation of the mind, but not the realization of the cessation of the mind, is called pristine wisdom.

original: gang sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyir ma'i mtha' rjes su dran pa 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyir ma'i mtha' rjes su dran pa 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The recollection of the past and future limits is called superknowledge.

original: gang dus gsum la ma chags par shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dus gsum la ma chags par shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of non-attachment to the three times is called pristine wisdom.

original: gang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhing du 'gro ba 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhing du 'gro ba 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The going to the buddha-fields is called superknowledge.

original: gang gis zhing nam mkha' dang mtshungs par shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhing nam mkha' dang mtshungs par shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the buddha-fields as like space is called pristine wisdom.

original: gang dbyer med pa'i chos 'dod pa 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang dbyer med pa'i chos 'dod pa 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The desire for the indivisible Dharma is called superknowledge.🔽The knowledge of the vision of the equality of all dharmas is called pristine wisdom.

original: gang chos thams cad mnyam par mthong par mthong ba'i shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o / gang 'jig rten thams cad dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad mnyam par mthong par mthong ba'i shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o / gang 'jig rten thams cad dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the characteristic of the inseparability of all worlds is called superknowledge.

original: gang 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad dang ma 'dres par shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad dang ma 'dres par shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is known as not mixed with any worldly phenomena is called pristine wisdom.

original: gang brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang 'jig rten skyong ba rnams zil gyis gnon pa 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang brgya byin dang tshangs pa dang 'jig rten skyong ba rnams zil gyis gnon pa 'di ni mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which overwhelms Śakra, Brahmā, and the world guardians is called supernormal knowledge.

original: gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyi bor shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi spyi bor shes pa 'di ni ye shes zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is known as the crown of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas is called pristine wisdom.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' @152a * //
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' @152a * //
translated: “Venerable Śāradvatīputra, these are called the bodhisatvas’

original: rnams kyi bsam gtan yongs su sbyang bzhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnams kyi bsam gtan yongs su sbyang bzhes bya'o //
translated: purification of meditation.

original: yang sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang sems g-yeng ba ji snyed par byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi tshogs dang sems gzhag pa'ang de snyed de /
analyzed: yang sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang sems g-yeng ba ji snyed par byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi tshogs dang sems gzhag pa'ang de snyed de /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisatvas’ accumulations of meditation and mental placement are as numerous as the afflictions and mental distractions of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang sems g-yeng ba ji snyed pa de snyed du byang chub sems dpas kyang bsam gtan gyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang sems g-yeng ba ji snyed pa de snyed du byang chub sems dpas kyang bsam gtan gyi tshogs yang dag par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: For as many times as there are afflictions and distractions of all sentient beings, for that many times the bodhisattva must accomplish the requisites of meditative concentration.

original: mnyam pa de nyid de la gnas pas na de'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa de nyid de la gnas pas na de'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he rests in that very sameness, therefore it is called meditative equipoise.

original: sems can mnyam pa nyid dang / bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sbyor ba mnyam pa nyid dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang /
analyzed: sems can mnyam pa nyid dang / bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sbyor ba mnyam pa nyid dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang /
translated: Because he rests in the sameness of sentient beings, the sameness of thoughts, the sameness of higher intention, the sameness of application, the sameness of giving, morality, patience, effort, meditative concentration,

original: shes rab mnyam pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas pas na de'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab mnyam pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid la gnas pas na de'i phyir mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and wisdom, and the sameness of all the qualities of the Buddha, therefore it is called meditative equipoise.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang dang mnyam par byang chub kyang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang dang mnyam par byang chub kyang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Because enlightenment is the same as whatever meditative absorption is,

original: byang chub gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: byang chub gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the equality of enlightenment, that is the equality of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam pa ste /
translated: Whatever is the equality of all sentient beings, that is the equality of all phenomena.

original: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is absorbed in that equality, he is called “absorbed.

original: byang chub gang dang mnyam pa stong pa nyid kyi de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: byang chub gang dang mnyam pa stong pa nyid kyi de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the equality of enlightenment, that is the equality of emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the equality of emptiness, that is the equality of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam ste /
translated: Whatever is the equality of all sentient beings, that is the equality of all phenomena.

original: mnyam ba nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam ba nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is absorbed in that equality, he is called “absorbed.

original: stong pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa mtshan ma med pa yang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gang dang mnyam pa mtshan ma med pa yang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the equality of emptiness, that is the equality of signlessness.

original: mtshan ma med pa gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the sameness of signlessness is the sameness of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad gang dang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gang dang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam ste /
translated: Whatever is the sameness of all sentient beings is the sameness of all phenomena.

original: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is absorbed in that sameness, he is called “absorbed.”

original: mtshan ma med pa gang dang dang mnyam pa smon pa med pa'ang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa gang dang dang mnyam pa smon pa med pa'ang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the sameness of signlessness is the sameness of wishlessness.

original: smon pa med pa gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: smon pa med pa gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the sameness of wishlessness is the sameness of all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the sameness of all sentient beings is the sameness of all phenomena.

original: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is absorbed in that sameness, he is called “absorbed.”

original: smon pa med @152b pa gang dang mnyam pa mngon par 'du mi byed pa'ang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: smon pa med @152b pa gang dang mnyam pa mngon par 'du mi byed pa'ang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the sameness of wishlessness is the sameness of non-conditioning.

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyi de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyi de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the same as non-performance, that is the same for all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam ste /
translated: Whatever is the same for all sentient beings, that is the same for all phenomena.

original: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is absorbed in that sameness, he is called “absorbed.”

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa gang dang mnyam pa mi skye ba yang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa gang dang mnyam pa mi skye ba yang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the same as non-performance, that is the same as non-arising.

original: mi skye ba gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: mi skye ba gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the same as non-arising, that is the same for all sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam ste /
translated: Whatever is the same for all sentient beings, that is the same for all phenomena.

original: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is absorbed in that sameness, he is called “absorbed.”

original: mi skye ba gang dang mnyam pa mi 'byung ba yang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: mi skye ba gang dang mnyam pa mi 'byung ba yang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the same as non-arising, that is the same as non-occurrence.

original: mi 'byung ba gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: mi 'byung ba gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the same as non-arising, all sentient beings are the same as that.🔽Whatever is the same as all sentient beings, all phenomena are the same as that.

original: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam ste mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam ste mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he has entered into that sameness, it is said that he has entered into evenness.

original: mi 'byung ba gang dang mnyam pa dngos po med pa yang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: mi 'byung ba gang dang mnyam pa dngos po med pa yang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the same as non-arising, non-entity is the same as that.

original: dngos po med pa gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa gang dang mnyam pa sems can thams cad kyang de dang mnyam mo //
translated: Whatever is the same as non-entity, all sentient beings are the same as that.

original: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad gang dang mnyam pa chos thams cad kyang de dang mnyam ste /
translated: Whatever is the same as all sentient beings, all phenomena are the same as that.

original: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid de la snyoms par zhugs pas na de'i phyir snyoms par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he has entered into that sameness, it is said that he has entered into evenness.
